title: Analyst II, Data (Data Analyst)
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><em>Position at Oak Street Health<br><br></em><strong>Company: Oak Street Health <br><br></strong><strong>Title: Analyst II, Data (Data Analyst) <br><br></strong><strong>Location: Remote<br><br></strong><strong><u>Role Description<br><br></u></strong>The Data Analyst will be responsible for creating ad hoc analyses and reports that interpret and analyze data trends for all teams at Oak Street Health. This role will handle all data requests and provide data reports to assist in programmatic decisions. The data analyst will also assist in determining future analyses and metrics and the development of meaningful performance indicators. The scope of this role will focus on medical economics and finance related data requests and analysis along with special projects.<br><br><strong><u>Core Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets</li><li>Prepares and disseminates analysis reports, and presentations to various audiences both internal and external</li><li>Collaborates with internal program staff around all evaluation and analysis activities</li><li>Handles all data requests and special analyses for internal and external partners</li><li>Assists in developing actionable metrics to quantify the impact of programming </li><li>Establishes relationships with internal and external partners to obtain and validate quality data</li><li>Assists in creating uniform business rules that will be used in all ad-hoc analyses</li><li>Other duties, as assigned<br></li></ul><strong>What are we looking for?<br><br></strong><strong><u>We’re Looking For a Motivated Data Analyst With<br></u></strong><ul><li>Payer data side experience highly recommended</li><li>Undergraduate degree, preferably in Computer Science, Business or Analytics</li><li>4 or more years of relevant work experience</li><li>Proficient in writing SQL queries and stored procedures on large data sets with complex data models</li><li>Data management experience; knowledgeable in database rules, writing queries, and relational database creation and management (create, query, relate)</li><li>An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving</li><li>Ability to manage deadlines and deliverables and communicate them to business owners</li><li>Ability to communicate clearly to stakeholders</li><li>Business process understanding</li><li>US work authorization</li><li>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br></li></ul><strong>What does being “Oaky” look like?<br></strong><ul><li>Radiating positive energy</li><li>Assuming good intentions</li><li>Creating an unmatched patient experience</li><li>Driving clinical excellence</li><li>Taking ownership and delivering results</li><li>Being relentlessly determined<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Oak Street Health?<br><br></u></strong>Oak Street Health is on a mission to “Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient’s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We’re an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody “Oaky” values and passion for our mission.<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients</li><li>Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options</li><li>Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits</li><li>Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends</li><li>New centers and flexible work environments</li><li>Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.<br><br>Learn more at <u>www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health</u>

We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.<br><br>Learn more at <u>www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health</u>

title: Customer Data Analyst
description: We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Customer Data Analyst to support our customer service team by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting customer data. The successful candidate will play a vital role in optimizing customer service operations and enhancing the overall customer experience. The Customer Service Data Specialist will collaborate with various departments to ensure accurate and timely data collection and analysis, and provide actionable insights to improve customer satisfaction and drive business growth. This is a Direct Hire opportunity located in Chicago, IL.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Collect, compile, and analyze customer data from various sources, such as customer interactions, surveys, and feedback, to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. </li><li>Perform data entry and ensure the accuracy and completeness of customer information in the company's database or CRM system. </li><li>Conduct data quality checks regularly to identify and resolve any discrepancies or errors in customer data. </li><li>Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present key customer service metrics and insights to relevant stakeholders. </li><li>Collaborate with the customer service team to identify data-driven opportunities for improving response times, service quality, and customer satisfaction. </li><li>Monitor customer service performance metrics and provide regular reports and recommendations for process enhancements and efficiency improvements. </li><li>Assist in the design and implementation of customer satisfaction surveys, analyzing survey results, and preparing actionable recommendations based on the findings. </li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as marketing and product development, to share customer insights and contribute to the development of customer-centric strategies. </li><li>Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in customer service and data analysis. </li><li>Ensure compliance with data protection and privacy regulations while handling customer data. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as business administration, data analytics, or a related discipline. </li><li>Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a customer service or customer-centric role. </li><li>Proficient in using data analysis tools and software, such as Microsoft Excel, SQL, or data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). </li><li>Working knowledge of any ERP system is a plus </li><li>Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large sets of data. </li><li>Familiarity with customer service metrics and KPIs, such as response time, first contact resolution, customer satisfaction scores, and net promoter score. </li><li>Excellent attention to detail and a high level of accuracy in data entry and analysis. </li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to identify patterns and trends from complex datasets. </li><li>Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present data and insights in a clear and concise manner. </li><li>Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment. </li><li>Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. </li><li>Knowledge of CRM systems and experience in handling customer data is a plus. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Job Details:<br></strong><ul><li>Direct Hire</li><li>Monday-Friday, first shift</li><li>Pay $55-65k depending on experience <br><br></li></ul>If you are interested and qualified, please apply and submit your resume!<br><br><strong>Benefit offerings include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits, and 401K plan. Our program provides employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. Available paid leave may include Paid Sick Leave, where required by law; any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law; and Holiday pay upon meeting eligibility criteria</strong><strong>.<br><br></strong>Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled<br><br>To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please navigate to https://www.lhh.com/us/en/candidate-privacy<br><br>The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

title: Data Analyst (IT)
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Apex Systems, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Job#: 1359885</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>Project Overview: This contract position will participate in a variety of data and analytics projects with an initial focus on data governance audits.<p><br></p>Data Governance Audit initiative addresses: Use of the Collibra Enterprise Cloud (CEC) tool will help support and sustain better data governance and metadata management processes. WM is required to build out the WM Data Catalog and show progress toward the adoption of the tool.<p><br></p>Global Privacy Audit initiative addresses: Any active application - that has PII data - is to have a control in place to delete or anonymize PII data that is past retention according to the Retention Schedule. Applications can only hold onto records if they were placed on a Legal Hold. Partners need to evidence that the control is working effectively.<p><br></p>Additional data and analytics projects focusing on business growth initiatives as aligned to the candidates data management skills and experience<p><br></p>Contractors Role: For the audits, this role will consult on the identification and definition of Critical Data Elements (CDEs), will engage with business stewards and IT data custodians to collect metadata and data lineage to be loaded into Collibra, and will partner with the Wealth Management Data Quality Control team to monitor CDE data quality. For other data and analytics projects, this role will participate in activities related to defining data requirements, hands on data analysis, data science, and data visualization. Projects will be aligned to the candidate based on their data management skills and experience.<p><br></p>Experience Level:<p><br></p>Level 3- [senior- 8+ years overall experience]<p><br></p>Qualifications (Must Haves):<p><br></p>Experience across a broad spectrum of data governance, data quality, and data analytics projects is a must have.<p><br></p>Experience with Metadata Management, Data Quality Management, and Reference and Data Domain Management<p><br></p>Experience with Collibra or other comparable metadata catalogs (e.g.: Informatica, Infosphere I Talend, Alation)<p><br></p>Experience setting and resolving Naming Conventions, Taxonomies, and Ontologies<p><br></p>Nice to Haves: Prior experience related to:<p><br></p>Creating data quality rules in Collibra OwlDQ or Oracle EDQ<p><br></p>Projects dealing with Information Security, Data Privacy, Document Retention, Individual Rights<p><br></p>Experience as a product owner on Agile data products<p><br></p>Data Analytics &amp; Data Presentation (PowerBI experience is highly desired)<p><br></p>Data analysis with SQL, Python, R, etc<p><br></p>Business analysis experience on data projects<p><br></p>Data Modeling<p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at or .<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico. Data Analyst (IT)

Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong> Job Description: </strong><p><br></p>This Position Is Responsible For Leading The Development Of Functional And Non-Functional Business Requirements.<p><br></p><u><strong>Required Job Qualifications:</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor degree and 2 years of data and analytics experience OR Technical Certification and/or college courses and 4 years of data and analytics experience OR 6 years of data and analytics experience</li><li>Experience in requirements management and/or prototyping</li><li>Knowledge of system architecture</li><li>Knowledge of big data and analytical technologies</li><li>Knowledge of data processing environments</li><li>Knowledge of Agile project management</li><li>Ability to simplify &amp; standardize complex concepts and/or processes</li><li>Business acumen</li><li>SDLC (systems development life cycle) / Iterative / Agile / Scrum development</li><li>Oral &amp; written communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong>Preferred Job Qualifications:</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or Information Technology</li></ul><p><br></p>Data Analyst - Hybrid (Chicago)

title: Data Engineer
description: <p><strong>Job Description</strong></p><p>The Data Engineer will be supporting both JCR's domestic and international eProducts. As JCR acquires more customers, their data is continuing to grow and environment is not sustainable. The Data Engineer will be critical in the advisement on best practices, ways to improve and implement solutions to meet the customer's needs. The data is all external customer data so the Data Engineer will create ease of customer access to the data and ability to extract. Additionally, the Data Engineer will help structure the data for reporting and align best ways for supporting it.</p><p><br></p><p>Summary:</p><p>Seeking an experienced data engineer with deep knowledge of data and analytics technologies, methodologies, architectures, and processes. Expertise in relational data analysis, data design, and ETL methods is required. This candidate will have a proven record of requirements analysis, problem solving, and solution design. In addition, the candidate must demonstrate an ability to collaborate well with team by exhibiting strong collaboration skills, team and customer focus, and an ability to work with senior management.</p><p><br></p><p>Position Accountabilities:</p><p>• Assembling large, complex sets of data that meet non-functional and functional business requirements. Manage and aggregate data for analytic consumption.</p><p><br></p><p>• Identifying, designing, and implementing internal process improvements including re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, optimizing data delivery, and automating manual processes.</p><p><br></p><p>• Building required infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using Microsoft technologies.</p><p><br></p><p>• Building analytical tools to utilize the data pipeline, providing actionable insight into key business performance metrics including operational efficiency and customer acquisition.</p><p><br></p><p>• Working with stakeholders including data, design, product, and executive teams and assisting them with data-related technical issues.</p><p><br></p><p>• Working with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to support their data infrastructure needs while assisting with data-related technical issues.</p><p><br></p><p>• Design, develop and deploy optimal monitoring and testing strategy for the data products.</p><p><br></p><p>• Collaborate with stakeholders and advanced analytics business partners to understand business needs and translate requirements into scalable data engineering solutions.</p><p><br></p><p>• Collaborate with data visualization and reporting application developers to ensure the sustainability of production applications and reports.</p><p><br></p><p>• Collaborate with data architects on the enhancement of enterprise data architecture and platforms.</p><p><br></p><p>• Research, evaluate and recommend emerging data and analytics technologies based on business and operational needs and requirements.</p><p><br></p><p>• Perform routine administration to keep the enterprise data systems, services, and processes secure and healthy.</p><p><br></p><p>Position Requirements:</p><p>Tech Stack:</p><p>• SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, SQL, Azure Synapse - data pipelines, Power BI Datasets.</p><p>• Azure tech stack – storage explorer, blob store, databricks, Azure SQL database/DWH, Azure functions, Azure Devops (automated CI/CD), build and release pipelines and DataOps.</p><p>General:</p><p>• Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related quantitative field of study with 4+ years of data architecture, data analysis, data modeling</p><p>• Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehouse concepts, and data integration best practices.</p><p>• Strong understanding of data quality and validation techniques, including data profiling, data cleansing, and data reconciliation.</p><p>• Extensive hands-on experience in data warehousing design, ETL/ELT, BI process development and applying modern data management frameworks and methodologies.</p><p>• Hands-on experience implementing full-cycle cloud enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects.</p><p>• Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to business needs.</p><p>• Security conscientiousness towards all work performed.</p><p>• Knowledge and experience in Windows and Linux operating system</p><p>• Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, and interpersonal skills. Basic ability to work independently and manage one’s time.</p>

Expertise in relational data analysis, data design, and ETL methods is required. This candidate will have a proven record of requirements analysis, problem solving, and solution design. In addition, the candidate must demonstrate an ability to collaborate well with team by exhibiting strong collaboration skills, team and customer focus, and an ability to work with senior management.</p><p><br></p><p>Position Accountabilities:</p><p>• Assembling large, complex sets of data that meet non-functional and functional business requirements. Manage and aggregate data for analytic consumption.</p><p><br></p><p>• Identifying, designing, and implementing internal process improvements including re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, optimizing data delivery, and automating manual processes.</p><p><br></p><p>• Building required infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using Microsoft technologies.</p><p><br></p><p>• Building analytical tools to utilize the data pipeline, providing actionable insight into key business performance metrics including operational efficiency and customer acquisition.</p><p><br></p><p>• Working with stakeholders including data, design, product, and executive teams and assisting them with data-related technical issues.</p><p><br></p><p>• Working with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to support their data infrastructure needs while assisting with data-related technical issues.</p><p><br></p><p>• Design, develop and deploy optimal monitoring and testing strategy for the data products.</p><p><br></p><p>• Collaborate with stakeholders and advanced analytics business partners to understand business needs and translate requirements into scalable data engineering solutions.</p><p><br></p><p>• Collaborate with data visualization and reporting application developers to ensure the sustainability of production applications and reports.</p><p><br></p><p>• Collaborate with data architects on the enhancement of enterprise data architecture and platforms.</p><p><br></p><p>• Research, evaluate and recommend emerging data and analytics technologies based on business and operational needs and requirements.</p><p><br></p><p>• Perform routine administration to keep the enterprise data systems, services, and processes secure and healthy.</p><p><br></p><p>Position Requirements:</p><p>Tech Stack:</p><p>• SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, SQL, Azure Synapse - data pipelines, Power BI Datasets.</p><p>• Azure tech stack – storage explorer, blob store, databricks, Azure SQL database/DWH, Azure functions, Azure Devops (automated CI/CD), build and release pipelines and DataOps.</p><p>General:</p><p>• Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related quantitative field of study with 4+ years of data architecture, data analysis, data modeling</p><p>• Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehouse concepts, and data integration best practices.</p><p>• Strong understanding of data quality and validation techniques, including data profiling, data cleansing, and data reconciliation.</p><p>• Extensive hands-on experience in data warehousing design, ETL/ELT, BI process development and applying modern data management frameworks and methodologies.</p><p>• Hands-on experience implementing full-cycle cloud enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects.</p><p>• Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to business needs.</p><p>• Security conscientiousness towards all work performed.</p><p>• Knowledge and experience in Windows and Linux operating system</p><p>• Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, and interpersonal skills. Basic ability to work independently and manage one’s time.</p>

title: Associate Business Analyst
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyze moderate business problems to be solved with automated systems.</li><li>Analyze and design business systems.</li><li>Diagnose business needs and develop requirements.</li><li>Create and implement test plans, and provide on-going project support during development phase.</li><li>Perform post-facto comparisons of delivered solutions against original specifications.</li><li>Act as an intermediary between technology and internal clients.</li><li>Implement improvements to existing processes and methodologies.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How You’ll Do It</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Works with client management to identify and specify business requirements and processes for diverse development platforms, computing environments (e.g., host based, distributed systems, client server), software, hardware, technologies and tools. Clearly identifies all known defects are understood and agreed by the business and technology teams prior to implementations.</li><li>Researches and evaluates solutions and recommends the most efficient and cost effective solutions for systems/program design. Develops system specifications and procedures. Delivers technology solutions that support business goals. Provides realistic project/release estimates and meets committed delivery dates. Work with business partners to develop final requirements/user stories by the target dates. Identifies and resolves any gaps and negotiates problematic requirements. Manages and maintains overall project/release tasks and timelines. Communicates status updates and issues with management, the business, and other technology teams.</li><li>Formulates logical statements of business requirements. Devises, tests and implements efficient and cost effective application program solutions (e.g., codes and/or reuses existing codes through the use of program development software alternatives and/or integrates purchased solutions).</li><li>Devises data verification methods and standard system procedures. May be required to participate in system testing.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications You’ll Need</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Basics</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in business administration, information technology or related field</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 2+ years of experience in application, business analysis, business process or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $51,000.00 to $75,000.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Data Engineer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Apex Systems, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Job#: 1359987</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>Do you want to be part of a dynamic, collaborative team supporting business partners with data solutions? We are looking for an individual to provide data visualization solutions that enable actionable business insights. We provide data solutions that support our broader global team as they work to achieve targets. Responsibilities include managing data visualization projects, ad hoc report creation, and other tasks as assigned.<p><br></p>This role will support the Data Analytics team's mission to provide dashboards and reporting solutions that allow our internal business partners to identify insights and build initiatives. This person will provide focused support for the Sales Execution teams globally.<p><br></p>This person will have the support of 5 coworkers with similar skills that focus on different internal customers. We have in-person team meetings 2-3 times per year to enable team-building and support collaboration.<p><br></p>Team Culture<p><br></p><ul><li>Our team places a high value on collaboration and is not internally competitive. We share knowledge freely and lean on each other's expertise to support projects. We prize personal connections and emphasize maintaining a healthy work/life balance.</li><li>This team exists to provide descriptive analytics solutions to our division.</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Duties:<p><br></p><ul><li>Use Tableau and Power BI to create solutions</li><li>Use Alteryx to combine data to support new dashboards</li><li>Manage multiple projects for customers simultaneously</li><li>Clearly communicate and document project progress, roadblocks, and anticipated timelines</li><li>Seek information about the real, underlying needs of their customers, beyond those expressed initially, and match those needs to available (or customized) products or services</li><li>This role will be responsible for managing tasks with varying timelines, including requesting support as needed. This may include getting clarity of requests from customers or guidance on data sources from teammates.</li></ul><p><br></p>Interaction with team:<p><br></p><ul><li>Weekly 1:1 meetings with manager, and we have a weekly team meeting and code review. Our Team Lead is available for support as needed. We have in-person team meetings 2-3 times per year. Department and division meetings are held regularly.</li></ul><p><br></p>Work environment:<p><br></p><ul><li>Hybrid - must be onsite minimum one day per week or more as business needs dictate - in Downtown Chicago or Peoria, IL</li><li>Infrequent travel required (less than 10% of working time).</li></ul><p><br></p>Candidate Requirements<p><br></p>Education &amp; Experience Required:<p><br></p><ul><li>A combination of education and work experience (including internships) will be accepted so long as proficiency in technical skills can be demonstrated.</li><li>Minimum required: Associates degree plus 4 years' experience OR Bachelor's degree plus 2 years' experience OR Master's degree plus 2 internships</li></ul><p><br></p>Technical Skills<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 1 year experience using each of the following tools:</li></ul><p><br></p>oTableau<p><br></p>oPower BI<p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 2 years' experience in SQL</li><li>Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision</li><li>Must be able to present finding to senior leadership</li></ul><p><br></p>(Desired)<p><br></p><ul><li>One year experience with:</li></ul><p><br></p>oAlteryx<p><br></p>oPython<p><br></p>oHTML<p><br></p>Soft Skills<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent verbal and written English communication skills</li><li>Excellent time management skills</li><li>Confidence to request support as needed</li><li>A strong customer focus and awareness of company products and product applications</li><li>A proven track record of building cross-functional relationships with diversified departments</li></ul><p><br></p>Candidates must already reside in state of IL<p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at or .<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico. Data Engineer

Data Engineer

title: Data Engineers
description: <strong>Title </strong><p><br></p>Data Engineers<p><br></p><strong>Overview</strong><p><br></p>Daugherty Business Solutions is looking for Data Engineers of <strong>all levels </strong>with varying modern technology stack experience, who can adapt to new client environments and learn new technologies quickly.<p><br></p>We are looking for full-stack developers, but also consultants with deep expertise in specific modern technologies. We always want people to apply what they know, but if you don’t know a particular technology of interest, we provide vast opportunities to learn new capabilities.<p><br></p>Daugherty will work with our employees to support preferred work locations, whether from home / remote, hybrid, in-office, or some other combination that still works with our clients’ expectations.<p><br></p>We prefer our consultants to be located in the Eastern, Central, or Mountain timezones within the United States.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As a Data Engineer on Team Daugherty, you will have the opportunity to:<p><br></p><ul><li> Contribute to the creation and maintenance of optimal data pipeline architectures. </li><li> Collaborate and work closely with team to build data platforms. </li><li> Maintain and manage distributed computing clusters in development and production environments. </li><li> Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements. </li><li> Work with team members and functional leads to understand existing data requirements and validation rules to support moving existing data warehouse workloads into a distributed data platform. </li><li> Create custom software components (e.g., specialized UDFs) and analytics applications. </li><li> Employ a variety of languages and tools to marry systems together. </li><li> Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality. </li><li> Implement &amp; automate high-performance algorithms, prototypes and predictive models. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><ul><li> Preferred: College degree or equivalent in technology-related field (computer science, engineering, information technology, etc.). </li><li> Practical education or experience in a technology related field – could include bootcamps and focused educational programs. </li><li> Project experience in delivering technology solutions in a team-based environment, ideally Agile development. </li><li> Interest working with cloud platform technologies such as:</li><ul><li> AWS – Redshift, RDS, S3, EMR, ADP, Hive, Kinesis, SNS/SQS and QuickSight. </li><li> Azure – Synapse, Data Factory, Data Lake, Databricks, Power Platform </li><li> GCP – Big Query, Vertex, Dataflow, GKE, Anthos, Dataproc, Firebase </li></ul><li> Interest in distributed computing including Kubernetes, DockerSwarm, and Hadoop. </li><li> Familiarity with high performance data libraries including Spark, NumPy and TensorFlow. </li><li> Familiarity with the data science process including feature extraction and productionalizing data science models. </li><li> Ability to work with large data structures and optimize code to process them. </li><li> Proven ability to pick up new languages and technologies quickly. </li><li> Intermediate level of SQL programming and query performance tuning techniques for data integration and consumption using design for optimum performance against large data assets within an OLTP, OLAP and MPP architecture. </li><li> Knowledge of cloud and distributed systems principles, including load balancing, networks, scaling, and in-memory versus disk. </li><li> Experience building data pipelines to connect analytics stacks, client data visualization tools and external data sources. </li><li> Exposure to stream-processing and messaging, such as Spark-Streaming, Kafka, MQ, Redis, and their cloud-based analogs. </li><li> Understanding of DevOps and CI/CD toolset, such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, Buildbot, Drone and Bamboo. </li><li> Proven experience with programming Languages, such as Scala, Java, R and Python. </li></ul><p><br></p>Compensation Range<p><br></p>Negotiable<p><br></p><strong>About Daugherty Business Solutions</strong><p><br></p>Daugherty Business Solutions brings a fresh approach to consulting by rolling up our sleeves and working with our clients—collaborating to solve some of their most pressing business challenges. We deliver results. This is why many of the most well-known companies in the world trust us with their mission-critical projects and why working at Daugherty is for the smart, the talented, and the curious.<p><br></p>Life at Daugherty isn’t like your typical consulting job. Every team member plays an integral role in our company’s success, and we treat you that way, starting with our culture.<p><br></p>In our Dev Center, specifically, we like to say that we have the culture of a startup with the security of a 35+ year old company. By that, it's a casual, relaxed agile shop focused on helping you create your best work. (And - A casual dress code is just one part of that success.) The other side... Our consultants work in the cities they live, and you don’t have to worry about your job ending when an engagement is complete.<p><br></p>What We Commit to YOU<p><br></p><ul><li> We provide a multitude of training opportunities, from Hackathons, Lunch and Learns, free access to Pluralsight and Safari Library. </li><li> You will get to work with some of the most innovative teams in the IT marketplace and solve real strategic problems. </li><li> We will invest in things that are important to you both professionally and personally. </li><li> We will provide you with a team environment like no other – and we prove that, as we consistently rank as a Top Workplace in many of our locations as voted by our own employees. </li><li> We will build a relationship with you to accelerate your Career. </li><li> We provide some of the best benefits around. </li></ul><p><br></p>We offer members of Team Daugherty<p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance. </li><li> Revenue sharing and a 401(k) retirement savings. </li><li> Life, disability, and long-term care insurance. </li><li> No travel / remote work. </li><li> Robust career development and extensive training. </li></ul><p><br></p>Daugherty Business Solutions is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<p><br></p>Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working remotely. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.<p><br></p>If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please inform any recruiter you are working with (or send an email to careers@daugherty.com) and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The recruiting team will respond to your email promptly.

data science process including feature extraction and productionalizing data science models. </li><li> Ability to work with large data structures and optimize code to process them. </li><li> Proven ability to pick up new languages and technologies quickly. </li><li> Intermediate level of SQL programming and query performance tuning techniques for data integration and consumption using design for optimum performance against large data assets within an OLTP, OLAP and MPP architecture. </li><li> Knowledge of cloud and distributed systems principles, including load balancing, networks, scaling, and in-memory versus disk. </li><li> Experience building data pipelines to connect analytics stacks, client data visualization tools and external data sources. </li><li> Exposure to stream-processing and messaging, such as Spark-Streaming, Kafka, MQ, Redis, and their cloud-based analogs. </li><li> Understanding of DevOps and CI/CD toolset, such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, Buildbot, Drone and Bamboo. </li><li> Proven experience with programming Languages, such as Scala, Java, R and Python. </li></ul><p><br></p>Compensation Range<p><br></p>Negotiable<p><br></p><strong>About Daugherty Business Solutions</strong><p><br></p>Daugherty Business Solutions brings a fresh approach to consulting by rolling up our sleeves and working with our clients—collaborating to solve some of their most pressing business challenges. We deliver results. This is why many of the most well-known companies in the world trust us with their mission-critical projects and why working at Daugherty is for the smart, the talented, and the curious.<p><br></p>Life at Daugherty isn’t like your typical consulting job. Every team member plays an integral role in our company’s success, and we treat you that way, starting with our culture.<p><br></p>In our Dev Center, specifically, we like to say that we have the culture of a startup with the security of a 35+ year old company. By that, it's a casual, relaxed agile shop focused on helping you create your best work. (And - A casual dress code is just one part of that success.) The other side... Our consultants work in the cities they live, and you don’t have to worry about your job ending when an engagement is complete.<p><br></p>What We Commit to YOU<p><br></p><ul><li> We provide a multitude of training opportunities, from Hackathons, Lunch and Learns, free access to Pluralsight and Safari Library. </li><li> You will get to work with some of the most innovative teams in the IT marketplace and solve real strategic problems. </li><li> We will invest in things that are important to you both professionally and personally. </li><li> We will provide you with a team environment like no other – and we prove that, as we consistently rank as a Top Workplace in many of our locations as voted by our own employees. </li><li> We will build a relationship with you to accelerate your Career. </li><li> We provide some of the best benefits around. </li></ul><p><br></p>We offer members of Team Daugherty<p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance. </li><li> Revenue sharing and a 401(k) retirement savings. </li><li> Life, disability, and long-term care insurance. </li><li> No travel / remote work. </li><li> Robust career development and extensive training. </li></ul><p><br></p>Daugherty Business Solutions is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<p><br></p>Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working remotely. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.<p><br></p>If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please inform any recruiter you are working with (or send an email to careers@daugherty.com) and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The recruiting team will respond to your email promptly.

title: Junior Business Analyst - Remote
description: <strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Kforce has a client that is seeking a remote Junior Business Analyst to execute Customer Business Integrations for customers agreeing to work with standard integrations. Enabling Data Access to customers and 3rd Party Software Companies to meet specific business needs via File transfers and other related IT Function solutions available to existing customers. The Junior Business Analyst will review requirements, identify any potential gaps and/or missing requirements, and update project status daily. Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Review project assigned for potential gaps and/or missing requirements necessary to fulfill the business request</li><li> Manages their Dashboard daily and update accordingly</li><li> Deactivating integrations in all systems when needed</li><li> Notify appropriate teams internally as needed based on specific project needs</li><li> Documents project extracts, company, and contact records</li><li> Maintain and protect customer relationships with excellent customer service</li><li> Document completed projects in application and distribute material to customers, internal departments, sales training, update applications/systems required</li><li> Provide support for implementation</li><li> Development and user test customer business integrations credentials, formats, data flow for production and successful delivery to the end user</li><li> Deliver completed customer integrations meeting all procedures &amp; process flows</li><li> Obtaining Signatures on Legal Documents, Distribution of Documents and Storing in a designated repository</li><li> Obtaining Customers approval/sign off</li><li> Customer Transfers, Communication and Attend all meetings for transfers and emergency transfers</li><li> New Customer Rollouts as the IT Resource for National Chains Corporate and Franchise</li><li> Train New Analysts on Standard Integrations and Support Tickets Troubleshooting/resolution</li><li> Document New Procedures and Processes for Standard Integrations</li><li> Create Jira Stories for Development Support</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 5+ years of experience as an IT Business Integration Analyst or IT Business Analyst role</li><li> Prior experience in gathering detailed business requirements, interpreting Customer business needs, and translating needs into operational business requirements</li><li> Prior experience in a customer service or customer facing role</li><li> Integration Procedure and Process Documentation experience</li><li> Excellent decision-making capabilities</li><li> Excellent organization, and team collaboration skills</li><li> Excellent Excel Advanced Preferred</li><li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li> Excellent facilitation, collaboration, negotiation, and presentation skills</li><li> Strong knowledge and general understanding of IT/Technical Concepts</li><li> Strong knowledge of various file types such as EDI ANSI X12, XML, cXML, Flat Files, etc.</li><li> Strong knowledge of Data warehouse, IBM, Sterling Integrator, EDI Translation Tools, CoreFtp/FileZilla</li><li> Strong knowledge of Communication Methods AS2, SFTP, FTP and Van</li><li> Comfort with ambiguity, frequent change, or unpredictability</li><li> Travel: 10% Minimal travel required</li><li> Prior experience in eCommerce/eBusiness environment (Such as EDI, B2B eCommerce, Supply Chain, other electronic integrations) preferred</li><li> Experience in the Food Industry/Distribution is a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.<p><br></p>We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability &amp; ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.<p><br></p>Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.<p><br></p>This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.<p><br></p>Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.<p><br></p>Salary: $40 - $45 per hour

title: React Developer
description: <p><strong>React Developer</strong></p> <p>Chicago – Onsite</p> <p><strong><em>This opportunity is onsite and requires you to be local to the Chicagoland area.</em></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>About The Role:</strong></p> <p>We are looking for a talented mid-level <strong>React Developer </strong>who will work with our UI/UX development team, business stakeholders, and designers to build interfaces for our leading-edge web-based products. This position reports to the Head of UI/UX Design and the role will work at our Chicago downtown office. </p> <p><strong>What You'll Do:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work with designers to implement pixel-perfect UI designs and produce functionality as described by product managers.</li> <li>Help to troubleshoot, test, and maintain the quality and security of web applications.</li> <li>Produce meaningful unit tests for functionality to ensure backwards compatibility.</li> <li>Leverage React's efficiency with re-painting in order to develop highly performant applications that handle heavy data flows.</li><br></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>What We're Looking For:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, business, engineering, or related field or equivalent work experience</li> <li>2+ years of building web apps experience.</li> <li>Local candidate</li> <li>Demonstrated ability in developing in JavaScript with React, Material UI, Node.js, Typescript and ES6 or equivalent experience.</li> <li>Knowledge of development methodologies, software design patterns, integration standards, and versioning.</li> <li>Experience working in an Agile environment.</li> <li>Additional technical skills in C#, Python and SQL a plus.</li> <li>Knowledge of the financial markets a plus</li> <li>Strong work ethic</li> <li>Communication with end users, assessing requirements and managing expectations professionally.</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-pressured technology environment.</li> <li>Independent project and time management.</li> <li>Professional, motivated attitude.</li> <li>Strong interpersonal skills.</li><br></ul> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p> </p> <p><strong>OOJ – 1318</strong></p>

title: Purchasing Specialist I
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>An entry level buyer with some data cleansing experience would be a perfect fit for this role. This individuals will be pulling data from different systems to prepare for an SAP migration. Someone that can assist in cleaning data for the integration and migration. MS Office suite is a requirement. SAP is highly desired.<br><br>The Purchasing Analyst is an experienced-level role responsible for purchase orders, inventory control, vendor relationship, payables and customer service, including efficient processing of Purchase Orders, effective coordination of inbound shipping, and product availability for production to meet customer and company needs.

title: JAVA SQL developer
description: <p><strong>Title:</strong> Java Developer</p><p><strong>Location</strong>: Chicago IL (Hybrid)</p><p><br></p><p>***Please know this<strong> is a hybrid role: 3 days per week in the office/2 days per week remote near the Mag Mile. </strong></p><p><strong><span class="ql-cursor"> </span></strong></p><p>Position will be digging into the details and moving forward with new initiatives in the area of the national database</p><p><br></p><p>Looking for 4-5+ years database design, development and analysis along with Java application development experience</p><p><br></p><p>This position will maintain, support, and enhance the abilities of the National Cancer Database (NCDB) to share information in an accurate and flexible manner with its constituent clinicians and cancer programs. In addition, it will also work closely with NCDB and Commission on Cancer (CoC) staff in order to automate, convert and expand existing data warehouse applications into more robust platforms, allowing easier management of data and a more flexible back-end. This includes software programs used to process the data into the database, and ongoing maintenance, support and optimization of these programs and their databases. Provide database support to NCDB development team and make recommendations to enhance the NCDB database architecture.</p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Primary Responsibilities:</u></strong></p><ul><li>Develop, implement, and support existing and additional data warehouse tools to enhance data collection and information dissemination within a network of 1500 CoC-accredited hospitals nation-wide.</li><li>Support, update and contribute to ongoing data warehouse processing efforts, including annual updates of the Analytic Data Warehouse (ADW), backend data processing, rules engine support, Datamart development and support of external vendor development.</li><li>Develop meaningful, easy-to-understand, web-based reports and comparison tools. Implement tools created from the Analytic Data Warehouse.</li><li>Provide troubleshooting and debugging support when issues arise with software.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Requirements:</u></strong></p><ul><li><strong>Java application development experience required. (mix of Core, Front End, and Back End is preferred but not required) - any version is okay</strong></li><li><strong>4+ years' Experience with database design, development, and analysis (<u>Must have experience with at least one of the following: Oracle, PL/SQL, or SQL Server - version doesn't matter</u>) required. </strong></li><li><strong>Experience in performing problem resolution and root cause analysis along with recommending and implementing preventive techniques required.</strong></li><li>Minimum 5+ years of Java application development experience on J2EE preferably with an emphasis on developing and utilizing web services of Java Application Servers (JBoss, JRun, Oracle AS, JMS, Drools) - no specific versions are required</li><li>Firm understanding of relational database structure and processes. </li></ul><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>Regards</p><p>Manoj TK</p><p>Manoj.TK@MATRIXRes.com</p>

Implement tools created from the Analytic Data Warehouse.</li><li>Provide troubleshooting and debugging support when issues arise with software.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Requirements:</u></strong></p><ul><li><strong>Java application development experience required. (mix of Core, Front End, and Back End is preferred but not required) - any version is okay</strong></li><li><strong>4+ years' Experience with database design, development, and analysis (<u>Must have experience with at least one of the following: Oracle, PL/SQL, or SQL Server - version doesn't matter</u>) required. </strong></li><li><strong>Experience in performing problem resolution and root cause analysis along with recommending and implementing preventive techniques required.</strong></li><li>Minimum 5+ years of Java application development experience on J2EE preferably with an emphasis on developing and utilizing web services of Java Application Servers (JBoss, JRun, Oracle AS, JMS, Drools) - no specific versions are required</li><li>Firm understanding of relational database structure and processes. </li></ul><p><br></p><p><br></p><p>Regards</p><p>Manoj TK</p><p>Manoj.TK@MATRIXRes.com</p>

title: Cloud Support Engineer
description: This role is an opportunity for a hands-on engineer with a passion for Linux and cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products.<p><br></p>If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.<p><br></p><strong>The role of a Cloud Support Engineer at Canonical </strong><p><br></p>We regularly solve interesting, technical problems. From triaging complex Cloud environment issues, Linux kernel crashes we've never seen before to OS configuration issues and root cause analysis, we provide an expert level of support and satisfaction to our peer groups and customers.<p><br></p>We are rapidly expanding and are looking for talented problem solvers with a passion for working on the next generation of Ubuntu solutions for our customers.<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> This is a globally remote role, unless specified otherwise.<p><br></p><strong>What Your Day Will Look Like</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Investigate issues reported by customers by researching and escalating issues </li><li>Work to resolve complex customer problems related to Canonical's portfolio of products. </li><li>Ownership of results: Ensure that each support case owned by you is handled according to our Service Level Agreement (SLA) with the highest possible customer satisfaction by setting the right expectations and fulfilling your commitments. </li><li>Engage directly with customers and work collaboratively by phone, ticketing system, and remote sessions to resolve their issues. </li><li>Participate in a regular weekend working rotation. </li><li>Contribute new knowledge base articles and maintain existing articles, ensuring shared knowledge and lessons learned are available to customers. </li><li>Understanding Ubuntu development process to be able to set customer expectations correctly on timeline for a fix. </li></ul><p><br></p>Background check required<p><br></p><strong>What Are We Looking For In You</strong>   <ul><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. </li><li>Hands-on experience supporting Linux systems including 2 or more of:</li><ul><li>Virtualization / Cloud - primarily using KVM or OpenStack. </li><li>Containers - especially with Docker, LXD/LXC, or Kubernetes. </li><li>Storage technologies - block, object and network. </li><li>Networking (bonding, firewalling, bridging, switching, network file system tuning, MTU issues, etc.)</li></ul><li>Linux integration with other environments (authentication/directory services, network file systems, etc.)</li><li>Cloud computing (provisioning, monitoring, orchestration, etc.)</li><li>Troubleshooting experience:</li><ul><li>Basic reading of stack traces to be able to search for duplicates, escalate to the correct team. </li><li>Understand OS and Application level bugs and advise on next steps</li><li>Programming fundamentals in any language. </li></ul><li>Customer support experience:</li><ul><li>Customer needs are top priority</li><li>Communicate clearly and set the right expectations. </li></ul><li>Ability to travel</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer You</strong><p><br></p>Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.<p><br></p>In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.<p><br></p><ul><li>Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!</li><li>Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual holiday leave</li><li>Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Assistance Programme</li><li>Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'</li><li>Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Canonical</strong><p><br></p>Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.<p><br></p>Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.<p><br></p><strong>Canonical is an equal opportunity employer</strong><p><br></p>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<p><br></p>
description_json: This role is an opportunity for a hands-on engineer with a passion for Linux and cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products.<p><br></p>If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.<p><br></p><strong>The role of a Cloud Support Engineer at Canonical </strong><p><br></p>We regularly solve interesting, technical problems. From triaging complex Cloud environment issues, Linux kernel crashes we've never seen before to OS configuration issues and root cause analysis, we provide an expert level of support and satisfaction to our peer groups and customers.<p><br></p>We are rapidly expanding and are looking for talented problem solvers with a passion for working on the next generation of Ubuntu solutions for our customers.<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> This is a globally remote role, unless specified otherwise.<p><br></p><strong>What Your Day Will Look Like</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Investigate issues reported by customers by researching and escalating issues </li><li>Work to resolve complex customer problems related to Canonical's portfolio of products. </li><li>Ownership of results: Ensure that each support case owned by you is handled according to our Service Level Agreement (SLA) with the highest possible customer satisfaction by setting the right expectations and fulfilling your commitments. </li><li>Engage directly with customers and work collaboratively by phone, ticketing system, and remote sessions to resolve their issues. </li><li>Participate in a regular weekend working rotation. </li><li>Contribute new knowledge base articles and maintain existing articles, ensuring shared knowledge and lessons learned are available to customers. </li><li>Understanding Ubuntu development process to be able to set customer expectations correctly on timeline for a fix. </li></ul><p><br></p>Background check required<p><br></p><strong>What Are We Looking For In You</strong>   <ul><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. </li><li>Hands-on experience supporting Linux systems including 2 or more of:</li><ul><li>Virtualization / Cloud - primarily using KVM or OpenStack. </li><li>Containers - especially with Docker, LXD/LXC, or Kubernetes. </li><li>Storage technologies - block, object and network. </li><li>Networking (bonding, firewalling, bridging, switching, network file system tuning, MTU issues, etc.)</li></ul><li>Linux integration with other environments (authentication/directory services, network file systems, etc.)</li><li>Cloud computing (provisioning, monitoring, orchestration, etc.)</li><li>Troubleshooting experience:</li><ul><li>Basic reading of stack traces to be able to search for duplicates, escalate to the correct team. </li><li>Understand OS and Application level bugs and advise on next steps</li><li>Programming fundamentals in any language. </li></ul><li>Customer support experience:</li><ul><li>Customer needs are top priority</li><li>Communicate clearly and set the right expectations. </li></ul><li>Ability to travel</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer You</strong><p><br></p>Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.<p><br></p>In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.<p><br></p><ul><li>Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!</li><li>Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual holiday leave</li><li>Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Assistance Programme</li><li>Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'</li><li>Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Canonical</strong><p><br></p>Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.<p><br></p>Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.<p><br></p><strong>Canonical is an equal opportunity employer</strong><p><br></p>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<p><br></p>

title: Software and Data Integration Developer - M
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Next Step Systems, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>Software and Data Integration Developer, Chicago, IL<p><br></p>This Software and Data Integration Developer position is a key part of the tech team, which ensures the seamless operation of the firm’s software and data platforms and assists key stakeholders with the development of scalable business processes and automated solutions. The Systems Integration team has the primary responsibility of developing webhook endpoints and workflows to ingest data and documents from external partners, as well as developing code solutions for document manipulation and internal integrations between web platforms. The ideal candidate will have an aptitude and interest in developing and supporting performant, scalable, and automated technology solutions. The Software and Data Integration Developer will write Python code for things like document ingestion/manipulation and more complex programming tasks. <strong>This is a Hybrid position in Chicago. Candidates are required to come into the office 3 days per week.</strong><p><br></p>Software and Data Integration Developer Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Become an expert on the technical aspects of a variety of platforms utilized by the firm - how the technology works, what issues can occur, how to troubleshoot problems.</li><li> Respond to internal stakeholder inquiries in a timely manner and utilize skills and knowledge of applications to answer questions and solve technical problems.</li><li> Work directly with internal users to resolve business problems. This may involve being an information resource, extracting data from cloud platforms to answer specific questions or address a specific issue, or implementing enhancements and new workflows into the existing application infrastructure.</li><li> Manipulate data tables in Excel; upload spreadsheets to cloud platforms to trigger bulk actions or database updates.</li><li> Actively assist in maintaining and administering the firm’s cloud-based services.</li><li> Contribute to software documentation, knowledgebase articles, and other support materials; communicate change to appropriate staff both within the tech team and in other parts of the firm.</li><li> Programming tasks to customize solutions in platforms that enable custom scripting, such as Tray.io and AWS Lambda.</li><li> Develop custom scripted solutions to solve ad-hoc business problems, such as: move data/documents via API, bulk manipulate documents (trim pages from a PDF, add a watermark, rename files, mail merge).</li><li> Manage testing scripts and run manual testing to reproduce reported issues; identify root cause of problems, then develop and implement a solution.</li></ul><p><br></p>Software and Data Integration Developer Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree preferred.</li><li> 2-3 years of application support experience preferred.</li><li> Need Microservices experience.</li><li> Experience with Zapier, Tray.io, or another integration-as-a-service platform preferred.</li><li> Experience with web automation tools such as Selenium or UI.Vision preferred.</li><li> Python programming experience, including manipulating PDF documents.</li><li> Software integration experience, ideally accessing medical data using Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR).</li><li> Must be able to read, write and speak fluent English.</li><li> Strong computer proficiency; adept at learning new software.</li><li> Strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills.</li><li> Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables and xlookup.</li><li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical language.</li><li> Excellent people-skills (outgoing, approachable, motivated to help), including the ability to train end users.</li><li> Ability to work independently or as part of a team.</li><li> Ability to conduct research into computing issues and software functionality.</li><li> Keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.</li><li> Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly.</li><li> Ability to collaborate across functional teams.</li><li> Proficiency with programming concepts and APIs.</li></ul><p><br></p>Keywords: Chicago IL Jobs, Software and Data Integration Developer, Python Programming, Zapier, Tray.io, UI.Vision, Selenium, FHIR, Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, Excel, Pivot Tables, xlookup, APIs, Automation Tools, .pdf Documents, Webhook Endpoint, Workflows, Microservices, Programming, Programmer Analyst, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Chicago Recruiters, Information Technology Jobs, IT Jobs, Chicago Recruiting<p><br></p>Looking to hire a Software and Data Integration Developer in Chicago, IL or in other cities? Our IT recruiting agencies and staffing companies can help.<p><br></p>We help companies that are looking to hire Software and Data Integration Developers for jobs in Chicago, Illinois and in other cities too. Please contact our IT recruiting agencies and IT staffing companies today!<p><br></p>Software and Data Integration Developer - M
