title: Engineer - IT Data Center Systems
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?<br><br>We believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. United's Digital Technology team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with cutting-edge technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. Our team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.<br><br><strong><u>Key Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Responsible for the 24 x 7 operation of Critically Important Data Centers and other Critical Facilities. Duties including data center operations, technical troubleshooting, and repairs. Data Center implementation, installation, testing, evaluation, and support of various IT hardware and infrastructure components. Onsite assistance to IT Engineering and Support teams to complete changes to their IT hardware and systems. Provide onsite data center escort and oversight to IT employees and support vendors. Ensure data center high availability and uptime to meet enterprise objectives through monitoring, timely service restoration, and tuning. Provide support and logistics for data center incidents and changes. Maintain accurate asset records and follow effective asset life cycle management methods.<br><br>Data Center Critical Operations<br><ul><li>Provide 24x7x365 onsite and on-call operational support to assure continuous uptime of Data Centers and critical infrastructure supporting IT platforms, hardware, and applications</li><li>Perform data center system checks, fix and repairs systems to assist UA operations and engineering teams with problems, changes, incidents, and system failures</li><li>Navigate and supervise systems for power and cooling including Power IQ and RF Code</li><li>Configure management IP, subnet mask, and default gateway on IT hardware to allow remote network access to engineering teams</li><li>Assist engineering with configuration or access problems</li><li>Provide data center access, escort and support to Network, Storage and Platform teams as needed</li><li>Coordinate and collaborate with vendor and other business units (e.g. application groups, DBAs, middleware, etc.) to configure platforms for product installation</li><li>Monitor, manage, diagnose, and tune platforms to ensure expected availability and performance levels are achieved</li><li>Assist in root cause analysis to recover from service interruptions, and to prevent recurring problems</li><li>Coordinate and perform asset management, purchasing, receiving, shipping, asset tagging and reporting</li><li>IT hardware repairs on network, security, server, storage, and other devices</li><li>Coordinate and schedule data center change and perform Customer Self Repair (CSR) and other hardware repairs as needed</li><li>Follow and complete Returned Material Authorization (RMA) process for defective components<br></li></ul>Data Center Projects<br><ul><li>Installation and decommissioning of all data center IT hardware and supporting infrastructure in Data Centers and other critical facilities</li><li>Infrastructure work includes power, cooling, under-floor raceways, data cabinets, hardware racking, network and SAN cabling, and associated peripherals</li><li>Coordinate and implement changes to platforms and systems with internal and external IT partners to bring hardware and application online</li><li>Provide project status, tracking and reporting<br></li></ul>Data Center Facilities support<br><ul><li>Work closely with the Facilities team to provide continuous electrical, mechanical, and cooling operations of the facility</li><li>Perform daily systems checks and report irregularities to facilities team</li><li>Provide relief coverage and assistance to the critical facilities team</li><li>Work directly with facilities to run power installations on the floor</li><li>Respond to emergency situations that may impact the data center operation and coordinate with critical facilities personnel to perform corrective repairs<br></li></ul>Data Center Technologies and Standards<br><ul><li>Assure minimal impact to the business by following data center standards and procedures</li><li>Research, evaluate, and stay aware of industry trends and emerging technologies for enterprise use to drive down cost of ownership while maintaining reliable operations and present findings to management<br></li></ul>United values diverse experiences, perspectives, and we encourage everyone who meets the minimum qualifications to apply. While having the “desired” qualifications make for a stronger candidate, we encourage applicants who may not feel they check ALL of those boxes! We are always looking for individuals who will bring something new to the table!<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>What’s needed to succeed (Minimum Qualifications):<br><ul><li>Bachelor's degree (Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Data Center Engineering, Telecommunications) or equivalent experience</li><li>A minimum of 3 years of data center infrastructure experience, or related equivalent IT or Telecommunications experience, is required</li><li>1 year of data center electrical or mechanical experience is required</li><li>A comprehensive demonstrable understanding of enterprise data center procedures</li><li>Must be familiar with network, security, server, and storage platforms and topologies</li><li>Perform initial configuration of systems as defined by our standard operating procedures (BIOS configuration, PXE OS installs, DNS updates etc.)</li><li>Hands-on experience with PXE boot, HPE iLO implementation and support</li><li>Knowledge and ability to Install data center infrastructure components including data cabinets, power, cabling, hardware and other supporting infrastructure</li><li>Experienced in industry standards (NEC, DCIM, EIA, ANSI/TIA-942-A, ANSI/BICSI 002-20XX) is required</li><li>Installation, termination, and certification of data cabling (CAT5-CAT7) and fiber (SM, MM, MPO) in accordance with industry standard data center protocols (ANSI/TIA/BICSI)</li><li>Experience using network test equipment for electrical and optical transport methods (CAT-6, Coaxial, Multi-Conductor, Single Mode and Multi-Mode Fiber, MPLS Circuits, DS-1/3s, OC-3/OC-192, GIG-E, Fast Ethernet, POTS lines)</li><li>Experience working with three-phase electrical systems (120/208 VAC, 277/480 VAC, 240/415 VAC), and (48V, 24V DC) power systems, Grounding Principals, and OHMs Law</li><li>Able to work on lifts and ladders</li><li>Lift and install hardware up to 75 pounds</li><li>Work on ladders up to 10’ and lifts up to 20</li><li>Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship<br></li></ul>What will help you propel from the pack (Preferred Qualifications):<br><ul><li>Industry certifications in Data Center Operations, hardware maintenance, or low voltage cabling</li><li>Uptime Institute data center certifications</li><li>BICSI RCDD, Installer, or Technician Certification</li><li>Cisco CCT, CCNA, CCNP – Data Centers</li><li>CNet Certified Data Center Technician</li><li>IDCA Technology, Operations, or Design Certification</li><li>IT Hardware Technician certifications from manufactures or professional organizations</li><li>5 years of data center infrastructure experience or related IT Telecommunications experience</li><li>2 years of electrical or mechanical experience within a Data Center</li><li>Experience in the installation and termination of a wide variety of cable types (CAT-6, Multi-conductor, Single Mode and Multi-Mode fiber)</li><li>Network security, server, or storage operations or engineering experience is a strong benefit</li><li>Project management experience</li><li>Technical writing skills<br></li></ul>United Airlines is an equal opportunity employer. United Airlines recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical ability, age, veteran status and other protected status as required by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions. Please contact JobAccommodations@united.com to request accommodation.<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT <strong>WHQ00022384</strong>

title: Site Reliability Engineer I
description: <strong>Who You Are</strong><p><br></p>Interested in enabling highly reliable operation of a variety of applications by applying best practice monitoring and proactive improvements?<p><br></p>You will work to ensure best practices are applied throughout the engineering teams while also enabling developer velocity and application stability. You love to learn new things and find it interesting to work with multiple teams. Vail's telephony platform is growing and as it does elegant solutions are needed to address both new features and provide stability to existing products.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Do:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enable developer velocity through build tooling and CI/CD maintenance and development. </li><li>Debug production issues and provide effective solutions. </li><li>Explore and prototype new solutions to difficult problems. </li><li>Design, code, troubleshoot, and debug. </li><li>Facilitate effective monitoring across multiple products. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications - We encourage you to apply if you think your experience may be a match, even if you do not meet all of the qualifications.</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or a related field, or equivalent experience. </li><li>2-4+ years of experience in industry (development, operations, etc.). </li><li>Proficiency with at least one of Python, C++, Perl, Rust, or Go. </li><li>Proficiency with Unix shell scripting (bash). </li><li>Strong problem solving ability and willingness to learn what is needed to solve the issue at hand. </li><li>Strong familiarity with Linux. </li><li>Experience with Git. </li><li>Experience with a CI solution (Gitlab CI, Jenkins, Circle CI, etc.). </li><li>Experience with Kubernetes and cloud native monitoring solutions. </li><li>Experience with a database (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.). </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>At Vail, we believe in the unique power of voice interactions to create more expressive, more intimate, and more efficient interpersonal interactions. Using Vail technology, we make millions of voice interactions better every day. We process around 10% of all toll-free call traffic in the U.S; 1 in 10 times when someone calls a customer support hotline Vail is routing or interacting with that call.<p><br></p>We are rapidly growing across multiple dimensions, including our customer base, the scope of products we offer, and the size of our team. Now is the right time for a strong candidate to join and grow with us. We have a supportive culture where employees are encouraged to achieve both personal and team goals because we believe growth leads to both business impact and personal fulfillment.<p><br></p>We offer competitive compensation and affordable benefits with flexibility and choice to meet individual and family (including Domestic Partnerships) needs including:<p><br></p><ul><li> Multiple medical, dental, and vision plan options</li><li> Company-paid life insurance, short and long-term disability</li><li> 401(k) savings plan with company match (50% on first 6% of employee contribution)</li><li> 31 days total annual PTO</li><li> Annual Bonus Program</li><li> Paid maternity and paternity leave</li><li> Relocation allowance</li><li> Employee referral bonus</li><li> Gym membership</li><li> Technical and Professional Development stipend</li></ul><p><br></p>We are striving to implement and sustain an inclusive and equitable work environment for all employees by sourcing underrepresented groups and continually empowering those individuals within our organization to further enrich Vail’s communication solutions. We recognize that equitable and unique individuals benefit our teams’ problem-solving, innovation and development efforts.<p><br></p>Our offices are located in Deerfield and Chicago, IL. Interviews and onboarding are conducted in our offices when possible. We observe a hybrid work format that provides employees flexibility to collaborate with team members based on business needs.

We recognize that equitable and unique individuals benefit our teams’ problem-solving, innovation and development efforts.<p><br></p>Our offices are located in Deerfield and Chicago, IL. Interviews and onboarding are conducted in our offices when possible. We observe a hybrid work format that provides employees flexibility to collaborate with team members based on business needs.

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong> DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title: </strong>Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)  <p><br></p><strong>Job Location: </strong>Riverwoods, IL<p><br></p><strong>Job Type: </strong>Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments and influence others to do the same by using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills and contribute to or lead technology communities. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements: </strong>Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Science, or a related field and 3 years in Cloud Engineer; Junior Cloud Engineer or related occupation. Alternately, the employer will accept a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Science and 1 year in Cloud Engineer; Junior Cloud Engineer or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills: </strong>Three (3) years of experience in job offered (with a Bachelor’s degree) or related occupation OR one (1) year of experience in job offered (with a Master’s degree) or related occupation: engineering software by creating new methods and adapting existing libraries within the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) ecosystem; utilizing security controls and standards, applying security engineering to designs and solutions, and addressing vulnerabilities; designing and implementing solutions and engineering principles, patterns, and methodologies; identifying, building, and deploying automation solutions to drive toil and manual requests; identifying and executing test scenarios and creating repeatable testing solutions; developing and troubleshooting ETL and ELT solutions with complex transformations; performing end-to-end design data integration; utilizing SQL for complex joins; developing business data quality rules; identifying data workload patterns, including I/O intensive and high CPU; identifying data security patterns using API gateways, encryption, tokenization, and protection layers; and structuring online and offline data patterns.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges </em><em>between $84,500 to $142,500</em><em>. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between to . Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: FIX Software Engineer
description: <p> </p> <p><strong>FIX Software Engineer</strong></p> <p>Chicago – Onsite</p> <p><strong><em>This opportunity is onsite and requires you to be local to the Chicagoland area.</em></strong></p> <p> </p> <p><strong>About The Role:</strong></p> <p>We're looking for a talented <strong>FIX <strong>Software Engineer </strong></strong>who will contribute to the design and development of our platform. This role will learn, participate in engineering discussions, and contribute to the various components of our cloud, APIs and software. You will be involved and work on FIX protocol related projects that collaborate with the development, DevOps and desk support teams in this full-time exempt position reporting to the FIX Team Lead and operating out of our downtown Chicago office.</p> <p><strong>What You'll Do:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design, develop and support of technology</li> <li>Work with our Clients to translate requirements into solutions within our cloud platform</li> <li>Establish connectivity to multiple exchanges with FIX.</li> <li>Work on API solutions that enable integration with our software</li> <li>Write and code unit tests</li> <li>Work with DevOps, IT and client support teams to troubleshoot issues</li> <li>Provide the development teams and business units with software solutions and ideas</li> <li>Contribute to our client support team's software quality assurance</li> <li>Assist integration efforts for our growing client base</li><br></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>What We're Looking For:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or related field or equivalent work experience</li> <li>3+ years of FIX protocol experience with at least 3+ years of development/coding experience</li> <li>Strong design, coding, organization, and debugging skills.</li> <li>Demonstrable C#, .NET, WPF, JavaScript, R, Python, REST skills</li> <li>Knowledge of financial markets</li> <li>General programming background (scripts, GUIs, WebServices, SQL, source control)</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of networking including working knowledge of TCP socket APIs and network routing issues</li> <li>Strong work ethic</li> <li>Communication with end users, assessing requirements and managing expectations professionally</li> <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative, high pressured technology environment</li> <li>Independent project and time management</li> <li>Professional, motivated attitude</li> <li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><br></ul> <p> </p> <p><strong>OOJ – 1319</strong></p>

title: American Heart Association, Statistical Analyst - Application via WayUp
description: This role is with American Heart Association. WayUp is partnering with American Heart Association to hire top talent.<p><br></p><ul><li>Overview  Now is the time to join us and make a difference. Be a relentless force for a world of longer, healthier lives. Here at the American Heart Association, you matter and so does your career. The American Heart Association has an excellent opportunity for a  Data Science Statistical Analyst  based out of our  National Center   (Home Based is acceptable)  . The Association offers many resources to help you maintain work-life harmonization through your changing needs and life situations. To help you be successful, you will have access to Heart U, our award-winning corporate university, as well as additional training and support, locally. \\#TheAHALife is our company culture, our way of life, reflecting our diversity and inclusion, our focus on work-life harmonization and our Guiding Values. Discover why you will Be Seen. Be Heard. Be Valued™ at the American Heart Association by following us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and at heart.org.  Responsibilities  We are seeking a data science analyst/biostatistician to use data science tools and methodologies to identify and analyze real-world healthcare data for scientific research in precision medicine, with a particular focus on health disparities research. You will work in a highly collaborative environment, closely collaborating with American Heart Association scientists, clinical and research volunteers, and program managers to creatively solve challenges in medical research using state-of-the-art tools and methodologies.</li><li>Develop and execute research projects focused on equity and disparity in clinical outcomes prediction algorithms.</li><li>Analyze real-world patient registry data to address important research questions related to health disparities and equity, using statistical models or advanced models such as artificial Intelligence, deep learning, and machine learning approaches.</li><li>Engage with scientists/grantees and Association scientists and clinical and research volunteers to develop and refine research questions and analysis plans.</li><li>Publish journal papers and present work at scientific meetings.</li><li>Serve as a technical/topical expert, champion, consultant, and liaison to Association stakeholders and external peers.</li><li>Lead cohort meetings/workshops of data science awardees.</li><li>Attend relevant external conferences, and attend/co-lead consultative sessions with volunteer Task Force and other Association volunteers/experts.</li><li>Contribute landscape and topical expertise to the development and execution of comms plan/strategies, including networks to engage, written pieces, workshop planning, and publication strategies.  Want to help get your resume to the top? Take a look at the experience we require:   Qualifications </li><li>Master’s or PhD degree in data science, biostatistics, biomedical informatics, epidemiology, statistics, public health, computer science, applied mathematics, or a related field</li><li>Must have three (3)+ years of R programming language experience</li><li>Must have experience in both statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms</li><li>Must have two (2)+ years of patient clinical data analysis</li><li>Must have experience in writing statistical analysis plans</li><li>Experience working with large-scale, complex data sets in the clinical domain</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders</li><li>Highly effective organizational skills, time management, responsibility, and motivation Preferred Experience:</li><li>Python programming language</li><li>Cardiovascular Data Analysis</li><li>Experience working in a healthcare or research environment  Compensation &amp; Benefits  The American Heart Association invests in its people. Here are the main components of our total rewards package. Visit Rewards &amp; Benefits to see more details.</li><li>  Compensation  – Our goal is to ensure you have a competitive base salary. That’s why we regularly review the market value of jobs and make adjustments, as needed.</li><li>  Performance and Recognition  – You are rewarded for achieving success by merit increases and incentive programs, based on the type of position.</li><li>  Benefits  – We offer a wide array of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance, along with a robust retirement program that includes an employer match and automatic contribution. As a mark of our commitment to employee well-being, we also offer an employee assistance program, employee wellness program and telemedicine, and medical consultation.</li><li>  Professional Development –  You can join one of our many Employee Resource Groups (ERG) or be a mentor/mentee in our professional mentoring program. HeartU is the Association’s national online university, with more than 100,000 resources designed to meet your needs and busy schedule.</li><li>  Work-Life Harmonization –  The Association offers Paid Time Off (PTO) at a minimum of 16 days per year for new employees. The number of days will increase based on seniority level. You will also have a total of 12 paid holidays off each year, which includes several days off at the end of the year.</li><li>  Tuition Assistance  \- We support the career development of all employees. This program provides financial assistance to employees who wish to further their education and career in relation to their current duties and responsibilities, or for potential future positions in the organization. The American Heart Association’s 2024 Goal: Every person deserves the opportunity for a full, healthy life. As champions for health equity, by 2024, the American Heart Association will advance cardiovascular health for all, including identifying and removing barriers to health care access and quality.  At American Heart Association | American Stroke Association, diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity applies to both our workforce and the communities we serve as it relates to heart health and stroke prevention.   This position not a match with your skills?  Click here to see other opportunities. EOE/Protected Veterans/Persons with Disabilities</li></ul>

You will also have a total of 12 paid holidays off each year, which includes several days off at the end of the year.</li><li>  Tuition Assistance  \- We support the career development of all employees. This program provides financial assistance to employees who wish to further their education and career in relation to their current duties and responsibilities, or for potential future positions in the organization. The American Heart Association’s 2024 Goal: Every person deserves the opportunity for a full, healthy life. As champions for health equity, by 2024, the American Heart Association will advance cardiovascular health for all, including identifying and removing barriers to health care access and quality.  At American Heart Association | American Stroke Association, diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity applies to both our workforce and the communities we serve as it relates to heart health and stroke prevention.   This position not a match with your skills?  Click here to see other opportunities. EOE/Protected Veterans/Persons with Disabilities</li></ul>

title: Sharepoint Developer
description: <p>Hi</p><p><br></p><p>Hope you are doing well</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Title:&nbsp;SharePoint Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL</strong></p><p><strong>Duration : Full Time</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Speak the language of business users IT-speak and translate between the two realms</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Excellent coding and unit testing using pre-defined standards / practices in line with expected outcomes desired specific to the project / customer environment.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provide Tier 3 troubleshooting and support for production deployed apps when required.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Define the structure of an application system within the constraints of the requirements, architecture, SDLC and deployment context. Follow the best practices for coding, commenting, and managing code.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Identify feasibility issues while working close with UX experts and provide solutions to the targeted experience goals</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Document the activities and operational procedures</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Work with team members to achieve goals for the project.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lead a team of around 10 – 15 developers.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Team Management, working as a track lead with PM and Scrum Master.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Working closely with onsite team and customer to understand the key expectations on the delivery and ensure the team can meet them.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Qualification:</strong></p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BE/ B Tech/ MCA/M Tech</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At least&nbsp;8 – 11 Years of Developer Experience on Power Apps, Power Automate and&nbsp;SharePoint Online /&nbsp;SharePoint 2016 / 2019 or later versions.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Microsoft Certifications:</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SharePoint related certifications and PL-900 would be an added advantage Certification is not mandatory, and TMTPL can provide training for the same.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Key Skills Required:</strong></p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong Specialty Insurance domain &amp; IT knowledge</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MS PowerApps / Automate developer to deliver automation capabilities using low/no-code solutions and products.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General understanding of Power Platform business value and product capabilities is required.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hands-on experience with Power Apps and Power Automate</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Design, develop, and support solutions within Power Platform using out-of-the box features and capabilities.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developing Canvas and Model-driven Power Apps.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developing all types of flows using Power Automate.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Support new or existing application development using Microsoft Power Platform technologies.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Implement business solutions with Microsoft Power Platform and&nbsp;SharePoint Online</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Development experience in Microsoft 365 technologies including&nbsp;SharePoint Online and the Power Platform (PowerApps, Power Automate, Power BI)</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SharePoint/Power Platform related certification</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experience on JIRA/ Remedy tool</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Iterative / Agile / DevOps/ ITIL practices &amp; tools</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Data Analysis &amp; Data Migration experience</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Execution of Transformation, Integration &amp; Automation Programs/ Projects</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Excellent verbal, written communication skills and Analytical reasoning ability.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Troubleshooting abilities</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ability to learn new emerging technologies.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Bhanuprakash Nadhalla&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Talent Acquisition Specialist</strong></p><p><span>Amiga Informatics Inc.</span></p><p><strong>Direct:&nbsp;</strong><span>+1 (469)&nbsp;293-9790</span></p><p><span>Email: bhanuprakash.n@amigainformatics.com</span></p>

title: Snowflake Cloud Developer
description: <strong>Title: Snowflake Cloud Developer</strong><p><br></p>Northern Trust Asset Management business unit is looking for a candidate with strong expertise into cloud data engineering using any of the following public clouds – Azure, Snowflake and Spark<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Skills Required For The Role</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Expertise in design/development and implementing a fully operational solution on Snowflake Data Warehouse in Snowflake on Azure</li><li>Good understanding of Snowflake Internals and integration of Snowflake with other data processing and reporting technologies</li><li>Azure cloud solution architect to provide technology solution to business problems.</li><li>Experience working with Azure services like – Azure Native SQL, Azure Data Factory, Blob Storage, DynamoDB, LogicApp, etc.</li><li>Experience in maintenance and optimization of snowflake databases</li><li>Experience in ETL tools from design/development and implementing data ingestion and processing pipelines Azure cloud services.</li><li>Design and Develop ETL pipelines in and out of data warehouse using combination of Python and Snowflakes Snow SQL</li><li>Deep understanding of relational as well as NoSQL data stores methods and approaches Star, Vault and Snowflake dimensional modelling</li><li>Experience in designing and deploying virtual warehouse, schema, views, zero-copy clone in Snowflake cloud data warehouse</li><li>Experience working with ADO for work management, code repository and CICD.</li><li>Knowledge of PowerBI with snowflake a plus</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Roles And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interface and communicate with global teams to collaborative work on business deliveries.</li><li>Perform business/data analysis and develop interfaces to ingest and extract data out of Snowflake environment.</li><li>Provide product and design level functional and technical expertise along with best practices.</li><li>Create, test, and implement enterprise-level apps with Snowflake</li><li>Design and implement features for identity and access management and authorization frameworks for better access control</li><li>Implement query optimization, data security features (data masking) and transaction management</li><li>Perform data integration with third-party tools including architecting, designing, coding, and testing phases</li><li>Manage documentation of data models, architecture, and maintenance processes</li><li>Evaluate and solve performance and scalability issues</li><li>Understand and implement the latest delivery approaches based on data architecture</li><li>Coordination with BI experts and analysts for customized data models and integration</li><li>Code updates, new code development, and reverse engineering</li></ul><p><br></p>Additional Information

title: Growth Engineer, Revenue Operations
description: <strong><u>About Telnyx</u></strong><p><br></p>At Telnyx, we’re architecting and amplifying access to global connectivity. We power communications, wireless, networking and storage from our private, global, multi-cloud IP network all the way out to the hyperlocal edge. And we make this edge infrastructure easily available through intuitive APIs housed in one space.<p><br></p>We’re interested in solving real-world problems, modernizing the antiquated and automating the manual. In building solutions that make connectivity simple and accessible, we’re laying the foundation for a future of endless innovation and interconnected technology. Our shared vision is a future where people, devices and applications can seamlessly connect across the globe.<p><br></p><strong>The Role</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for an experienced Growth Engineer with a focus in Revenue Operations to help drive the next phase of growth at Telnyx! Reporting to the Revenue Operations Manager, you’ll be a key partner in taking the GTM organization to the next level - leveraging emerging AI technology to develop and execute on vision and operational processes. You’ll work directly with our Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Support, &amp; Product teams to drive mission-critical, cross-functional projects across the organization. This is a unique opportunity to define an AI-empowered GTM engine at Telnyx &amp; deliver real impact to the organization.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Sales Strategy: Act as the main point of contact and the strategic thought partner for all AI projects impacting our GTM leadership team and help shape our long term Revenue Operations strategy</li><li>Automate: Own developing new and optimizing existing GTM motions and processes for all Revenue Operations initiatives that impact the sales, support, &amp; customer success functions; Work closely with the GTM Systems team to evaluate and deploy process improvements, tools, and infrastructure</li><li>Reporting: Identify areas of opportunity and risk and provide actionable insights to management; Maintain and create net new reporting to help us better understand the performance &amp; ROI of our AI-powered workflows, facilitate productivity, and guide investment</li><li>Integrate: Act as the technical subject matter expert for the use of AI in sales/revenue functions &amp; it’s integrations with the GTM tech-stack</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Are Looking For</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 1 year in Sales Operations/Sales Strategy or Revenue Operations, with a demonstrated history of working cross-functionally and improving sales productivity by providing data-driven insights for strategy planning (especially within the SaaS/CPaaS startup space).</li><li>Excellent project management skills. Self-motivated and extremely resourceful in driving projects forward.</li><li>Experience working with APIs &amp; webhooks, in particular OpenAI or similar.</li><li>Experience working with building Flows &amp; Custom Objects in Salesforce. Administrator/Developer certifications are a plus but not required. </li><li>Intermediate to advanced competence with Domo or BI tool with a passion for metrics and dashboards visualizations. Experience with SQL, Python, Javascript is a plus. </li><li>Analytical thinking - analyze, synthesize, and apply information to solve problems swiftly while weighing all pros and cons and understanding the downstream effects of decisions.</li><li>Ability to partner with different parts of the organization to identify and creatively solve major business problems.</li><li>Hands-on, proven experience implementing and managing software applications and automation tooling in a B2B company.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bring Your Authentic Self to Telnyx</strong><p><br></p>Telnyx is committed to building a team full of diverse perspectives, various backgrounds and different minds. We believe diversity drives innovation. We are committed to building a culture where difference is valued and creating avenues of equity for underserved groups. While we are still a work in progress, we are actively seeking folks who are passionate about building a place of belonging for everyone.<p><br></p>We're looking for people with passion, grit, and integrity. We believe in transparency, proactivity, and mutual respect. We provide the high-grade tools that help you do your best work, and keep up the collaborative habits that help everyone stay in the loop. No matter where you're based or which team you’re on, you’re plugged in, supported, and helping to shape the future of communications.<p><br></p>You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. At Telnyx, we welcome diverse perspectives, rigorous thinkers and assumption challengers. Are you ready to join us?<p><br></p>

title: Ocean Import Coordinator
description: Ocean Import Coordinator Position Overview: The Ocean Import Coordinator is primarily responsible for operationally filing entry documents, tracking and updating the movement of ocean freight, and ensuring compliance with import and export clearance regulations. Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities: <li>Tracking, tracing, and updating the status of shipments on a daily basis. <li>Work collaboratively with the Traffic Department and Accounting to provide top-notch, timely, and efficient service to customers. <li>Monitoring of reports. <li>Accurate and timely billing to customers. <li>Providing customer service via email and telephone correspondence to address customer questions and concerns. <li>Ensure customer needs are consistently met and assist to resolve inquiries <li>Expedite clearance and delivery to exceed customer requirements <li>Work well in a team environment and assist other peers when needed <li>Maintaining good relationships with various vendors such as carriers, truckers, terminals, etc. <li>Process and manage import and/or export shipments <li>Prepare price quotes on the international freight <li>Prepare necessary documents for shipments <li>Develop and maintain relationships with customers as well as vendors specifically steamship lines and customs <li>Research and resolve operational problems <li>Ensure customer needs are consistently met and assist to resolve inquiries <li>Additional duties as assigned Requirements and Qualifications: <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills <li>Excellent listening and analytical skills <li>Ability to prioritize, multitask, organize, and manage time effectively <li>Previous experiences in logistics, cargo management, supply chain, customer service, dispatcher, warehouse, logistics specialist, administrative assistant, data entry, transportation, and logistics analyst are preferred Pay, Benefits and More: <li>Competitive compensation package <li>Full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), Life insurance, tuition assistance, PTO and MORE <li>Growing company with a performance record that continues to climb <li>Opportunity to drive significant changes in Talent Acquisition with an ability to make an impact across the organization <li>Open-door work environment <li>High Performance culture with a focus on a growth mindset where continuous improvement is embraced <li>Opportunities for advancement CJ Logistics America About Statement: CJ Logistics America delivers integrated and multimodal logistics services, connecting every corner of the world via air, sea and land. As a lead logistics partner (LLP), third-party logistics provider (3PL) and supply chain consultant, we help customers leverage supply chain management as a competitive advantage, reducing total system costs, transforming business processes, improving service and facilitating growth and change. With a focus on social responsibility and sustainability through growth with customers and communities, we prioritize the wellbeing of the end consumer, our customers and our employees. CJ Logistics America is responsible for the North America region, specializing in solutions for regulated industries such as food and beverage, consumer-packaged goods, healthcare and medical supplies, and tire and automotive. CJ Logistics America is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We prohibit discrimination and or/harassment of any type, including but not limited to discrimination and or harassment based upon race, religion, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, pregnancy or relation medical conditions, childbirth, breastfeeding, parental status, veteran and/or military statue, disability (physical or mental) medical condition, genetic information or characteristics, political affiliation, domestic violence survivor status, marital status, or other characteristics prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Additionally, CJ Logistics America participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.</li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li>

CJ Logistics America is responsible for the North America region, specializing in solutions for regulated industries such as food and beverage, consumer-packaged goods, healthcare and medical supplies, and tire and automotive. CJ Logistics America is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We prohibit discrimination and or/harassment of any type, including but not limited to discrimination and or harassment based upon race, religion, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, pregnancy or relation medical conditions, childbirth, breastfeeding, parental status, veteran and/or military statue, disability (physical or mental) medical condition, genetic information or characteristics, political affiliation, domestic violence survivor status, marital status, or other characteristics prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Additionally, CJ Logistics America participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.</li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li>

title: Contract Cloud/Systems Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description</strong> LaSalle Network has partnered with a national bank to hire a <strong>Cloud/Systems Engineer </strong>on a contract basis. This position will be responsible for migrating their private cloud data center to Azure.<p><br></p><strong> Cloud/Systems Engineer Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Assist in the migration of current private cloud data center to Azure </li><li> Move core firewalls to Fortinet and recreate VPNs </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Cloud/Systems Engineer Requirements: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Prior experience in migration from VMware environment to Azure environment </li><li> Experience with azure Migrate to move VMs from on-Prem to Cloud </li><li> Experience with Fortinet virtual firewalls in Azure </li><li> Ability to review and convert ASA firewall rules to Fortinet firewall rules </li><li> Fortinet EMS experience for RA-VPN </li><li> Experience with Azure Networking – vNets, routes, etc. </li><li> Experience with Azure site recovery to configure backup/replication </li><li> MS windows servers engineer experience </li><li> CentOS experience </li><li> Experience with Azure storage accounts and management </li><li> Experience with Azure Networking – Network Security Groups and Route Tables </li><li> Ability to be in office three days per week </li></ul><p><br></p>Thank you,<p><br></p>Ian Tapia<p><br></p>Project Manager<p><br></p>LaSalle Network<p><br></p>LaSalle Network has partnered with a national bank to hire a <strong>Cloud/Systems Engineer </strong>on a contract basis. This position will be responsible for migrating their private cloud data center to Azure.<p><br></p><strong> Cloud/Systems Engineer Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Assist in the migration of current private cloud data center to Azure </li><li> Move core firewalls to Fortinet and recreate VPNs </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Cloud/Systems Engineer Requirements: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Prior experience in migration from VMware environment to Azure environment </li><li> Experience with azure Migrate to move VMs from on-Prem to Cloud </li><li> Experience with Fortinet virtual firewalls in Azure </li><li> Ability to review and convert ASA firewall rules to Fortinet firewall rules </li><li> Fortinet EMS experience for RA-VPN </li><li> Experience with Azure Networking – vNets, routes, etc. </li><li> Experience with Azure site recovery to configure backup/replication </li><li> MS windows servers engineer experience </li><li> CentOS experience </li><li> Experience with Azure storage accounts and management </li><li> Experience with Azure Networking – Network Security Groups and Route Tables </li><li> Ability to be in office three days per week </li></ul><p><br></p>Thank you,<p><br></p>Ian Tapia<p><br></p>Project Manager<p><br></p>LaSalle Network<p><br></p><strong>LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v.</strong><p><br></p>LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.<p><br></p>

title: WordPress Developer
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>Our client, a design agency, is in need of a freelance WordPress Developer to assist with the development of a client's website. The website will be a single-page site, with one potential microsite, involving simple case studies. The website will be video-heavy, so a key piece is ensuring that the site will not lag. The WordPress Developer will assist with development through the QA process. The site includes all custom fields, no themes.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years' experience as a WordPress Developer</li><li>Must be comfortable with custom builds, no themes</li><li>QA experience</li><li>Managing videos and SVG animations </li></ul><p><br></p>Innovation starts with people.®<p><br></p>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<p><br></p>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<p><br></p>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<p><br></p>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p>Job Description:<p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong>                   DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong> Riverwoods, IL<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong>                    Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties:</strong> Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) by using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills, and contribute to or lead technology communities. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering (any), or a related field and 36 months of experience in Software Engineer-2 or related occupation<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: Installing and configuring OpenShift and Kubernetes clusters on AWS cloud; administering worker node configurations, including docker configuration, Kubernetes, Cloud Container services, and deployments; provisioning infrastructure in AWS, including nodes, security groups, S3, Elb, volumes, IAM role and policies using Terraform; Utilize GitHub, Jira, and Jfro Artifactory; deploying applications, including Splunk, CLS, IDAP, and Instana using Ansible playbooks with Jenkins (CI/CD); managing and supporting Linux based application servers; migrating and upgrading OpenShift environments with Jenkins; and installing, operating, and recovering Linux operation systems as well as OpenShift Clusters and Nodes using Jenkins. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program.<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay:</strong> <em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016 to $142,500. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

Telecommuting and/or working from home is permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or a related field and 3 years of experience in Senior Systems Engineer; IT Analyst or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position Required Skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: participating in Hadoop data cluster engineering and administration for high availability, replications and disaster recovery solutions; performing Big Data cluster security implementation; and utilizing technologies including Kafka, Storm, Spark, Zookeeper, NiFi, HBase, HDFS, Hive, Yarn, Ranger, Knox, Ambari and Kerberos.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $101,500 - $171,500. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em><em>.</em><p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Systems Engineer
description: We inspire purpose-filled living that brings joy to the modern home. With a team of more than 8,000 associates spanning 130 store and distribution locations across the U.S. and Canada, we achieve together, drive results and innovate to inspire. Drawn together by a shared passion for our customers and a spirit of fun, we deliver high-quality home furnishings that are expertly designed, responsibly sourced and bring beauty and function to people’s homes. From the day we opened our first store in Chicago in 1962 to the digital innovations that engage millions of customers today, our iconic brand is over 60 years in the making—and our story is still unfolding.<p><br></p>We’re here for it. We think you should be too. We’re looking for a driven professional with an inclusive mindset to join our team as a <strong> Systems Engineer </strong><p><br></p>The Systems Engineer will be responsible for building, configuring and deploying critical infrastructure used across the organization. They will be responsible for providing 24x7 operational support along with executing infrastructure related projects. This is a combination of infrastructure administration, engineering, and architecture.<p><br></p>This is a hybrid position based out of our Northbrook, IL office. This role can be worked remotely the majority of the time, and will only require travel to the office for and will only require travel into the office when necessary (likely a couple times a year).<p><br></p><strong> A day in the life as a Systems Engineer… </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Partnering with technical administrators, application developers, and other technical peers to create robust, scalable infrastructure solutions </li><li> Coordinating and executing projects associated with the installation, configuration and deployment of compute, storage, and virtualization technologies </li><li> Providing operational and project status reports </li><li> Contributing and supporting disaster recovery activities and strategy </li><li> Performing patch management activities for critical infrastructure </li><li> Scripting and automating routine tasks </li><li> Participating in annual business audits and providing all related documentation to appropriate team(s) </li><li> Participating in the evaluation of new infrastructure technologies </li><li> Recommending optimizations to the environment which improve delivery and performance for end users and customers </li><li> Establishing standard operating procedures for building and deploying infrastructure </li><li> Resolving incidents and work orders escalated from the Service Desk </li><li> Providing technical training to Service Desk, Operations, and relevant parties </li><li> Serving as after hour, weekend and holiday support, as necessary </li><li> Maintaining and supporting infrastructure at remote locations </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Bring To The Table…</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision </li><li> Strong attention to detail and interpersonal skills </li><li> Ability to write and present information and documentation </li><li> Strong ability to manage multiple issues at once </li><li> Strong working knowledge of server, storage and virtualization technologies within a hybrid-cloud environment </li><li> Ability to Collaborate with technical peers across a highly dispersed work environment </li><li> Communicate effectively and efficiently with all company associates and business units including executive leadership </li><li> Maintain awareness of industry best practices and partner with management to ensure these are applied appropriately </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> We’d love to hear from you if you have… </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field </li><li> 5+ Years Systems Engineering experience in a hybrid-cloud environment </li><li> Hands-on experience with a mix of server, storage, and virtualization technologies </li><li> Working knowledge and hands-on experience integrating with public cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) </li><li> Strong understanding of core system administration concepts (e.g., patch management, OS layout and integrity, security, hardening and service management, backup, restore, monitoring and maintenance) </li><li> Basic scripting capabilities in at least one scripting language for system administration automation on one OS (e.g., PowerShell, VB, WMI or PowerCLI)</li></ul>

title: Azure ADF Engineer
description: <ul><li>Should have 8-10 years of experience in the Data engineering and integration domain and should be able to lead projects end to end</li><li>Prior experience in working with Snowflake, Azure Data Factory, Airflow, Power BI, Azure/AWS tooling for ETL, Data warehousing, &amp; BI Projects.</li><li>Prior experience in executing ETL/ ELT and Data integration projects with-in modern data architecture with big-data Cloud tools</li><li>Minimum 8 years of hands-on work experience with SQL, Python for database modeling and data transformations</li><li>Prior experience in developing the solution with-in DevOps and CICD development setup</li><li>Good to have experience in handling BI projects, with contribution towards project requirements understanding, assisting in wire-frame ideation and helping BI/ Power BI team with data modelling requirements and data validations</li><li>Team management experience (including managing the team on day to day basis and coaching and mentoring them and helping them troubleshoot/find solution whenever required)</li><li>Experience in creating proposal and estimating efforts for execution of the project.</li></ul>

title: Java Developer
description: <em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work very closely with customer, UI architect, offshore and onsite co-developers</li><li>Follow-up with lead developer for pull request approvals and resolve code merge conflicts</li><li>Actively participate in all scrum ceremonies</li><li>Work very closely with offshore developers for technical clarifications</li><li>Contribute to the architecture, design, best practices and coding of web- /mobile solutions based for MRO</li><li>Implement UI component design focused on re-usability/scalability/extensibility/ supportability</li><li>Collaborate with fellow developers, designers and analysts to solve problems.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in working with onshore/offshore teams;</li><li>Experience with using Azure DevOps</li><li>Strong hands on development experience on Angular (ionic framework)</li><li>5+ years of experience developing dynamic, highly interactive user interfaces for the web/mobile;</li><li>Ability to manage and interface with APIs and RESTful web services;</li><li>DevOps experience such as creating configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments;</li><li>Well versed in software architecture patterns;</li><li>Familiar with basic web technologies such as CSS, HTML, etc.</li><li>Experience in writing unit test cases</li><li>Experience in building and integrating component library</li><li>Experience in developing micro services using Java spring boot</li></ul>

title: Sitecore Developer
description: <p>Position: Lead .NET Sitecore Developer</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Minimum 15+ years of experience.</strong></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>***Every candidate we submit after I screen, I need them to send me a right to represent email that I will attach to my submittal to the client***</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><span>*need the candidate based in Chicago as they will be required to come onsite at least 1-2 times per month&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>We are seeking a Lead .NET Developer who is passionate about new technology and creating a seamless, customer-centric eCommerce experience. Our Lead .NET Developer will be responsible for driving improvements and new features of the&nbsp;eCommerce applications from a coding and configuration perspective. Our Lead Developer will have previous experience in .Net or C# technologies. Today, we use Sitecore and Sitecore eCommerce platforms. This role presents an exciting opportunity to learn Sitecore technology. Training and certification in Sitecore will be provided as part of the onboarding experience. Working within a scrum team, you will review objectives, work on code fixes and enhancements, and occasionally assist with the code releases.&nbsp;This role will engage in daily scrum meetings with the US and offshore teams to ensure all communication of objectives is clear and address any blocking issues.</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Our Lead&nbsp;Developer will have excellent communication skills, and be able to document changes, features, and processes, and keep the documentation up-to-date.&nbsp;Regular code reviews will be a part of this role, keeping coding standards, and ensuring compliance with SOX, PCI, GDPR, and any other compliance requirements.&nbsp;The right candidate will have the ability to work with the team on the Continuous Integration process, improving the time-to-live for code, and the efficiency of Continuous Inspection, and testing.</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>This position is responsible for pushing business expectations further by joining a diverse team of collaborative individuals with one thing in mind; bridging the gap to customer empowerment. Regal’s Power Efficiency Solutions business is fortunate to have a hand in igniting this digital transformation as we apply insights from customer behavior, develop skillful content, and implement constant feedback to enhance a frictionless digital customer experience through a high performing team that will drive us into the future. Our Solutions Team is seeking talent that will, not only, strategize and execute researched decisions, but also approach each task with determined interest. You’ll have the opportunity to work with emerging technologies, from various mature customer, product, and ecommerce technologies to more upcoming machine learning and artificial intelligence applications.</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>This role will support our Power Efficiency Solution division’s overall Digital Customer Experience (DCX) product portfolio with focus on Small-Medium customer growth, 80/20 initiatives to maximize growth on the best fit customers and most profitable products and will also be a key player driving implementation and coordination of digital efforts for profitable growth through enhanced digital customer experience.</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>As the Lead .NET Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining websites and applications built on the Sitecore XP Content Management System (CMS) and Sitecore ecommerce system (XC). You will work closely with clients and stakeholders to understand their requirements and use cases, and then translate them into functional website solutions.</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Key responsibilities include:</span></p><ul><li>Building and customizing websites and applications using .NET programming languages (such as C#), Sitecore-specific APIs, and other web development tools.</li><li>Developing and implementing templates, components, layouts, and workflows to enable content creators to easily manage and publish web content.</li><li>Integrating with other systems and tools, such as CRMs, ERPs, marketing automation software, and social media platforms.</li><li>Collaborating with other developers, designers, and content creators to ensure that the website and application meet functional, design, and performance requirements.</li><li>Testing and debugging solutions to ensure high performance, security, and usability.</li><li>Providing technical support and maintenance for websites and applications, including troubleshooting and fixing issues as they arise.</li><li>Staying up-to-date with the latest Sitecore and web development trends, best practices, and technologies.</li></ul><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Specific technical skillsets include:</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Required</span></p><ul><li>Languages:&nbsp;.NET,&nbsp;C#</li></ul><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Preferred</span></p><ul><li>Sitecore CMS Versions:&nbsp;&nbsp;9.x, 10.x Hands-on experience with XC (Experience Commerce optimal)</li><li>Web Technologies:&nbsp;&nbsp;ASP.NET,&nbsp;ASP.NET&nbsp;MVC 5</li><li>Languages:&nbsp;T-SQL, Linq</li><li>Scripting Languages:&nbsp;Ajax, JavaScript, Knockout.js, jQuery, JSON, HTML, XML</li><li>Component Technologies:&nbsp;&nbsp;Web Services, SOAP,&nbsp;ADO.NET, WCF, WEB API, SOAP, REST</li><li>Databases (RDBMS):&nbsp;SQL 2016/2019</li><li>Version Control:&nbsp;GitHub Enterprise</li><li>ORM:&nbsp;Glass Mapper, Entity Framework</li></ul><p><br></p>

Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, or a related field and 3 years of experience in Infrastructure Developer Specialist; Senior Infrastructure Developer; Tech Lead; Technical Lead or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: providing technical direction in design, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD platform components, including Jenkins, GitHub, Nexus, and SonarQube; developing and releasing infrastructure as a code with DevOps methodology for automation; working with Docker and Kubernetes to create highly available and scalable CI/CD solutions; designing and implementing backup and disaster strategies for CI/CD tools; developing self-service utilities to perform CICD tool administrative activities; providing best practices to address any audit and security issues; and designing and configuring automation scripts to monitor CI/CD tool infrastructure resources and its availability.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p>Job Description:<p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong>                   DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong>                     Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)  <p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong>       Riverwoods, IL<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong>                    Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) by using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills and contribute to or lead technology communities. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, or a related field and 3 years of experience in Infrastructure Developer Specialist; Senior Infrastructure Developer; Tech Lead; Technical Lead or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: providing technical direction in design, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD platform components, including Jenkins, GitHub, Nexus, and SonarQube; developing and releasing infrastructure as a code with DevOps methodology for automation; working with Docker and Kubernetes to create highly available and scalable CI/CD solutions; designing and implementing backup and disaster strategies for CI/CD tools; developing self-service utilities to perform CICD tool administrative activities; providing best practices to address any audit and security issues; and designing and configuring automation scripts to monitor CI/CD tool infrastructure resources and its availability.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. title: DevOps Engineer
description: Are you passionate about DevOps and looking for your next challenge?<br><br>As a DevOps Engineer you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies like AWS and Kubernetes to design and implement highly scalable and resilient infrastructure solutions. You'll collaborate closely with development teams to streamline the deployment process, automate testing, and improve overall system performance.<br><br>Trading industry salary plus bonus<br><br>100% paid benefits, Terrific Work/Life Balance<br><br>401K, Continuing Education program, and so much more<br><ul><li> 3+ years of experience in Tech Ops or DevOps</li><li> Linux, Python</li><li> Docker, Kubernetes and AWS a plus<br></li></ul>Mid-Senior Level<br><br>
