title: Databricks Engineer
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Overview:<p><br></p>This role requires extensive familiarity with Windows, Linux servers and frequently involves user support tasks. Expertise with the Windows operating system and server administration to develop and deploy servers, support day-to-day system performance, and prevent data loss and unauthorized access is required. This role encompasses back-end IT support for business-critical and development-related departments and personnel.<p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Administer and support core Microsoft, Linux, VMware technologies and Azure resources</li><li>Install and Configure Windows Servers and Linux Server.</li><li>Develop servers and provide support to individual users to ensure that the system works reliably and quickly.</li><li>Manage server virtualization technologies like VMWare Server/ESX</li><li>Responsible for implementing, monitoring, and maintaining the instances of the on-prem and cloud infrastructure services and the servers.</li><li>Knowledge in Application Insights, service principal in Azure, NSG rule, Azure Key vault </li><li>Provide technical support and guidance to users and other administrators.</li><li>Works closely with other IT departments and vendors to answer technical questions or resolve issues with server performance and access.</li><li>Install and maintain Windows-based programs for end users and help debug applications so that they work with Windows servers.</li><li>Perform System Maintenance activities like review backups, error logs and user-reported errors and identify stable and reliable solutions.</li><li>Monitor performance to reduce interruptions and server crashes. Develop and deploy proactive solutions and setup alerts to ensure system usability across the organization.</li><li>Maintain system security by noticing faults and vulnerabilities within the server’s architecture.</li><li>Provides troubleshooting and support, including on-call rotation, after-hours support</li><li>Other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Windows/Linux administration</li><li>Azure Certification is preferred</li><li>Experience with Azure</li><li>Good knowledge of the Windows servers ( 2012 R2, 2016, 2019)</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to apply these skills to identify and resolve anomalies in system functionality and performance</li><li>Managing server virtualization technologies like VMWare Server/ESX</li><li>Group Policy design, configuration Active Directory/LDAP user and group administration</li><li>Strong communication and documentation skills</li><li>Flexible and able to adapt to a rapidly changing environment and can manage projects of varying length</li><li>Responsible, highly reliable, organized; able to work individually and collaboratively with peers</li><li>Windows system administration: 8+ years</li><li>2 years Azure experience.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Risk &amp; Compliance:</strong><p><br></p>Our CIBC risk culture is based on employees striving to exceed the expectations of ourselves and our leadership’s identification and mitigation of risks in their daily responsibilities, not just in quarterly or annual monitoring/assessments. We all are accountable for managing risk.<p><br></p>As an employee of CIBC the incumbent must conduct themselves (and foster an environment for others) in a manner consistent with our strong risk culture. This includes:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following all aspects of the CIBC Code of Conduct, as well as all applicable CIBC policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>At all times acting in accordance with our Purpose and shared values, to achieve our Bank’s strategic goals</li><li>Understanding and following the qualitative and quantitative components of our Risk Appetite Statements</li><li>Completing all annual Corporate Mandatory Training and Testing modules, as well as any additional business-specific modules, as required and employing the learnings in daily activities and undertakings</li><li>Escalating matters through one of the appropriate channels identified in the CIBC Code of Conduct (i.e., HR, management, Ethics Hotline, Whistleblower, etc.) upon observing activities that may be inconsistent with CIBC’s policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>Speaking up if witnessing behaviors that drive poor or unfair outcomes for clients, team members or other stakeholders</li><li>Escalating matters that can result in adverse market practices and outcomes, thereby negatively impacting CIBC’s reputation as a leading financial institution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-70 W Madison St, 8th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Group Policy, Microsoft Azure Administration, Server Administration, VMware ESXi, VMware Server, Windows System Administration

title: Systems Engineer
description: Top Skills' Details <br><ul><li>Experience upgrading SQL servers (they will be upgrading any servers below SQL 2019) - Not looking for a true SQL DBA - Needs to be more of a Systems Engineer/Admin w/SQL experience</li><li>Experience installing, updating and configuring SQL servers</li><li>Experience with VMware (building new VMs or spinning up VMs and installing SQL)<br><br></li></ul> Description <br><br>Client recently went through a security vulnerability assessment and identified 30 SQL servers that were considered vulnerable. They are looking to bring on a Systems Engineer with a focus in SQL and VMware to upgrade the 30 servers. This candidate will be responsible for installing, updating and configuring SQL servers. They will be configuring new versions to have the same setting as the old servers (just need them upgraded to latest version of SQL with the same current settings).<br><br> Skills <br><br>Windows, VMware, sql, sql server, System administrator, Systems engineering<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>Windows, VMware, SQL, sql server, System administrator, Systems engineering<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: C++ Engineer - Performance
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover </strong><strong><em>is </em></strong><strong>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Golang programing language</li><li>OpenShift/Kubernetes</li><li>Linux administration/scripting skillset</li><li>AWS – RDS</li><li>Git/GitHub, Jenkins CI/CD</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration skills, responsive to service needs and project demands in a fast-changing environment.</li><li>Working in agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Sargent &amp; Lundy is one of the most experienced full-service architect-engineering firms in the world. Founded in 1891, the firm is a global leader in power and energy with expertise in grid modernization, renewable energy, energy storage, nuclear power, and fossil fuels. Sargent &amp; Lundy delivers comprehensive project services—from consulting, design and implementation to construction management, commissioning and operations/maintenance—with an emphasis on quality and safety. The firm serves public and private sector clients in the power and energy, gas distribution, industrial, and government sectors.<br><br><strong> Our Core Values <br><br></strong>Every decision we make is guided by our core values. By upholding these six principles, we support our clients, employees, and community. They are the compass we follow as we continue to grow our business and lead the industry.<br><br><strong>Quality </strong><strong>– </strong>We provide high-quality deliverables and services through an uncompromising focus on peer review, safety, and continuous improvement.<br><br><strong>Accountability </strong><strong>–</strong> Our actions demonstrate the highest levels of professionalism, integrity, and respect.<br><br><strong>Our People </strong><strong>– </strong>We value diverse perspectives, encourage professional growth, and are committed to providing a work community where people thrive. Our work is challenging but rewarding.<br><br><strong>Our Clients</strong><strong> – </strong>We deliver value and exceed our clients’ expectations through outstanding customer service, personal accessibility, and clear communication.<br><br><strong>Innovation </strong><strong>–</strong> Since 1891, we have invested in the people, training, tools, and technology needed to quickly adapt in a constantly changing world.<br><br><strong>Meaningful Impact </strong><strong>– </strong>We make a positive impact in the communities where we work and live.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong><strong> This position allows for a hybrid work schedule with a mix of work spent in office and working remote from home </strong><strong> . <br></strong><ul><li> Assist in the development of geographic information to produce maps or quantify information about the impacts of features related to linear engineering projects </li><li> Create or edit map labels, annotation, symbology, representations, and legends </li><li> Conduct data research and compile spatial data </li><li> Manage online GIS data and help develop strategies for collecting GIS data in the field. </li><li> Evaluate information and data from outside sources and convert data to be used in conjunction with preparing maps </li><li> Incorporate spatial and non-spatial data from a broad range of sources (e.g. Access databases, Excel spreadsheets, or AutoCAD/Microstation drawings) </li><li> Use extensions such as 3D Analyst and Spatial Analyst to perform complex geoprocessing tasks </li><li> Provide quality assurance for geospatial data and maps </li><li> Assist in preparing exhibits and compiling information for proposals, project status reports and schedules </li><li> Maintain intra-office communications to share data, procedures, efficiencies, and problem-solving </li><li> Create, edit, and inventory GIS metadata title: GIS Technician -- Hybrid
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Next Step Systems, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>Systems Integration Developer, Python, Chicago, IL<p><br></p>This Systems Integration Developer position is a key part of the tech team, which ensures the seamless operation of the firm’s software and data platforms and assists key stakeholders with the development of scalable business processes and automated solutions. The Systems Integration team has the primary responsibility of developing webhook endpoints and workflows to ingest data and documents from external partners, as well as developing code solutions for document manipulation and internal integrations between web platforms. The ideal candidate will have an aptitude and interest in developing and supporting performant, scalable, and automated technology solutions. The Systems Integration Developer will write Python code for things like document ingestion/manipulation and more complex programming tasks. <strong>This is a Hybrid position in Chicago. Candidates are required to come into the office 3 days per week.</strong><p><br></p>Systems Integration Developer Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Become an expert on the technical aspects of a variety of platforms utilized by the firm - how the technology works, what issues can occur, how to troubleshoot problems.</li><li> Respond to internal stakeholder inquiries in a timely manner and utilize skills and knowledge of applications to answer questions and solve technical problems.</li><li> Work directly with internal users to resolve business problems. This may involve being an information resource, extracting data from cloud platforms to answer specific questions or address a specific issue, or implementing enhancements and new workflows into the existing application infrastructure.</li><li> Manipulate data tables in Excel; upload spreadsheets to cloud platforms to trigger bulk actions or database updates.</li><li> Actively assist in maintaining and administering the firm’s cloud-based services.</li><li> Contribute to software documentation, knowledgebase articles, and other support materials; communicate change to appropriate staff both within the tech team and in other parts of the firm.</li><li> Programming tasks to customize solutions in platforms that enable custom scripting, such as Tray.io and AWS Lambda.</li><li> Develop custom scripted solutions to solve ad-hoc business problems, such as: move data/documents via API, bulk manipulate documents (trim pages from a PDF, add a watermark, rename files, mail merge).</li><li> Manage testing scripts and run manual testing to reproduce reported issues; identify root cause of problems, then develop and implement a solution.</li></ul><p><br></p>Systems Integration Developer Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree preferred.</li><li> 2-3 years of application support experience preferred.</li><li> Need Microservices experience.</li><li> Experience with Zapier, Tray.io, or another integration-as-a-service platform preferred.</li><li> Experience with web automation tools such as Selenium or UI.Vision preferred.</li><li> Python programming experience, including manipulating PDF documents.</li><li> Software integration experience, ideally accessing medical data using Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR).</li><li> Must be able to read, write and speak fluent English.</li><li> Strong computer proficiency; adept at learning new software.</li><li> Strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills.</li><li> Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables and xlookup.</li><li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical language.</li><li> Excellent people-skills (outgoing, approachable, motivated to help), including the ability to train end users.</li><li> Ability to work independently or as part of a team.</li><li> Ability to conduct research into computing issues and software functionality.</li><li> Keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.</li><li> Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly.</li><li> Ability to collaborate across functional teams.</li><li> Proficiency with programming concepts and APIs.</li></ul><p><br></p>Keywords: Chicago IL Jobs, Systems Integration Developer, Python Programming, Zapier, Tray.io, UI.Vision, Selenium, FHIR, Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, Excel, Pivot Tables, xlookup, APIs, Automation Tools, .pdf Documents, Webhook Endpoint, Workflows, Microservices, Programming, Programmer Analyst, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Chicago Recruiters, Information Technology Jobs, IT Jobs, Chicago Recruiting<p><br></p>Looking to hire a Systems Integration Developer in Chicago, IL or in other cities? Our IT recruiting agencies and staffing companies can help.<p><br></p>We help companies that are looking to hire Systems Integration Developers for jobs in Chicago, Illinois and in other cities too. Please contact our IT recruiting agencies and IT staffing companies today!<p><br></p>Systems Integration Developer, Python - M

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: <u><strong>Your Impact:</strong></u><p><br></p>Rauland Corporation is looking for a talented and passionate Requirements Engineer who wants to make an impact in the medical &amp; educational space. You can help the development teams make a real difference in innovating, designing, and developing cutting-edge products that delight customers that they use as part of their daily operations. This is a highly visible position of influence that is expected to improve customer satisfaction, R &amp; D return on investment, time to market, and scheduling accuracy while increasing skills and joy for you and the teams<p><br></p><u><strong>What You'll Do:</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li> Translate end user requirements into a consumable form for the developers and the test team </li><li> Write clear and well-structured technical product requirements </li><li> Assist product managers in converting roadmap items into user stories as needed </li><li> Collaborate with a cross functional team to draft and secure approval of product requirements, acceptance criteria and review test cases </li><li> Analyze requirements for completeness, correctness, and other requirement development best practices </li><li> Manage the development and traceability of requirements throughout the product lifecycle </li><li> Collaborate with our quality team to maintain requirement documents in the design history file throughout the product lifecycle </li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong> What You Need: </strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of professional experience and education </li><li> 5+ years of working experience as a technical requirements engineer/analyst in a product development company </li><li> Experience developing technical requirements for a product in a regulated industry (medical device, automotive, defense, aerospace, etc.) </li><li> Familiarity with requirements management tools. </li></ul><p><br></p>If you have experience with the below, even better!<p><br></p><ul><li> Enterprise-class software requirements development for on-premises or cloud hosted applications </li><li> Mobile application requirements development </li><li> Embedded systems requirements development </li><li> Jama and / or Azure Devops </li><li> Medical device or healthcare IT industry regulated by FDA </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Why Us?</u></strong><p><br></p>Rauland, a division of AMETEK, is a business unit in the Measurement, Communications and Technologies division of AMETEK. We are a leader in integrated communications technology, designing and manufacturing Nurse Call Systems for the medical industry and school critical communication systems for the education K-12 market.<p><br></p>Website: www.rauland.com<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Salary Minimum: Market<p><br></p>Salary Maximum: Market<p><br></p>Incentive: No<p><br></p>Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.<br><br>AMETEK is committed to making a safer, sustainable, and more productive world a reality. We use differentiated technology solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. We employ 18,500 colleagues, in 30 countries, that are grounded by our core values: Ethics and Integrity, Respect for the Individual, Diversity and Inclusion, Teamwork, and Social Responsibility. AMETEK (NYSE:AME) is a component of the S&amp;P 500. Visit www.ametek.com for more information.<br><br>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call 1 (866) 263-8359.

title: Requirements Engineer
description: <strong>Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?</strong><p><br></p>The Tanzu Learning team at VMware is hiring a Staff Product Designer to work on our Learning Platform product team.<p><br></p><strong><strong>The Product</strong></strong><p><br></p>The Tanzu Learning team is a startup-style team inside of VMware, with the goal of creating modern, engaging learning material to help developers and operators achieve their<u> Jobs to Be Done</u> using Spring, Kubernetes, and Tanzu technologies. We are a cross-discipline team of Product Designers, Product Managers, Software Developers, and Courseware Developers.<p><br></p>The Learning Platform team within Tanzu Learning is responsible for the design &amp; development of a multi-tenant e-learning platform that is home to our 3 Tanzu Learning properties:<p><br></p><ul><li>Spring Academy </li><li>Tanzu Academy</li><li>Kube Academy </li></ul><p><br></p>These Academies introduce the Spring and Kubernetes communities to Tanzu Solutions and ensure customers can succeed with Tanzu.<p><br></p><strong><strong>The Work: </strong></strong><strong>What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?</strong><p><br></p>Your regular activities may be modified to suit your strengths, but you can expect a variety of assignments that are similar to:<p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with the Design Lead to design and build a multi-tenant, e-learning platform to delight users</li><li>Define &amp; execute our UX research program, including: Persona discovery &amp; definition, user recruitment, appropriate methods &amp; tooling, and Learner Experience (LX) research &amp; testing</li><li>Support internal-facing service design efforts—helping shape &amp; deliver value for content creators</li><li>Hands-on, “full Stack” design of our consumer-facing learning platform, from UX research through pixel-perfect UI design</li><li>Work closely with the Design Lead to understand &amp; support our overall product &amp; design strategy and shifting priorities</li><li>Adapt modern best practices like User-Centered Design, Design Thinking, Lean, and Agile, in an ecosystem of diverse teams and working styles</li><li>Proactively solve problems quickly &amp; collaboratively in uncertain environments using a combination of domain knowledge, competitive analysis, instinct, and your skills in research and design</li><li>Independently design, develop, and deliver results, leveraging teammates for expertise as appropriate</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Success in the Role: </strong></strong><strong>What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?</strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Day: </strong></strong>You've had a great first day, met your manager and a couple of your peers who’ve welcomed you to the company and answered any burning questions you have.<p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Week: </strong></strong>You have a good sense of our strategy and our team, as well as the dynamics of the diverse groups with which we collaborate. You’re starting to attend a bunch of meetings to observe. You’re starting to build relationships with your stakeholders.<p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Month:</strong></strong> You’ve gotten a feel for key personas and roles, and you’re deepening your team’s understanding of their wants, needs, and jobs to be done. You’re collaborating closely with the Design Lead to deliver on learning platform feature capabilities. You understand the what &amp; why of current design priorities and the near-term product roadmap.<p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Quarter:</strong> </strong>You understand how value delivery works, who’s involved, and have helped your team spot opportunities to improve this system. You’ve played a key role in the design &amp; delivery of delightful features to Academy learners. You’ve also paired with your manager to create goals aligned to your career and development interests, and understand how your work drives the teams OKRs. You have the support and resources at hand to go on that journey.<p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Year:</strong> </strong>You have helped to establish, support, and refine processes for research &amp; design within Tanzu Learning. You’re continuing to add value to the learning platform product by delivering new features and identifying opportunities to improve existing features. You’ve helped establish healthy feedback loops with internal and external users. You’ve played a key role in making Spring Academy, Tanzu Academy, and Kube Academy a go-to learning resource in the market.<p><br></p><strong>What is leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?</strong><p><br></p>This position works closely with another highly experienced Staff Product Designer who has been working at VMware on multiple different projects/products. The team consists of highly competent designers that work very collaboratively.<p><br></p><strong>Where is the role located?</strong><p><br></p>The role is based in the US with the option of working remotely.<p><br></p><strong>What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?</strong><p><br></p>You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.<p><br></p><ul><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types</li><li>Generous Time Off Programs</li><li>40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community</li><li>Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities</li><li>Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)</li><li>Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes</li></ul><p><br></p>For US based candidates, the annual pay range (OTE for commissioned roles; Salary for other roles) for this position is: $154,000 - $277,000. description_json: <strong>Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?</strong><p><br></p>The Tanzu Learning team at VMware is hiring a Staff Product Designer to work on our Learning Platform product team.<p><br></p><strong><strong>The Product</strong></strong><p><br></p>The Tanzu Learning team is a startup-style team inside of VMware, with the goal of creating modern, engaging learning material to help developers and operators achieve their<u> Jobs to Be Done</u> using Spring, Kubernetes, and Tanzu technologies. We are a cross-discipline team of Product Designers, Product Managers, Software Developers, and Courseware Developers.<p><br></p>The Learning Platform team within Tanzu Learning is responsible for the design &amp; development of a multi-tenant e-learning platform that is home to our 3 Tanzu Learning properties:<p><br></p><ul><li>Spring Academy </li><li>Tanzu Academy</li><li>Kube Academy </li></ul><p><br></p>These Academies introduce the Spring and Kubernetes communities to Tanzu Solutions and ensure customers can succeed with Tanzu.<p><br></p><strong><strong>The Work: </strong></strong><strong>What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?</strong><p><br></p>Your regular activities may be modified to suit your strengths, but you can expect a variety of assignments that are similar to:<p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with the Design Lead to design and build a multi-tenant, e-learning platform to delight users</li><li>Define &amp; execute our UX research program, including: Persona discovery &amp; definition, user recruitment, appropriate methods &amp; tooling, and Learner Experience (LX) research &amp; testing</li><li>Support internal-facing service design efforts—helping shape &amp; deliver value for content creators</li><li>Hands-on, “full Stack” design of our consumer-facing learning platform, from UX research through pixel-perfect UI design</li><li>Work closely with the Design Lead to understand &amp; support our overall product &amp; design strategy and shifting priorities</li><li>Adapt modern best practices like User-Centered Design, Design Thinking, Lean, and Agile, in an ecosystem of diverse teams and working styles</li><li>Proactively solve problems quickly &amp; collaboratively in uncertain environments using a combination of domain knowledge, competitive analysis, instinct, and your skills in research and design</li><li>Independently design, develop, and deliver results, leveraging teammates for expertise as appropriate</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Success in the Role: </strong></strong><strong>What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?</strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Day: </strong></strong>You've had a great first day, met your manager and a couple of your peers who’ve welcomed you to the company and answered any burning questions you have.<p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Week: </strong></strong>You have a good sense of our strategy and our team, as well as the dynamics of the diverse groups with which we collaborate. You’re starting to attend a bunch of meetings to observe. You’re starting to build relationships with your stakeholders.<p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Month:</strong></strong> You’ve gotten a feel for key personas and roles, and you’re deepening your team’s understanding of their wants, needs, and jobs to be done. You’re collaborating closely with the Design Lead to deliver on learning platform feature capabilities. You understand the what &amp; why of current design priorities and the near-term product roadmap.<p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Quarter:</strong> </strong>You understand how value delivery works, who’s involved, and have helped your team spot opportunities to improve this system. You’ve played a key role in the design &amp; delivery of delightful features to Academy learners. You’ve also paired with your manager to create goals aligned to your career and development interests, and understand how your work drives the teams OKRs. You have the support and resources at hand to go on that journey.<p><br></p><strong><strong>1st Year:</strong> </strong>You have helped to establish, support, and refine processes for research &amp; design within Tanzu Learning. You’re continuing to add value to the learning platform product by delivering new features and identifying opportunities to improve existing features. You’ve helped establish healthy feedback loops with internal and external users. You’ve played a key role in making Spring Academy, Tanzu Academy, and Kube Academy a go-to learning resource in the market.<p><br></p><strong>What is leadership like for this role? title: DevOps Engineer
description: <p><strong><em>What Customer Contract Administration contributes to Cardinal Health </em></strong></p><p></p><p>Customer Contract Administration is responsible for responding to RFIs and RFPs and coordinating administration of customer contract terms and conditions across multiple areas to maximize contract value.</p><p></p><p><strong><em>What is expected of you and others at this level</em></strong></p><ul><li>Applies working knowledge in the application of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks</li><li>Works on projects of moderate scope and complexity</li><li>Identifies possible solutions to a variety of technical problems and takes actions to resolve</li><li>Applies judgment within defined parameters</li><li>Receives general guidance may receive more detailed instruction on new projects</li><li>Work reviewed for sound reasoning and accuracy</li></ul><p></p><p><strong><em>Responsibilities</em></strong></p><p></p><p><span>• Review and understand contract terms and conditions to ensure contractual obligations are met</span></p><p><span>• Work with varying levels of internal and external customers</span></p><p><span>• Ensures alignment with local strategies and initiatives</span></p><p><span>• Administer multiple Federal Government contracts </span></p><p><span>• Serves as a liaison for Government contracting officers to ensure all contract requirements are met for various Federal Med and Pharm contracts </span></p><p><span>• Run audits to ensure the business remains compliant on contractual requirements </span></p><p><span>• Attention to detail and organization skills are key to success in this role</span></p><p></p><p><strong><em>Qualifications</em></strong></p><ul><li><p>Bachelors degree preferred</p></li><li><p>Advanced degree preferred</p></li><li><p>8-10 years experience in related field preferred</p></li></ul><p></p><p><span><span>•</span></span><em>Anticipated salary range: $63,648 - $91,105</em></p><p><span><span>•</span></span><em>Bonus eligible: No</em></p><p><span><span>•</span></span><em>Benefits: Health insurance, 401k Contributions, Paid Time Off, Vacation, STD/LTD</em></p><p><span></span></p><p><em>Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.</em></p><br><br><p><em>Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.</em></p>

title: Java Developer - Remote | WFH
description: Harris Associates is committed to bringing together individuals whose diverse backgrounds, opinions and perspectives maximize our expertise in finding value and delivering an excellent client experience.<br><br><strong>The Position<br><br></strong>This role is within the Operations Technology team. Our mission is to empower our investment professionals to achieve greater success by leveraging Technology &amp; Data to enhance all facets of our decision-making.<br><br>We seek creative software engineers with strong analytical &amp; collaborative skills to join our team of highly qualified technology professionals to work towards our shared vision of unlocking the alpha in technology. Intellectual curiosity with a keen interest in investing &amp; asset management are essential for a rewarding career and long-term success at the firm.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Work with the team to design, develop &amp; support software, and vendor integrations on our systems.</li><li>Collaborate with the team on software development lifecycle to develop, test &amp; deploy applications</li><li>Develop business expertise in supported areas, related technology, data domains and vendor platforms.</li><li>Partner with stakeholders on efforts to modernize and transform our platforms to leverage cloud-native solutions to democratize technology &amp; data across the enterprise.</li><li>As part of support escalations, triage &amp; solve production incidents and participate in support activities for critical issues during business hours and when necessary, weeknights or weekends.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br><br></strong><u>Required<br></u><ul><li>At least 5 years’ work experience in the asset management industry with specific knowledge of Investment Accounting and Order Management</li><li>Expertise with the .NET framework, C#, SQL Server, database, and application design &amp; development</li><li>Experience building applications and integrations using Azure platforms &amp; services</li><li>Experience with API design, messaging / event-driven architecture &amp; modern test frameworks</li><li>Strong collaborative, communication, and problem-solving skills</li><li>4-year degree in a STEM discipline or equivalent professional experience<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with Eagle and Charles River Investment Systems</li><li>Expertise in development and orchestration of Azure data pipelines</li><li>Familiarity with trade life cycle, security data management, and other middle office processes<br><br></li></ul><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Statement<br><br></strong>Harris Associates L.P. pursues a policy of equal opportunity in all areas of employment including recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, benefits, advancement, and treatment on the job. This means that Harris does not discriminate against employees, or qualified applicants, based on an individual's race, color, religion, creed, sex, age, national origin, physical disability, sexual orientation, trans-gender status, transsexual status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, genetic information or for any other reason prohibited by law. Harris reserves the right to review publicly available information about applicants (i.e., via social networking sites), to the extent permissible under applicable law.<br><br><strong>Reasonable Accommodation Notice<br><br></strong>We provide reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, you may use the alternative email address below to contact us about your interest in employment at HR@harrisassoc.com or you can call us at 312-646-3600.<br><br><strong>Privacy Statement<br><br></strong>The information you send to us is used for employment purposes only. What you send is kept confidential—we will not give your personal information to outside parties without your consent.

title: Java Developer - Remote | WFH
description: <ul><li>Company with sports and technology at its core - with mobile and web apps|Fullstack opportunity using C#, ASP.NET, React with small team of 6 developers<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client was founded over 20 years ago in the Spectator Sports industry, gearing their platform to serve a wide array of youth sports organizations across the US. They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports teams in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M onboarded users. Their main challenge now is merging their technology to integrate with a company they acquired, while continuing to maintain operation of their platforms with minimal downtime. These are high impact projects that enrich the experiences of youth athletes, and simplify<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The Selected Software Developer will:<br><ul><li>Use React Native for all mobile development projects.</li><li>Remain up to date with development breakthroughs and follows best practices.</li><li>Use, rework, and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps.</li><li>Create and test software prototypes when needed.</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in a Fullstack capacity.</li><li>Perform complete testing of web applications-unit and end-to-end automated testing, engaging users as necessary.</li><li>Develop SQL database-driven web interfaces.</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences with rich functionality.</li><li>Take charge of story development without needing micromanagement.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The Successful Software Developer has:<br><ul><li>4+ years of Fullstack experience.</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Boot camp certificate (with at least 2 additional years of experience).</li><li>Strong proficiency with React Native.</li><li>Exposure or experience working in C#/.NET is highly preferred but not required.</li><li>Experience using SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience.</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs.</li><li>Strong attention to detail, always looking to create robust solutions that minimize excess redundancies.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.</li><li>Clear documentation.</li><li>A desire to have an impact on the world with the software being developed.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br><br></strong>What's on Offer for the Selected Software Developer?<br><ul><li>Base salary very open for the right candidate, in the range of 120k-140k depending on experience.</li><li>Affordable comprehensive healthcare plans, with more than 80% of out of pocket costs covered.</li><li>401k with 4% company match, no waiting period for matched contributions.</li><li>Unlimited Paid Time Off program, with no expectations, thresholds, or strings attached.</li><li>Person first model, i.e. you're a person before you're a developer allowing flexibility for when life just happens.</li><li>Hybrid in the office in Northbrook up to twice a week, can make exceptions as needed.</li><li>Dynamic culture, tech minded individuals looking to make a difference with their coding.</li><li>Mentorship, management, and leadership opportunities within.</li><li>Onboarding program to make the transition period run smoothly.</li><li>Optional outings to visit Chicago Sports teams, games, press events, networking events.<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Emily Bodett<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-072023-6116804</strong>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security

title: Software Engineer - Investment Ops Technology
description: <strong>Job#: 1355545</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Role: Property Systems Technical Engineer </strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: REMOTE </strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: 6 month + contract </strong><p><br></p><strong>Client: Large Hotel Client </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>If you are interested, please email your resume to Matt at [email protected] **</li><li> The Property Systems Technical Engineer assume responsibility in either support or project engineering roles.</li><li> In both the roles the Property Systems Technical Engineer will communicate with various teams to deliver the required tasks towards Property Systems implementation and operation. Those include incident management tasks and ITIL best practices for Property Systems Technical Engineers allocated to support and project specific tasks and runbook implementation for those allocated to the project team.</li><li> They acquire knowledge from all available channels and share with colleagues in order to improve the knowledge level of the Property Systems team.</li><li> They are self-driven, motivated and quick-learners in Property System and automation field.</li></ul><p><br></p>TEAM AND OFFICE STRUCTURE:<p><br></p><ul><li> They work remotely and will be available for possible onsite visits up to 4 times a year.</li><li> Report to the managers of support or projects depending on their assigned role.</li><li> Candidate is expected to put in approximately 40 hours per week.</li><li> Occasional overtime is expected if crunch time requires it.</li><li> Occasional late-night hours may be required when supervising off-hours action items.</li></ul><p><br></p>WHAT IS OPERA:<p><br></p><ul><li> Web based application vital to daily hotel operations (Front desk check-in, back office accounting, interfaces to 200 other systems like door locks, TVs, and point of sell.)</li><li> Critical to other core systems being hosted in datacenters worldwide.</li></ul><p><br></p>POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:<p><br></p>DELIVERABLES:<p><br></p><ul><li> Support new technologies and the roll-out of new products and systems in coordination with other teams.</li><li> Provide technical guidance on operational issues affecting Opera Property Systems.</li><li> Maintain channels of communication with the related application technicians to ensure successful and efficient production changes.</li><li> Coordinate communication with the third-party technical vendors and internal teams for planned events, outages, etc.</li><li> Acquire oversight for the Opera Property Systems project tasks including planning, implementation, monitoring, maintenance and diagnostics.</li><li> Participate in the development and implementation of related systems that require communication to/from our hosted application.</li><li> Coordinate all modifications and changes to property systems with the technical team and carry out the changes as agreed upon the reviewed solution.</li><li> Performs trend analysis on monitoring alarms, incident reports and service ticket to resolve identified issues.</li><li> Provides on-call or after-hours technical support for the group.</li></ul><p><br></p>SAMPLE PROJECTS (FOR INDIVIDUALS ALLOCATED TO THE PROJECT TEAM):<p><br></p><ul><li> Upgrade Opera grids to the new application versions received from the vendor</li><li> Standing up a new datacenter or Azure environment in another region</li><li> Migrating Opera servers and data from standalone servers to the datacenter</li><li> Implement EMV payment gateway interface between the datacenter and payment processing companies</li><li> Testing disaster recovery readiness</li><li> Implementing interfaces/services of additional vendors to/from Opera</li><li> Building additional non-prod environments to give internal testers more varied test configurations</li></ul><p><br></p>EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:<p><br></p><ul><li> Oracle Opera installation experience is highly preferred.</li><li> 5 Years Windows Administrator Experience.</li><li> 1-2 Years Network experience (F5, VIP theory, DNS, Certificates)</li><li> 1-2 Years working with virtual environments (VSphere)</li><li> 1-2 Years working with scripting or automation platforms (PowerShell, Ansible, Etc.)</li></ul><p><br></p>PREFERRED SKILLS:<p><br></p>WORKING KNOWLEDGE OF THE FOLLOWING TOOLSETS IS PREFERRED:<p><br></p>MAIN APPLICATION:<p><br></p><ul><li> Oracle Opera Property Systems and its dedicated interfaces.</li></ul><p><br></p>DATABASE:<p><br></p><ul><li> Oracle DB, RAC and SCAN (11g,12c,19c)</li></ul><p><br></p>AUTOMATION:<p><br></p><ul><li> PowerShell (Scripting of manual windows functions/tasks or installations of software)</li><li> Ansible (YAML scripting and playbooks)</li><li> Rundeck (Implement scripted jobs to run ad hoc or on a fixed schedule)</li><li> Jenkins (Automation of tasks related to building, testing and deploying software)</li></ul><p><br></p>MONITORING:<p><br></p><ul><li> Splunk (Scripting, GUI buildouts)</li><li> Nagios (Scripting, Unix Shell)</li></ul><p><br></p>WORKING KNOWLEDGE OF THE FOLLOWING APPLICATIONS/PLATFORMS:<p><br></p><ul><li> FIM and Active Directory (Security and Distribution Groups)</li><li> Citrix (Dedicated Server Farms in multiple environments)</li><li> Tumbleweed (SFTP Servers)</li><li> VMWare (Vpshere)</li><li> SQL Developer (Connection strings, building queries, running scripts, analysis)</li></ul><p><br></p>SKILLS NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB:<p><br></p><ul><li> Experience in Oracle hospitality property management systems</li><li> Experience in Opera PMS installation and troubleshooting</li><li> Experience in Opera interface implementation</li></ul><p><br></p>ADDITIONAL COMMENTS AND REQUIREMENTS:<p><br></p><ul><li> Must be able to educate, train or mentor other members within the team with internal tools and skill sets.</li><li> Must be able to work in a multicultural environment.</li><li> Hotel / Hospitality operations experience preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p>EDUCATION:<p><br></p><ul><li> University Degree in Information Systems or Information Technology.</li><li> Or, university degree in hospitality with technical background in hospitality systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at [email protected] or 844-463-6178.<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. description_json: <strong>Job#: 1355545</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Role: Property Systems Technical Engineer </strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: REMOTE </strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: 6 month + contract </strong><p><br></p><strong>Client: Large Hotel Client </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>If you are interested, please email your resume to Matt at [email protected] **</li><li> The Property Systems Technical Engineer assume responsibility in either support or project engineering roles.</li><li> In both the roles the Property Systems Technical Engineer will communicate with various teams to deliver the required tasks towards Property Systems implementation and operation. Those include incident management tasks and ITIL best practices for Property Systems Technical Engineers allocated to support and project specific tasks and runbook implementation for those allocated to the project team.</li><li> They acquire knowledge from all available channels and share with colleagues in order to improve the knowledge level of the Property Systems team.</li><li> They are self-driven, motivated and quick-learners in Property System and automation field.</li></ul><p><br></p>TEAM AND OFFICE STRUCTURE:<p><br></p><ul><li> They work remotely and will be available for possible onsite visits up to 4 times a year.</li><li> Report to the managers of support or projects depending on their assigned role.</li><li> Candidate is expected to put in approximately 40 hours per week.</li><li> Occasional overtime is expected if crunch time requires it.</li><li> Occasional late-night hours may be required when supervising off-hours action items.</li></ul><p><br></p>WHAT IS OPERA:<p><br></p><ul><li> Web based application vital to daily hotel operations (Front desk check-in, back office accounting, interfaces to 200 other systems like door locks, TVs, and point of sell.)</li><li> Critical to other core systems being hosted in datacenters worldwide.</li></ul><p><br></p>POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:<p><br></p>DELIVERABLES:<p><br></p><ul><li> Support new technologies and the roll-out of new products and systems in coordination with other teams.</li><li> Provide technical guidance on operational issues affecting Opera Property Systems.</li><li> Maintain channels of communication with the related application technicians to ensure successful and efficient production changes.</li><li> Coordinate communication with the third-party technical vendors and internal teams for planned events, outages, etc.</li><li> Acquire oversight for the Opera Property Systems project tasks including planning, implementation, monitoring, maintenance and diagnostics.</li><li> Participate in the development and implementation of related systems that require communication to/from our hosted application.</li><li> Coordinate all modifications and changes to property systems with the technical team and carry out the changes as agreed upon the reviewed solution.</li><li> Performs trend analysis on monitoring alarms, incident reports and service ticket to resolve identified issues.</li><li> Provides on-call or after-hours technical support for the group.</li></ul><p><br></p>SAMPLE PROJECTS (FOR INDIVIDUALS ALLOCATED TO THE PROJECT TEAM):<p><br></p><ul><li> Upgrade Opera grids to the new application versions received from the vendor</li><li> Standing up a new datacenter or Azure environment in another region</li><li> Migrating Opera servers and data from standalone servers to the datacenter</li><li> Implement EMV payment gateway interface between the datacenter and payment processing companies</li><li> Testing disaster recovery readiness</li><li> Implementing interfaces/services of additional vendors to/from Opera</li><li> Building additional non-prod environments to give internal testers more varied test configurations</li></ul><p><br></p>EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:<p><br></p><ul><li> Oracle Opera installation experience is highly preferred.</li><li> 5 Years Windows Administrator Experience.</li><li> 1-2 Years Network experience (F5, VIP theory, DNS, Certificates)</li><li> 1-2 Years working with virtual environments (VSphere)</li><li> 1-2 Years working with scripting or automation platforms (PowerShell, Ansible, Etc.)</li></ul><p><br></p>PREFERRED SKILLS:<p><br></p>WORKING KNOWLEDGE OF THE FOLLOWING TOOLSETS IS PREFERRED:<p><br></p>MAIN APPLICATION:<p><br></p><ul><li> Oracle Opera Property Systems and its dedicated interfaces.</li></ul><p><br></p>DATABASE:<p><br></p><ul><li> Oracle DB, RAC and SCAN (11g,12c,19c)</li></ul><p><br></p>AUTOMATION:<p><br></p><ul><li> PowerShell (Scripting of manual windows functions/tasks or installations of software)</li><li> Ansible (YAML scripting and playbooks)</li><li> Rundeck (Implement scripted jobs to run ad hoc or on a fixed schedule)</li><li> Jenkins (Automation of tasks related to building, testing and deploying software)</li></ul><p><br></p>MONITORING:<p><br></p><ul><li> Splunk (Scripting, GUI buildouts)</li><li> Nagios (Scripting, Unix Shell)</li></ul><p><br></p>WORKING KNOWLEDGE OF THE FOLLOWING APPLICATIONS/PLATFORMS:<p><br></p><ul><li> FIM and Active Directory (Security and Distribution Groups)</li><li> Citrix (Dedicated Server Farms in multiple environments)</li><li> Tumbleweed (SFTP Servers)</li><li> VMWare (Vpshere)</li><li> SQL Developer (Connection strings, building queries, running scripts, analysis)</li></ul><p><br></p>SKILLS NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB:<p><br></p><ul><li> Experience in Oracle hospitality property management systems</li><li> Experience in Opera PMS installation and troubleshooting</li><li> Experience in Opera interface implementation</li></ul><p><br></p>ADDITIONAL COMMENTS AND REQUIREMENTS:<p><br></p><ul><li> Must be able to educate, train or mentor other members within the team with internal tools and skill sets.</li><li> Must be able to work in a multicultural environment.</li><li> Hotel / Hospitality operations experience preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p>EDUCATION:<p><br></p><ul><li> University Degree in Information Systems or Information Technology.</li><li> Or, university degree in hospitality with technical background in hospitality systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at [email protected] or 844-463-6178.<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. title: DevOps Engineer
description: <strong>Start a Rewarding Career with Alliant </strong><p><br></p>The Systems Engineer (Linux) serves as the first line of support for assigned team responsible for troubleshooting 3rd level service desk tickets until resolution and working directly with the service desk.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Serve as an administrator on Active Directory and manage additions, changes or deletions to the tree structure and group policies </li><li> Ensure environment is updated with current, stable versions of software products; maintain currency with operating system and support software; plan and implement major software upgrades; ensure change management procedures and methodologies are implemented and followed; provide a current, well-managed operating environment for production processing and application development </li><li> Troubleshoot and diagnoses server hardware or software problems in varying levels of complexity </li><li> Provide support for data located on encrypted storage </li><li> Troubleshoots 3rd level service desk tickets until resolution and work directly with hardware software vendors as appropriate </li><li> Provide support to core server systems which include firmware upgrades, releases, patches, Disaster recovery planning and testing, backup and vaulting of data </li><li> Provide support for Multi-Hosts Nodes as well as upgrades, updates and patches </li><li> Provide support on systems to meet departmental service level agreements </li><li> Provide support for business continuity by ensuring backup schedules are completed and provide on-site support for annual disaster recovery test </li><li> Build, develop, and manage the Windows Systems, including organizing the development of Operating System technical support, operational software, and server hardware platform capabilities </li><li> Define and monitor multiple project priorities and provide technical and administrative supervision ensuring appropriate management is apprised of operational status of projects </li><li> Provide appropriate hardware/software resources for business applications; perform capacity planning, workload modeling/prediction, and purchasing recommendations for new hardware/software upgrades; provide business applications enough resources for their short-term and long-term growth </li><li> Document projects deployed and ensure cross-training to team members is completed </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or Related – Minimum<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>3+ Years’ of Experience in Network Hardware and Software Design/Configuration/Deployment, or Related – Minimum<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience In Lieu Of Education</u></strong><p><br></p>8+ Years’ of Experience in Network Hardware and Software Design/Configuration/Deployment<p><br></p><strong>When you’re happy, we’re happy!</strong><p><br></p>As a thank you for joining our team, you’ll benefit from:<p><br></p><ul><li> Competitive medical, dental, and free vision benefits </li><li> Competitive compensation plan </li><li> Contributions towards gym memberships </li><li> Generous PTO and banking holidays off </li></ul><p><br></p>Adhere to and ensure compliance of all business transactions with policy and process of the Bank Secrecy Act. Ensures compliance with all applicable state and federal laws, company procedures and policies. Maintains integrity and ethics in all actions and conversations with or regarding credit union members and their accounts; complies with Privacy Act directives.<p><br></p>The responsibilities listed do not contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this position. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.<p><br></p><strong>Still not convinced?</strong><p><br></p>For more details you can also visit our Glassdoor and <u> LinkedIn </u>profiles.<p><br></p>

title: React Native Mobile Developer - Hybrid
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>You will be joining CIBC’s US Infrastructure Planning &amp; Engineering team. The Infrastructure Engineer to manage our organization's IT infrastructure, ensuring its smooth operation and optimal performance.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in VMware technologies, Active Directory, Exchange and SMTP relay, EMC storage, physical server technologies, and related Azure services. This role requires a deep understanding of infrastructure management, coupled with excellent technical skills and the ability to lead and collaborate with a team.<p><br></p><strong>How You Will Succeed</strong><p><br></p>You can demonstrate and responsible for the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage and maintain the organization's IT infrastructure, including servers, storage, virtualization platforms, and related systems.</li><li>Ensure the availability, reliability, and performance of the infrastructure components, addressing any issues promptly and efficiently.</li><li>Oversee the design, implementation, and administration of VMware technologies, including vSphere, VCenter, and VSAN.</li><li>Manage Active Directory services, including user accounts, group policies, security, and access controls.</li><li>Administer Exchange server and SMTP relay services, ensuring smooth email communication and system integrity.</li><li>Monitor and optimize EMC storage systems, ensuring efficient data storage, backup, and disaster recovery processes.</li><li>Provide technical expertise and guidance in the evaluation, selection, and implementation of physical server technologies.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement infrastructure solutions that meet business needs and align with industry best practices.</li><li>Stay up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends, making recommendations for continuous improvement and innovation.</li><li>Ensure compliance with security standards, data privacy regulations, and disaster recovery policies.</li><li>Lead and mentor a team of infrastructure professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Who You Are</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).</li><li>You have proven experience in infrastructure management, preferably in a leadership role.</li><li>In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with VMware technologies, including vSphere, vCenter, and vSAN.</li><li>Strong expertise in Active Directory administration, group policies, and security management.</li><li>Proficiency in managing Exchange server and SMTP relay services.</li><li>Experience with EMC storage systems, data storage optimization, and backup and recovery strategies.</li><li>Solid understanding of physical server technologies, server virtualization, and related hardware components.</li><li>Familiarity with Azure services and cloud infrastructure is highly desirable.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to analyze complex issues and implement effective solutions.</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams and stakeholders.</li><li>Certifications in relevant technologies (such as VMware, Microsoft, EMC) are a plus.</li><li>If you are a results-oriented professional with a passion for infrastructure management and a solid background in VMware technologies, Active Directory, Exchange, storage, and related technologies, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and contribute to the stability and growth of our organization's IT infrastructure.</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What CIBC Offers</strong><p><br></p>At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client and to do it well. As part of our team, you will<strong>:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and home.</li><li>Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure foster innovation, collaboration, and creativity.</li><li>Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training.</li><li>Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits programs, retirement savings, and more</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-70 W Madison St, 8th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Active Directory (AD), Azure Active Directory (AD), Backup and Recovery (Software), Disaster Recovery (DR), Infrastructure Management (IM), Quest Migration Manager for Active Directory, VMware
