title: Full Stack Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>Responsible for all aspects of the x86 hardware and software lifecycle for Virtual and Windows server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to VMware and Windows operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, HCIS and x86 hardware solutions. Works in agile product delivery team. Interfaces with Product Owner, Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support </li><li>Experience supporting Microsoft Windows Server technologies</li><li>Installation, configuration, and administration of virtualization infrastructures running on VMware suite of products</li><li>Experience with x86 and HCIS platforms (Nutanix, Cisco UCS)</li><li>Strong Powershell or Ansible scripting experience, especially with the goal of automation</li><li>Experience working under a Change Management umbrella, with strong policies and approval chain</li><li>Able to demonstrate a strong engineering mindset throughout the project lifecycle</li><li>Able to take responsibility and will pro-actively look to identify and improve existing processes and practices within the environment</li><li>Excellent Communication skills (spoken/written English) are a must, strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Must be able to multi-task and respond effectively under pressure</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Windows, VMware</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)
description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. title: Property Systems Technical Engineer
description: <em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>The Following Will Be The Core Responsibilities For This Position</u></strong><p><br></p>Roles &amp; Responsibilities The CME Group is seeking to fulfill the position of a senior Java developer responsible for supporting, enhancing, and developing Java-based applications on the GCP platform.<p><br></p>Support the existing Java-based applications running on a GKE cluster on GCP<p><br></p>Work with the CME SDR team to implement new functionalities to the Java application on the GCP environment<p><br></p>Work with the CME quality assurance and other internal CME teams to test any enhancements made to the Java applications<p><br></p>Continually update documentations outlining the new development or enhancements made to the Java applications<p><br></p>Attend all required project meetings and provide status updates for all development activities<p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>10+ years of experience as a Java developer utilizing Java 8 or newer versions and the supporting platforms such as Eclipse, Spring boot, code repository (i.e. Bitbucket)<p><br></p>5+ years of experience with relational databases (Oracle, Postgres, MySQL)<p><br></p>5+ years of experience using build tools such as Maven.<p><br></p>3+ years of experience with CI/CD concepts and tools such as Jenkins.<p><br></p>4+ years of experience and understanding of cloud computing.<p><br></p>4+ years of experience and understanding of Docker for containerization and its underlying concepts.<p><br></p>3+ years of experience with cloud data warehouse such as Big Query.<p><br></p>3+ years of experience with cloud containerization technology such as GKE.<p><br></p>4+ years of experience in microservices development and REST-based architecture.<p><br></p>1+ years of experience with Argo for CI/CD and Workflow orchestration. Not a must have, but a nice to have.

title: Systems Engineer - Linux
description: Job ID: 62216<p><br></p><strong>NetApp CVO Engineer</strong><p><br></p>Our client is seeking a NetApp CVO Engineer to assist their organization in Chicago, Illinois. The NetApp CVO Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, and supporting NetApp Cloud Volumes ONTAP (CVO) solutions for clients. He/she will collaborate with the IT Transformation/Simplification team to understand business requirements and develop solutions that meet their needs. Primarily, this will involve the migration of data from NetApp “on-rem” to NetApp CVO in Azure. The NetApp CVO Engineer will also be responsible for configuring, testing, and troubleshooting CVO solutions.<p><br></p><em><u>This role is fully remote.</u></em><p><br></p><strong>NetApp CVO Engineer Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with clients to understand their business requirements and design NetApp CVO solutions that meet their needs.</li><li>Configure and implement NetApp CVO solutions, including configuring virtual machines, storage volumes, and networking.</li><li>Support the migration of data from NetApp “on-prem” in our Data Centers and Offices to NetApp CVO using snap-mirror and robo-copy methods.</li><li>Test and troubleshoot NetApp CVO solutions to ensure they meet performance and availability requirements.</li><li>Work with clients to migrate their data to NetApp CVO and provide hyper-care support to ensure their systems run smoothly and perform as required.</li><li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge of NetApp CVO features and capabilities and recommend upgrades and improvements to clients as appropriate.</li><li>Create and maintain documentation on NetApp CVO solutions, including design documents, implementation plans, and troubleshooting guides.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>NetApp CVO Engineer Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field is desired.</li><li>Minimum of 3 years of experience in designing, implementing, and supporting NetApp storage solutions, including CVO.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies such as Azure (preferred), AWS, or Google Cloud Platform.</li><li>Strong knowledge of networking, virtualization, and storage technologies.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.</li><li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively with clients and team members.</li><li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities.</li><li>NetApp certification, such as NCDA or NCIE, is preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation: $52-$75/hr. (DOE)</strong> <strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>Benefits are available to eligible VanderHouwen contractors and include coverage for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long term disability, and matching 401k.<p><br></p><strong>About VanderHouwen</strong><p><br></p>VanderHouwen is an award-winning, Women-Owned, WBENC certified professional staffing firm. Founded in 1987, VanderHouwen has been successfully placing experienced professionals throughout the Pacific Northwest and nationwide. Our recruitment teams are highly specialized in either Technology and IT, Engineering, or Accounting and Finance career markets. Our recruiters value building meaningful, professional relationships with each candidate as well as developing honed knowledge of companies' staffing needs and workplaces. Partner with us to land your next exciting career.<p><br></p>VanderHouwen is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. VanderHouwen does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state or federal civil rights laws.<p><br></p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <ul><li>Stock options + 3 weeks PTO|Fast growing company working in C#/.NET<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>My client is doing innovative work with bots spanning many capabilities and needs a Full Stack Engineer to join their well funded start-up. This position will take more of an senior role, but if interested, can work directly on the bots as well. Working with different applications, my client is seeking an individual who can operate in a fast paced environment and can think quickly on their feet. To keep pace, my client works in an agile environment with frequent iterations overseen by this Full Stack Engineer.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>See through full life-cycle of features on customer-facing web application.</li><li>Design and document efficient data models with complex relationships.</li><li>Mentor and share with other developers on the team and other stakeholders on other teams.</li><li>Maintain a full library of Python written applications.</li><li>Collaborate with team to document optimal practices.</li><li>Contribute work on UI, API, and DB tiers.</li><li>Be adaptive to frequent change.<br><br></li></ul>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills, for both technical and non-technical audiences.</li><li>4+ years of experience working in full stack, or API engineering role.</li><li>Strong foundation in programming, algorithms, and software application design.</li><li>Finger on the pulse of new industry trends.</li><li>Experience in leadership role.</li><li>History of working with C#/.NET.</li><li>Communicating with co-workers across different teams.</li><li>Mentoring more junior developers.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Strong base for 4-7 years of experience</li><li>Employee stock options</li><li>Medical, dental, and vision</li><li>Company merchandise </li><li>3 weeks PTO to start</li><li>Happy hours and team events</li><li>Wellness perks i.e. gym, mental health apps</li><li>Clearly defined path to growth<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Sean Stanton<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-072023-6116649</strong>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security

title: Java Developer with GCP
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, CIS Technologies Inc., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Position: Java Developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Evanston, IL</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: 4-6 Months CTH</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Current work setup (hybrid model):</li><li>2 Days - Work from client site</li><li>3 Days - Work from home</li><li>Other requirements:</li><li>Dress Code: Formal dress code when working from client location.</li><li>Vaccination: Client require candidate to be fully vaccinated, as their facility is fully vaccinated area</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Description For Java Developer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>8+ years’ experience in software development on Java Platform</li><li>Strong understanding of RDBMS concepts, with ability to understand and write complex queries, stored procedures, analytical skills.</li><li>Experience in development and production support environment.</li><li>As a senior developer ability to work independently, highly motivated self-starter and a good team player with ability to work under minimal supervision.</li><li>Ability to perform effort estimation, breakdown workload into MVP.</li><li>Strong Communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Primary Skills: </strong><p><br></p>Very Strong with extensive knowledge and experience in -<p><br></p><ul><li> Java 6 and above</li><li> Hibernate 2.5 and above.</li><li> Spring Framework 2.5 and above</li><li> Eclipse Keplar and current. Other similar IDE</li><li> SQL (Actual language not just using ORM)</li><li> JBoss (Preferred 5 or 7)/Wildfly</li><li> Maven</li><li> Experience in UX (HTML, CSS, Java script …)</li><li> Struts Framework</li><li> Tomcat (preferred version 7 or above)</li><li> Linux</li><li> Ant/Ivy</li><li> Freemarker</li><li> Analytical Skills: Ability to perform root cause analysis, identify the defect area reported by client/ production support tickets. Ability to understand complex business processes &amp; workflow, functional &amp; technical process of application. Identify and resolve database related performance and/or other issues.</li><li> Tools:</li><li> SVN &amp; GIT: SVN and GIT are used as source code repository, hence must have knowledge and experience using these tools.</li><li> TFS: Experience in using TFS for agile projects.</li><li> JIRA and Confluence: JIRA is used for product support and enhancement ticket. Confluence is the document repository.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Methodology:</strong><p><br></p>Agile - Normal course of project execution is under Agile methodology. Hence knowledge and experience to work in agile structure (Sprints, retrospectives, etc)<p><br></p><strong>Secondary:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Postgres</li><li> XSL/XSLT</li><li> Excel</li><li> Experience with AS/400 (iSeries) &amp; DB2</li><li> Perl</li><li> Adeptia ETL or similar</li><li> JasperReports</li><li> iText</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Good To have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in migration Java 6 to newer version</li><li>Experience in updating Java 6 code base for latest browser compatibility.</li></ul> Java Developer|| Evanston, IL ||Hybrid

description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Ascendion Inc., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>About Ascendion</strong><p><br></p>Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next. Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life<p><br></p>We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:<p><br></p><ul><li>Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands</li><li>Solve complex problems – and learn new skills</li><li>Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients</li><li>Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience a community of change makers! </strong><p><br></p>Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.<p><br></p>About the Role: We are looking for an experienced AWS Developer to join our team and help us build and maintain our cloud-based applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of .NET development, web services, microservices, and database technologies. They should also have experience with messaging queues and topics, as well as AWS general, EKS, ECS, Queues, and Lambda.<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> AWS Developer<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, IL (Hybrid)<p><br></p><strong>About the role: </strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop and maintain .NET web services and microservices </li><li>Design and implement database schemas </li><li>Work with messaging queues and topics </li><li>Implement AWS general concepts, such as cloud computing, infrastructure as code, and security </li><li>Use EKS, ECS, SQS, and Lambda </li><li>Work independently and as part of a team </li><li>Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field </li><li>7+ years of experience in AWS and C# </li><li>3-5 years' experience in .NET development </li><li>Experience with web services and microservices </li><li>Experience with database technologies </li><li>Experience with messaging queues and topics </li><li>Experience with AWS general concepts </li><li>Experience with EKS, ECS, SQS, and Lambda </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Salary Range</strong>: The salary for this position is between $1,04,000 – $1,12,320 annually. Factors which may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.<p><br></p>This position is eligible for commissions in accordance with the terms of the Company’s plan. Commissions for this position are estimated to be based on individual performance. Additionally, this role is also eligible for bonus based on achievement of mutually agreed KRAs.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits:</strong> The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: [medical insurance] [dental insurance] [vision insurance] [401(k) retirement plan] [long-term disability insurance] [short-term disability insurance] [personal days accrued each calendar year. The Paid time off benefits meet the paid sick and safe time laws that pertains to the City/ State] [12-15 days (about 2 weeks) of paid vacation time] [6-8 weeks (about 2 months) of paid parental leave after a year of service] [9 paid holidays and 2 floating holidays per calendar year] [Ascendion Learning Management System] [Tuition Reimbursement Program]<p><br></p>Want to change the world? Let us know.<p><br></p>Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let’s talk!

Need to be able to use the computer system for job orders.<p><br></p><ul><li>Skills:*</li></ul><p><br></p>Cnc programming, Mastercam, Cnc mill, Cnc machining, Solidworks<p><br></p><ul><li>Top Skills Details:*</li></ul><p><br></p>Cnc programming,Mastercam,Cnc mill<p><br></p><ul><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li></ul><p><br></p>Must Have: CNC milling experience Programming experience<p><br></p>G code Gibbs Cam or Mastercam experience<p><br></p>Mics and cals<p><br></p>Nice to Have: 3D modeling experience- Solid Works Worked with exotic metals<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience Level:*</li></ul><p><br></p>Expert Level<p><br></p>About Aerotek:<p><br></p>We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, UXIN Collaborative, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Note:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Current work setup (hybrid model):</li><li>2 Days - Work from client site</li><li>3 Days - Work from home</li><li>Other requirements:</li><li>Dress Code: Formal dress code when working from client location.</li><li>Vaccination: Client require candidate to be fully vaccinated, as their facility is fully vaccinated area.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Description For Java Developer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>8+ years’ experience in software development on Java Platform</li><li>Strong understanding of RDBMS concepts, with ability to understand and write complex queries, stored procedures, analytical skills.</li><li>Experience in development and production support environment.</li><li>As a senior developer ability to work independently, highly motivated self-starter and a good team player with ability to work under minimal supervision.</li><li>Ability to perform effort estimation, breakdown workload into MVP.</li><li>Strong Communication skills </li><li>Primary Skills: Very Strong with extensive knowledge and experience in -</li><li> Java 6 and above</li><li> Hibernate 2.5 and above.</li><li> Spring Framework 2.5 and above</li><li> Eclipse Keplar and current. Other similar IDE</li><li> SQL (Actual language not just using ORM)</li><li> JBoss (Preferred 5 or 7)/Wildfly</li><li> Maven</li><li> Experience in UX (HTML, CSS, Java script …)</li><li> Struts Framework</li><li> Tomcat (preferred version 7 or above)</li><li> Linux</li><li> Ant/Ivy</li><li> Freemarker</li><li> Analytical Skills: Ability to perform root cause analysis, identify the defect area reported by client/ production support tickets. Confluence is the document repository.</li><li> Methodology:</li><li> Agile - Normal course of project execution is under Agile methodology. Hence knowledge and experience to work in agile structure (Sprints, retrospectives, etc)</li></ul>

title: Security Operations Engineer
description: <strong>POSITION SUMMARY:</strong><p><br></p>The Infrastructure Security Engineer will work collectively across teams in implementing and maintaining the configurations of our various physical and cloud-based systems. This position will be responsible for implementing the firm’s security and risk requirements to ensure compliance. The Infrastructure Security Engineer role will reside on the infrastructure team and will report to the infrastructure manager. Required to collaborate with other infrastructure engineers (network/systems/storage/virtualization/cloud), security architect, security team, desktop architect, and various support teams to apply our security best practices.<p><br></p>Thorough understanding of network and security solutions, hardware, and fundamental security best practices are vital to this role.<p><br></p><strong>DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work with infrastructure and security teams to manage and maintain network firewalls and security equipment.</li><li>Primary point of contact and resource for security and risk related network infrastructure projects.</li><li>Implement, manage, and maintain the firm’s endpoint security plan and authentication (NAC)</li><li>Troubleshoot and provide support for various infrastructure and security systems as required.</li><li>Work collectively with our network and security team to plan and strategize on network and security roadmaps. Study network architecture and make recommendations and identify solutions. Work in conjunction with our security team to conduct risk assessments.</li><li>Implement new network designs, take part in continual improvement and equipment life cycle management across our offices – globally. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology with 4 + years equivalent work experience required.</li><li> At least 5 years of experience and direct “hands-on” knowledge maintaining network equipment and information security systems required.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><ul><li> Knowledge of enterprise networks and security infrastructure. NAC, NPS, communication and internet security systems, remote access VPN, firewalls, and wireless security infrastructure.</li><li> Knowledge and experience with the following:</li><ul><li>NAC/802.1x implementations and controls using Aruba Clearpass.</li><li>Palo Alto firewalls – physical and virtual in Azure</li><li>Meraki firewalls</li><li>Silverpeak SDWAN – physical and virtual in Azure</li><li>Cisco switching</li><li>Cisco Anyconnect VPN</li><li>Palo Alto Prisma VPN</li><li>Network segmentation and isolation<br><br></li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>COMPETENCIES</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must possess excellent communication, documentation, and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Strong technical knowledge across a variety of systems – integration of infrastructure and security devices with Active Directory, various MFA, and SSO systems.</li><li>Knowledge of LAN and WAN technologies, VPN, MPLS, ISPs, Silver Peak SD-WAN, failover, and high availability.</li><li>Design and implementation of various network segmentation strategies.</li><li>Requires after-hours, weekends and on-call work as needed.</li><li>Interact with all levels of management and teams within IS.</li><li>Ability to travel to Winston offices and or vendor locations as required.</li></ul><p><br></p>We value diversity in the workplace. EOE/Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled (EOE=Equal Opportunity Employer)<p><br></p>

title: Software Engineer - Docker Images & Community
description: At Kin + Carta, we’ve got opportunities to offer you — for growth, for leadership, for big, world-changing impact and for, dare we say it, fun. We are a global workforce that is committed to building a world that works better for everyone. And that starts with our Kin. That’s why we’re proud of:<p><br></p><ul><li>The life we create within our virtual walls, every day</li><li>Our B Corp certification</li><li>Our ranking in Consulting Magazine's 2022 “Best Large Firms to Work For”</li><li>The work we’ve done with some of the world’s most innovative companies</li></ul><p><br></p>The role<p><br></p>Kin + Carta is seeking a Full Stack Java Engineer to join our Cloud Engineering Practice.<p><br></p>Role responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Consulting with Fortune 500 clients in order to build enterprise-grade cloud-native applications</li><li>Develop and maintain full-stack solutions; front-end (user interfaces), back-end (APIs), database, and DevOps development to fit business needs</li><li>Supporting team members in order to deliver products to market in an efficient manner</li><li>Partnering with top-notch designers to create award-winning user experiences</li><li>Bridging the gap between elegant front-end design and existing enterprise backend architectures</li><li>Mentoring less experienced engineers to foster their career path and growth</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>We want all new hires to succeed in their roles at Kin + Carta. That's why we've outlined the job requirements below. To be considered for this role, it's important that you meet all Minimum Qualifications. If you do not meet all of the Preferred Qualifications, we still encourage you to apply.</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4+ years of professional software development experience</li><li>2+ years of experience working with or working knowledge of JDK 11+</li><li>2+ years of experience working with or working knowledge OOD and OOP</li><li>2+ years of experience working with or working knowledge of web services</li><li>2+ years of hands-on experience developing Java applications, APIs, and front-end/web</li><li>Exposure to modern software practices such as TDD, CI/CD, etc.</li><li>Flexibility to work in a pair programming environment using modern development principles like XP, TDD as necessary </li><li>The ability to work on Central Standard Time (CST) hours</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS in Computer Science, or a related field</li><li>Strong level knowledge of Java and Java web applications</li><li>Strong understanding of modern Spring frameworks (Spring Boot, Spring Cloud Services, etc)</li><li>Previous experience delivering products in an Agile environment</li><li>Experience developing enterprise applications that support high traffic volumes</li><li>Working experience with microservice architectures</li><li>Working experience with public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)</li><li>Working experience with modern web application frameworks (AngularJS, ReactJS, etc)</li><li>Certifications in Google (Associate Cloud Engineer, Professional Cloud Developer) or Pivotal (Pivotal Certified Developer Java, Spring Professional) are preferred. </li><li>Previous exposure to Pivotal Cloud Foundry</li><li>Previous consulting experience is a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>About Kin + Carta<p><br></p>Kin + Carta is a global digital transformation consultancy committed to working alongside our clients to build a world that works better #ForEveryone. We build digital solutions that connect people, data and technology for some of the world’s most influential companies. As a Certified B Corp, we are committed to Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Awareness, and our triple bottom line focus of people, the planet and profit.<p><br></p>If you need accommodations at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

title: IT Software Engineer 2
description: <ul><li>Work with a fast-growing software company and a collaborative team|Work on greenfield projects and cutting edge new developments.<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client is an industry leader in the youth sports and athletics industry, and this role is located in an northern Chicago suburb. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Top of the market salary, ranging from $160k-$200k based upon experience</li><li>Excellent total comp package with benefits</li><li>401k match, and Health care / Medical Insurances</li><li>Very generous PTO, sick, mental and holiday time-off<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. title: Java Developer - Evanston, IL
description: <strong>You have the ability to introduce and engineer evolution across an organization. Your exceptional multitasking skills help you to prioritize and balance in accordance with an organization’s goals and timelines. Your expert analytical skills allow you to quickly examine performance, security and reliability of systems and networks, and identify and resolve any issues that may arise. You stay ahead of the curve and utilize various tools and methods to collect, process and interpret data. You use your interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with different stakeholders and can explain technical concepts and solutions in a clear and concise manner, and in creating robust documentation.</strong><p><br></p>If this sounds like you, please read on!<p><br></p>As the Infrastructure Engineer, you will be involved in creating end-to-end infrastructure solutions as part of a cross-functional team. Your main responsibilities include assisting in designing and implementing infrastructure solutions, supporting infrastructure improvement projects, maintaining and updating existing infrastructure solutions, creating operational documentation, and resolving server (physical and virtual), network and desktop issues.<p><br></p>Responsible for Academy’s server infrastructure and network system comprising of system maintenance; installation and tuning of system software; monitoring of system performance; management and allocation of computer resources; provisioning of system users; backup and system restoration. Responsible for securing systems per Information Security recommendations.<p><br></p>Part of a team responsible for basic database administration duties comprising of installation of SQL Server, Personify and other database applications. Monitoring of SQL Server and other database applications. Maintenance of databases which includes user provisioning, resource usage, and backup and restoration.<p><br></p>Server backup, network, phone and desktop support and alert monitoring primarily at the Rosemont headquarters with limited travel to the Washington D.C office.<p><br></p>Works with DevOps, SQL DBAs and Cloud Engineering to support both on premises and cloud-based projects and improve the provisioning times for IT environments.<p><br></p>Participates in creating documentation for operational readiness activities, designs and builds pilot solutions using new technologies, and implements new product features and enhancements.<p><br></p>Ensures that infrastructure projects are integrated and operate efficiently, and coordinates with colleagues across the enterprise to drive infrastructure builds and resolves any issues that may arise.<p><br></p>Works closely with the Identity and Access Management and Cyber Security teams to properly provision and decommission access to systems as necessary.<p><br></p>Assists with desktop software, OS and hardware upgrades and using SCCM.<p><br></p>Configures and monitors AAOS backup solutions. Consists of backup, restore, on site retention, cloud (Azure) backups and cloud synchronization. Member of the Disaster Recovery team.<p><br></p>Monitors, purchases, and installs DNS name renewal and SSL certificates.<p><br></p>Responsible for 3rd party audio/visual conference subscriptions. Provisioning users and billing reconciliation.<p><br></p><strong><u>Exemplifies The Following Essential Values Of The Academy</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Teamwork: Effective collaboration and team-focus to solve complex problems and drive innovation.</li><li>Empowerment: The authority, information, and skills to make decisions and drive results.</li><li>Accountability: Ownership of process and results that drive decisions and ensure implementation.</li><li>Mindset of Growth/Continuous Learning: Focused on and invested in self and staff development to become more adaptable, making the Academy more agile, innovative, and sustainable.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Travel</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Up to 10 days per year</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Required</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree and 3-5 years of relevant infrastructure engineering, network, and desktop support experience </li><li>Hands-on experience with VMware, and experience with Microsoft Azure </li><li>Knowledge and skills in infrastructure management </li><li>Ability to manage multiple assignments, prioritize activities, and work independently. </li><li>Familiarity with ITIL v4, IT standards, procedures, and policies </li><li>Experience in configuring networking components, TCP-IP/tools, VMWare, wired and wireless appliances (using Extreme Networks, Cisco, and Mitel solutions) </li><li>Ability to simplify and standardize complex concepts and processes. </li><li>Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as the ability to prioritize. </li><li>Drive for cross-functional execution, adaptability, and ability to introduce and manage change. </li><li>Team player, detail-oriented, and analytical skills. </li><li>Above average ability in communication and human relations skills </li><li>Strong organizational skills and user orientation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>System administration and IT certifications in Linux, Microsoft, or other network related fields </li><li>Knowledge of IIS running in Windows 2016, 2019 and 2022 </li><li>Experience with cloud-based infrastructure specifically in Microsoft Azure </li><li>1-2 years of experience of project coordination/management</li></ul><p><br></p>If this describes YOU, please apply by sharing the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Clearly communicate why you are the ideal candidate for this role, providing specific examples and experiences as proof points.</li><li>Resumes must be accompanied by a cover letter with salary expectations to be considered. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Please Note</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>This position is based in Rosemont, Illinois and is open to applicants who are able to commute weekly to this office.</strong><p><br></p>Applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of work visas.<p><br></p><strong>JOB CODE: 1000052</strong>

title: Infrastructure Security Engineer
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying basic knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 2, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of limited complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities<p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect Chamberlain Group’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, related technical field or equivalent practical experience</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>1+ years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties and Responsibilities</li><li>Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products; strong analytical skills; effective communication skills; Oriented programming experience; TCP, UPD, HTTP, WebSockets, MQTT, or other connected protocols</li><li>Agile/Scrum experience</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Full Stack Java Engineer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Photon, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>Hi,<p><br></p>Greetings everyone,<p><br></p>We are hiring a<strong> Gupta Centura SQL Windows Developer </strong><u>t</u>o join our Digital Engineering team.<p><br></p><strong>Who are we?</strong><p><br></p>For the past 20 years, we have powered many Digital Experiences for the Fortune 500. Since 1999, we have grown from a few people to more than 4000 team members across the globe that are engaged in various Digital Modernization.<p><br></p><strong>What do we need?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Designing, coding, and debugging applications using Centura Team Developer.</li><li>Collaborating with business analysts and stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.</li><li>Developing and maintaining software applications, including user interfaces, business logic, and database integration.</li><li>Writing efficient and well-structured code in Centura Team Developer programming language.</li><li>Conducting unit testing and debugging to ensure the applications meet functional requirements and are free from errors.</li><li>Optimizing application performance and responsiveness.</li><li>Working with relational databases (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL) and implementing database operations such as querying, data manipulation, and reporting.</li><li>Integrating applications with web services and other third-party systems.</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.</li><li>Solid experience in developing applications using Centura Team Developer or Gupta Team Developer.</li><li>Proficiency in Centura Team Developer programming language and associated development tools.</li><li>Strong knowledge of client-server architecture and web application development concepts.</li><li>Familiarity with relational databases and SQL.</li><li>Experience in software development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies and practices.</li></ul><p><br></p>Thanks &amp; Regards<p><br></p>saravanan MG<p><br></p>Photon - Human Resources<p><br></p>Gupta Centura Windows Developer - Multiple Openings Direct Client

title: Software Engineer- 7+ Yr's of C#/.NET- Hybrid
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Ntiva, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Are you looking for limit-less career opportunities? Do you have a growth mindset, and like to take initiative?</strong> If yes, then Ntiva is the right place for you! At Ntiva, we have a saying – “We exist to grow each other.” Our focus is helping each other, our clients and our families grow both personally and professionally. Sound like something you could get in to? Because as one of the fastest-growing Managed Services Companies in the country, we’re looking to fuel our team with powerhouse talent. With strategic locations across the U.S., and still led by our original founder Steven Freidkin, we specialize in in helping organizations solve their complex IT challenges no matter where they are located. Definitely a fast-paced environment where we collectively battle escalating cyber-attacks and stay on top of fast changing technologies! Come explore one of our many opportunities!<p><br></p><strong>How You’ll Make An Impact</strong><p><br></p>As the Systems Engineer (SE) you will provide onsite technical support to customers on a recurring or non- recurring basis and will be an escalation point for technical issues.<p><br></p><strong>Summary of Location and Hours</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This is an On-site position traveling to different client sites within the Chicagoland area (ability to work remote up to 20% of the time)</li><li>Monday-Friday approximately 8am-5pm, afterhours work required as needed, some on call work may be necessary</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provides excellent support to customers remotely or onsite as needed</li><li>Resolves technical issues assigned to them</li><li>Maintain utilization metrics above 85%</li><li>Provides advanced troubleshooting and resolutions</li><li>Design and build networks, VLANs and security rules</li><li>Design and build GPOs to enforce policy across organizations</li><li>Configuration of AAD and DirSync to O365</li><li>Troubleshoot advanced applications, servers, and networks</li><li>Troubleshoot Virtual machines and drives</li><li>Troubleshoot VLAN settings and configurations</li><li>Create and manage internal DNS zones and settings</li><li>Understanding of raid arrays and configurations</li><li>Create virtual machines, drives, and configurations</li><li>Create and manage firewall rules and configurations</li><li>Migrate VMs from hosts and storage</li><li>Update ticket notes and details daily</li><li>Participates in the afterhours support rotation</li><li>Preforms deployments and new system setups</li><li>Performs datacenter visits as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You’ll be successful in this role if you have experience in/with</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 3 to 7 years of experience that is directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified</li><li>Windows Server Administration/Deployment/Implementation</li><li>Email Migrations – On-Prem/O365/Google Suite</li><li>Intune/Endpoint Manager Setup/Configuration</li><li>Microsoft Azure Knowledge – Implementation of VM’s, VNets, Virtual Gateways, Virtual Firewalls</li><li>Sharepoint Online – Implementation / File Migrations / OneDrive</li><li>Tenant to Tenant Migration Experience – O365 to O365, Google to O365</li><li>Network infrastructure implementation and administration of routers, firewalls and switches in-depth experience including system implementation, management and documentation</li><li>Microsoft Hyper-V/ VMware LAN/WAN Technologies</li><li>Ability to create and document technical information to both technical and non-technical personnel</li><li>Ability to travel to client premises as needed</li><li>This position requires a high level of independence and strong client service skills. Organizational ability is important to keep track of all tasks, because the job requires a great deal of multi-tasking. We also require accurate and timely tracking of client work, service calls, and related documentation including timesheets and expense reporting.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus points for</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline; equivalent experience acceptable</li><li>Experience with ConnectWise, SCCM, LabTech or similar service management system</li><li>Subject matter expert for specific technologies (e.g. Microsoft, VMware, Citrix, Cisco, etc.)</li><li>Certifications including:</li><ul><li>Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE)</li><li>VMware Certified Professional (VCP)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)</li><li>Citrix Certified Administrator (CCA)</li><li>Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Foundation </li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Physical Requirements / Working Conditions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds frequently</li><li>Must be able to lift up to 75 pounds rarely</li><li>Must be able to perform occasional bending, kneeling, squatting, and turning.</li><li>Must be able to perform occasional reaching over shoulder height, waist level and from floor.</li><li>Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Must be able to work in an unsupervised environment.</li><li>Must be able to drive / sit for extended periods of time.</li><li>Fast Paced Environment with competing priorities</li><li>Must have a valid driver’s license in the state you reside and access to an insured vehicle for travel to client sites / office.</li><li>Ability to work in an office environment while sitting at a desk for extended periods of time.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits And Perks</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, Dental and Vision coverage for employee and family</li><li>401k + company matched contributions 4% match on 5% contribution – Employee and Company contribute after 90 days – no vesting period!)</li><li>Group Term Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment coverage (company provided)</li><li>Short-Term (voluntary enrollment) and Long-Term Disability coverage (company provided)</li><li>Health Savings Account (HSA) Options / PPO Options</li><li>Paid Personal Time Off (PTO) + 2 Floating Holidays</li><li>Bonus plans</li><li>Tuition Reimbursement Program</li><li>Employee Assistance Program</li><li>Generous Employee Referral Program – the more you refer the more you earn!</li><li>Dynamic Recognition and Rewards</li><li>Work with Industry-Leading Talent</li><li>Clear Promotion and Advancement Tracks </li></ul><p><br></p>At Ntiva, we are committed to creating and maintaining a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming work environment for all employees and job applicants. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters a wider range of perspectives, experiences, and ideas that lead to increased creativity, innovation, and problem-solving capabilities. As an equal opportunity employer, we actively seek to recruit and retain a diverse workforce that reflects the communities we serve. We prohibit discrimination of any kind, including but not limited to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and comply with all applicable laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.
description_json: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Ntiva, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Are you looking for limit-less career opportunities? Do you have a growth mindset, and like to take initiative?</strong> If yes, then Ntiva is the right place for you! At Ntiva, we have a saying – “We exist to grow each other.” Our focus is helping each other, our clients and our families grow both personally and professionally. Sound like something you could get in to? Because as one of the fastest-growing Managed Services Companies in the country, we’re looking to fuel our team with powerhouse talent. With strategic locations across the U.S., and still led by our original founder Steven Freidkin, we specialize in in helping organizations solve their complex IT challenges no matter where they are located. Definitely a fast-paced environment where we collectively battle escalating cyber-attacks and stay on top of fast changing technologies! Come explore one of our many opportunities!<p><br></p><strong>How You’ll Make An Impact</strong><p><br></p>As the Systems Engineer (SE) you will provide onsite technical support to customers on a recurring or non- recurring basis and will be an escalation point for technical issues.<p><br></p><strong>Summary of Location and Hours</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This is an On-site position traveling to different client sites within the Chicagoland area (ability to work remote up to 20% of the time)</li><li>Monday-Friday approximately 8am-5pm, afterhours work required as needed, some on call work may be necessary</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provides excellent support to customers remotely or onsite as needed</li><li>Resolves technical issues assigned to them</li><li>Maintain utilization metrics above 85%</li><li>Provides advanced troubleshooting and resolutions</li><li>Design and build networks, VLANs and security rules</li><li>Design and build GPOs to enforce policy across organizations</li><li>Configuration of AAD and DirSync to O365</li><li>Troubleshoot advanced applications, servers, and networks</li><li>Troubleshoot Virtual machines and drives</li><li>Troubleshoot VLAN settings and configurations</li><li>Create and manage internal DNS zones and settings</li><li>Understanding of raid arrays and configurations</li><li>Create virtual machines, drives, and configurations</li><li>Create and manage firewall rules and configurations</li><li>Migrate VMs from hosts and storage</li><li>Update ticket notes and details daily</li><li>Participates in the afterhours support rotation</li><li>Preforms deployments and new system setups</li><li>Performs datacenter visits as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>You’ll be successful in this role if you have experience in/with</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 3 to 7 years of experience that is directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified</li><li>Windows Server Administration/Deployment/Implementation</li><li>Email Migrations – On-Prem/O365/Google Suite</li><li>Intune/Endpoint Manager Setup/Configuration</li><li>Microsoft Azure Knowledge – Implementation of VM’s, VNets, Virtual Gateways, Virtual Firewalls</li><li>Sharepoint Online – Implementation / File Migrations / OneDrive</li><li>Tenant to Tenant Migration Experience – O365 to O365, Google to O365</li><li>Network infrastructure implementation and administration of routers, firewalls and switches in-depth experience including system implementation, management and documentation</li><li>Microsoft Hyper-V/ VMware LAN/WAN Technologies</li><li>Ability to create and document technical information to both technical and non-technical personnel</li><li>Ability to travel to client premises as needed</li><li>This position requires a high level of independence and strong client service skills. Organizational ability is important to keep track of all tasks, because the job requires a great deal of multi-tasking. We also require accurate and timely tracking of client work, service calls, and related documentation including timesheets and expense reporting.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus points for</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline; equivalent experience acceptable</li><li>Experience with ConnectWise, SCCM, LabTech or similar service management system</li><li>Subject matter expert for specific technologies (e.g. Microsoft, VMware, Citrix, Cisco, etc.)</li><li>Certifications including:</li><ul><li>Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE)</li><li>VMware Certified Professional (VCP)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)</li><li>Citrix Certified Administrator (CCA)</li><li>Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Foundation </li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Physical Requirements / Working Conditions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds frequently</li><li>Must be able to lift up to 75 pounds rarely</li><li>Must be able to perform occasional bending, kneeling, squatting, and turning.</li><li>Must be able to perform occasional reaching over shoulder height, waist level and from floor.</li><li>Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Must be able to work in an unsupervised environment.</li><li>Must be able to drive / sit for extended periods of time.</li><li>Fast Paced Environment with competing priorities</li><li>Must have a valid driver’s license in the state you reside and access to an insured vehicle for travel to client sites / office.</li><li>Ability to work in an office environment while sitting at a desk for extended periods of time.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits And Perks</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, Dental and Vision coverage for employee and family</li><li>401k + company matched contributions 4% match on 5% contribution – Employee and Company contribute after 90 days – no vesting period!)</li><li>Group Term Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment coverage (company provided)</li><li>Short-Term (voluntary enrollment) and Long-Term Disability coverage (company provided)</li><li>Health Savings Account (HSA) Options / PPO Options</li><li>Paid Personal Time Off (PTO) + 2 Floating Holidays</li><li>Bonus plans</li><li>Tuition Reimbursement Program</li><li>Employee Assistance Program</li><li>Generous Employee Referral Program – the more you refer the more you earn!</li><li>Dynamic Recognition and Rewards</li><li>Work with Industry-Leading Talent</li><li>Clear Promotion and Advancement Tracks </li></ul><p><br></p>At Ntiva, we are committed to creating and maintaining a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming work environment for all employees and job applicants. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters a wider range of perspectives, experiences, and ideas that lead to increased creativity, innovation, and problem-solving capabilities. As an equal opportunity employer, we actively seek to recruit and retain a diverse workforce that reflects the communities we serve. We prohibit discrimination of any kind, including but not limited to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and comply with all applicable laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Looking for the next step in your career? Enjoy a challenge? Do you have an ambition for innovation? Want to make a difference? </strong><p><br></p>If you join our growing global team, you’ll be working for an industry leader with offices across five continents, in over 47 countries and more than 28 000 employees. You will work with some of the leading world brands across the Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies – who are all relying on Dimension Data to help them use the power of technology to achieve their ambition in this digital era.You’ll be part of a team who’s passionate about making a difference to the way technology shapes how we live and work – whether it’s protecting the rhino, connecting the G20 Summit, or revolutionising cycling, giving you the opportunity to do great things.<p><br></p>You’ll be joining a Global Top Employer, recognised for investing in talent because people are at the heart of our success. You provide the skills, passion and ideas, and we’ll provide the platform to realise your ambitions.Great talent. Great teams. Great work. Great opportunities.<p><br></p><strong>Want to be part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Be Doing</strong><p><br></p>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.<p><br></p><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. </li><li>Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. </li><li>Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. </li><li>Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. </li><li>Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. </li><li>Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. </li><li>May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. </li><li>Included in higher complexity design work, with input to the design expected. </li><li>Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Good understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles</li><li>Demonstrates project management and administration ability</li><li>Good project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments</li><li>Demonstrate customer engagement skills</li><li>Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge</li><li>Good verbal communication skills</li><li>Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems</li><li>Ability to work under pressure</li><li>Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members</li><li>Good understanding of project management principles</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Academic Qualifications and Certifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent</li><li>Project management certification</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Solid work experience in a technical implementation engineering or similar role</li><li>Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations</li><li>Good project administration and documentation experience</li><li>Report writing experience</li><li>Basic project management</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What would make you a good fit for this role?</strong><p><br></p><strong>Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Equal opportunity employer </strong><p><br></p>We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.

title: UI Developer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Whiztek Corp, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design and develop software applications (apps) for mobile phones, Smartphones, tablets, and other mobile devices. </li><li> Manage full software development life cycle including testing, implementation, and auditing. </li><li> Perform product design, bug verification, and beta support which may require research and analysis. </li><li> Create, maintain and implement the source code to develop iOS mobile apps and programs that meet the needs and requirements of our business partner. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Primary Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support) </li><li> Produce fully functional mobile applications writing clean code </li><li> Gather specific requirements and suggest solutions </li><li> Write unit and UI tests to identify malfunctions </li><li> Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance </li><li> Design interfaces to improve user experiences </li><li> Liaise with the Product development team to plan new features </li><li> Ensure new and legacy applications meet quality &amp; data security standards </li><li> Research and suggest new mobile products, applications and protocols </li><li> Stay up-to-date with new technology trends </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven work experience as a Mobile developer </li><li> Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android market </li><li> In-depth knowledge of at least one programming language like Swift and Java </li><li> Experience with third-party libraries and APIs </li><li> Support monthly application production releases </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strong iOS developer </li><li> knowledge into AWS and Java </li><li> Accountability </li><li> Execution </li><li> Communication skills </li><li> Organization</li></ul>

title: Firmware Engineer II
description: <strong>ob TITLE: </strong>Systems Integration Developer<br><br><strong><u>Job DESCRIPTION<br><br></u></strong><strong>The Systems Integration Developer </strong>maintains, improves, and develops system integration solutions across internal applications, data repositories and third-party solutions.<strong> The System Integration Engineer will work closely with business and system analysts, IT leadership and third-party contacts to deliver and improve integration solutions for the organization.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job RESPONSIBILITIES<br></u></strong><ul><li>Lead integration projects. Manage, design, develop, improve, verify, and support data integration solutions associated with Syspro ERP and custom Data Warehouse. This includes third-party Logistics (3PL) systems, Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), Amazon vendor and seller central, third-party Point of Sales systems, and Master Data Management</li><li>Design, develop, and maintain VB.NET integration solutions and custom web pages to manage integration errors</li><li>Design, develop, and maintain Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) packages to extract, transform, and load data between systems </li><li>Understand data and process flows to investigate, track, manage, communicate, and improve data issues across systems</li><li>Ensure data integration security and code management best practices</li><li>Daily monitoring and error handling of all integration solutions to ensure successful completion </li><li>Implement and maintain batch schedules using Microsoft Power Automate and Visual Cron; provide after-hours support when needed<br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge, SKILLS, AND Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>SQL development, SSIS, and ETL experience required</li><li>Experience with VB.NET and .NET framework required </li><li>Experience with SOAP Web Services and RESTful APIs required</li><li>Knowledge of basic data constructs (XML, JSON)</li><li>Prior ERP experience preferred</li><li>Manufacturing and distribution industry experience preferred</li><li>Experiences with GIT and Azure DevOps source code management preferred</li><li>EDI integration experience a plus</li><li>Must be able to manage multiple work items at one time with a high sense of urgency.</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to collaborate and communicate well with team members and stakeholders </li><li>Must possess strong problem solving and organizational skills<br></li></ul><strong>EDUCATION:</strong> Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience<br><br><strong>EXPERIENCE:</strong> 5 - 10 years of custom integration development experience<br><br><strong>WORK LOCATION:</strong> Gurnee, Illinois (Hybrid/Remote Flexibility)<br><br><strong>Employment Status:</strong> Full Time<br><br><strong>Travel required:</strong> N/A
