title: Gupta Centura Windows Developer - Multiple Openings Direct Client
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>The MS Engineer (L1) is responsible for providing a managed service to clients to ensure that their IT infrastructure and systems remain operational through proactively identifying, investigating and resolving technical incidents and problems and to restore service to clients by managing incidents to resolution. Their primary objective is to ensure zero missed service level agreement conditions. The MS Engineer (L1) focuses on first line support for standard and low complexity incidents and service requests.<p><br></p>Radford reference:<p><br></p>"Performs IT functions such as design, analysis, evaluation, testing, debugging and implementation of applications programs supporting the company infrastructure business processes and operations and/or network-based (cloud) product systems. Analyzes, installs, acquires, modifies and supports operating systems, database or utilities software. Plans, conducts and directs the analysis of business problems with automated systems solutions. Analyzes, designs, acquires and implements projects for LAN and/or WAN systems. Plans, designs, acquires and implements telecommunications voice/wire systems. At higher job levels, may contribute to the development, testing, evaluation or design of system or infrastructure architecture used throughout the IT solution set."<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitors client infrastructure and solutions</li><li>Identify problems and errors prior to or when they occur</li><li>Routinely identify common incidents and opportunities for avoidance as well as general opportunities for incident reduction</li><li>Investigate first line incidents assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems</li><li>Fulfil approved requests following agreed procedures</li><li>Provide telephonic or chat support to clients when required</li><li>Execute approved maintenance activities including patching and configuration changes</li><li>Follow the required handover procedures for shift changes to ensure service continuity</li><li>Report and escalate incidents where necessary</li><li>Ensure the efficient and comprehensive resolutions of incidents and requests</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for work optimisation</li><li>Update existing knowledge articles or create new ones</li><li>Identify opportunities for work optimisation including opportunities for automation of work, request fulfilment, incident resolution and other general process improvement opportunities. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to communicate and work across different cultures and social groups</li><li>Ability to plans activities and projects well in advance, and takes into account possible changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work</li><li>Ability to work well in a pressurised environment</li><li>Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary</li><li>Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information and refraining from interrupting</li><li>Ability to adapt to changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to place client at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Academic Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Diploma, degree or relevant qualification in IT/Computing (or demonstrated equivalent work experience)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Advantageous certifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Up to date and relevant ITIL certification (Foundation Level)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Routing and Switching (CCNA-R/S)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Wireless (CCNA-WL)</li><li>Riverbed Certified Solutions Associate - WAN Optimization (RCSA-W)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Security (CCNA-SEC)</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Administrator (CCSA)</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Administrator NG with Application Intelligence (CCSA-NG AI)</li><li>VMware Certified Professional vSphere</li><li>IP, WINS, DHCP, DNC, etc</li><li>MS-Office, MS-Outlook, Symantec Backup Exec, Symantec EndPoint Protection, Symantec System Recovery, Citrix Go-To-Assist</li><li>MS-Active Directory</li><li>MS-Windows Server</li><li>MS-Windows XP Professional</li><li>MS-Windows Terminal Server</li><li>MS-Exchange Server</li><li>MS-SQL Server</li><li>MS-IIS Server</li><li>Citrix Metaframe</li><li>Switches and Routers</li><li>SonicWall Firewalls and SSL VPN Security Appliances</li><li>Cisco Firewalls and Routers</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Data Center (CCNA-DC)</li><li>MCSA+VCP, RHCE or equivalent</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Video (CCNA-VID)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Voice (CCNA-V)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Certifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Routing and Switching (CCNP-R/S)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Wireless (CCNP-W)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Security</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Expert (CCSE)</li><li>Certified Partner SE - Security</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Data Center (CCNP-DC)</li><li>Blue Coat Certified Proxy SG Professional</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Voice (CCNP-V)</li></ul><p><br></p>Any of the above certifications is a plus. The MS – Services Engineer (L1) is expected to gain certifications relevant to services supported. Certifications carry additional weight on candidate’s qualification for the role.<p><br></p><strong>Required Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Entry level experience or completion of relevant intern program</li><li>Entry level experience with troubleshooting and providing support required in network/ data centre/ systems/ storage administration and monitoring Services within a medium to large ICT organisation. </li><li>Working knowledge of management agent, redundancy concepts, and products within the supported technical domain (i.e. Network, Data Center, Telephony, Exchange, Storage, Cloud, Backup etc)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>
description_json: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>The MS Engineer (L1) is responsible for providing a managed service to clients to ensure that their IT infrastructure and systems remain operational through proactively identifying, investigating and resolving technical incidents and problems and to restore service to clients by managing incidents to resolution. Their primary objective is to ensure zero missed service level agreement conditions. The MS Engineer (L1) focuses on first line support for standard and low complexity incidents and service requests.<p><br></p>Radford reference:<p><br></p>"Performs IT functions such as design, analysis, evaluation, testing, debugging and implementation of applications programs supporting the company infrastructure business processes and operations and/or network-based (cloud) product systems. Analyzes, installs, acquires, modifies and supports operating systems, database or utilities software. Plans, conducts and directs the analysis of business problems with automated systems solutions. Analyzes, designs, acquires and implements projects for LAN and/or WAN systems. Plans, designs, acquires and implements telecommunications voice/wire systems. At higher job levels, may contribute to the development, testing, evaluation or design of system or infrastructure architecture used throughout the IT solution set."<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitors client infrastructure and solutions</li><li>Identify problems and errors prior to or when they occur</li><li>Routinely identify common incidents and opportunities for avoidance as well as general opportunities for incident reduction</li><li>Investigate first line incidents assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems</li><li>Fulfil approved requests following agreed procedures</li><li>Provide telephonic or chat support to clients when required</li><li>Execute approved maintenance activities including patching and configuration changes</li><li>Follow the required handover procedures for shift changes to ensure service continuity</li><li>Report and escalate incidents where necessary</li><li>Ensure the efficient and comprehensive resolutions of incidents and requests</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for work optimisation</li><li>Update existing knowledge articles or create new ones</li><li>Identify opportunities for work optimisation including opportunities for automation of work, request fulfilment, incident resolution and other general process improvement opportunities. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to communicate and work across different cultures and social groups</li><li>Ability to plans activities and projects well in advance, and takes into account possible changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work</li><li>Ability to work well in a pressurised environment</li><li>Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary</li><li>Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information and refraining from interrupting</li><li>Ability to adapt to changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to place client at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Academic Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Diploma, degree or relevant qualification in IT/Computing (or demonstrated equivalent work experience)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Advantageous certifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Up to date and relevant ITIL certification (Foundation Level)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Routing and Switching (CCNA-R/S)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Wireless (CCNA-WL)</li><li>Riverbed Certified Solutions Associate - WAN Optimization (RCSA-W)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Security (CCNA-SEC)</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Administrator (CCSA)</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Administrator NG with Application Intelligence (CCSA-NG AI)</li><li>VMware Certified Professional vSphere</li><li>IP, WINS, DHCP, DNC, etc</li><li>MS-Office, MS-Outlook, Symantec Backup Exec, Symantec EndPoint Protection, Symantec System Recovery, Citrix Go-To-Assist</li><li>MS-Active Directory</li><li>MS-Windows Server</li><li>MS-Windows XP Professional</li><li>MS-Windows Terminal Server</li><li>MS-Exchange Server</li><li>MS-SQL Server</li><li>MS-IIS Server</li><li>Citrix Metaframe</li><li>Switches and Routers</li><li>SonicWall Firewalls and SSL VPN Security Appliances</li><li>Cisco Firewalls and Routers</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Data Center (CCNA-DC)</li><li>MCSA+VCP, RHCE or equivalent</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Video (CCNA-VID)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Voice (CCNA-V)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Certifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Routing and Switching (CCNP-R/S)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Wireless (CCNP-W)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Security</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Expert (CCSE)</li><li>Certified Partner SE - Security</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Data Center (CCNP-DC)</li><li>Blue Coat Certified Proxy SG Professional</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Voice (CCNP-V)</li></ul><p><br></p>Any of the title: Systems Engineer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, GLOBAL VISSE INC, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>100% on- site role (3 days from client office in Chicago)<p><br></p><strong>Position: IBM BPM Developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL - Hybrid </strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: 6-12 Months</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 8 years of IT Experience with minimum of 5 years IBM BPM Development with certification.</li><li>At least 2 project implementation in IBM BPM 8.0 or above</li><li>Very good written verbal communication Can connect with Business Stakeholders understand the business</li><li>Primary Skills Must have Very good understanding of BPMN 2 0</li><li>Very good knowledge on Coach &amp; BPM UI (Spark UI) implementation</li><li>Good knowledge on REST API its implementation</li><li>Must have implemented Web services integration services controls the flow of process execution decision making and exception management across multiple organizational roles and systems applications</li><li>Tailors user screens for each process activity to enable end users to interact with multiple internal external systems through a single interface</li><li>Good database skills with excellent query writing skills</li><li>Can build the executable processes with limited requirement to showcase business</li><li>Knowledge on Content Management System &amp; its integration with IBM BPM.</li></ul><p><br></p>IBM BPM Developer at Chicago, IL - Hybrid

title: TS Implementation Engineer (L2)
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Synechron, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Position: Java Developer with Strong Google Cloud Platform experience</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL</strong><p><br></p><strong>Our Challenge:</strong> The role is aligned to the delivery team responsible for the planning, development, and delivery of Insurance products for the Benchmarks and Indices business.<p><br></p>This is a hands-on <strong>Java Developer with Strong Google Cloud Platform experience</strong> with focus on delivering results on-time, in-full to the expected quality levels.<p><br></p><strong>Overview: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The Client is migrating many of its applications from its on-premise data centers to the Google Cloud Platform (Google Cloud Platform). The applications will be primarily Java-based applications that will be running on containers managed by Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE). In addition, these applications have been configured or modified to utilize Google Cloud Platform services such as GCS buckets for file and object storage, Google Cloud Platform PubSub for messaging, Big Query for data warehouse capabilities, etc.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Description/Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The Client is seeking to fulfill the position of a senior Java developer responsible for supporting, enhancing, and developing Java-based applications on the Google Cloud Platform platform. The following will be the core responsibilities for this position:</li><li>Support the existing Java-based applications running on a GKE cluster on Google Cloud Platform</li><li>Work with the Client SDR team to implement new functionalities to the Java application on the Google Cloud Platform environment</li><li>Work with the Client quality assurance and other internal Client teams to test any enhancements made to the Java applications</li><li>Continually update documentations outlining the new development or enhancements made to the Java applications</li><li>Attend all required project meetings and provide status updates for all development activities</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience as a Java developer utilizing Java 8 or newer versions and the supporting platforms such as Eclipse, Springboot, code repository (i.e. BitBucket)</li><li>5+ years of experience with relational databases (Oracle, Postgres, mySQL)</li><li>5+ years of experience using build tools such as Maven.</li><li>3+ years of experience with CI/CD concepts and tools such as Jenkins.</li><li>4+ years of experience and understanding of cloud computing.</li><li>4+ years of experience and understanding of Docker for containerization and its underlying concepts.</li><li>3+ years of experience with cloud data warehouse such as Big Query.</li><li>3+ years of experience with cloud containerization technology such as GKE.</li><li>2+ years of experience in microservices development and REST-based architecture.</li><li>1+ years of experience with Argo for CI/CD and Workflow orchestration. Not a must have, but a nice to have.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>We Can Offer You:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A highly competitive compensation and benefits package</li><li>A multinational organization with offices in 17 global locations and the possibility to work abroad</li><li>Laptop and a mobile phone</li><li>15 days of paid annual leave</li><li>Maternity &amp; Paternity leave plans</li><li>A comprehensive insurance plan including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and long-/short-term disability</li><li>Retirement savings plans</li><li>A higher education certification policy</li><li>Commuter benefits</li><li>Extensive training opportunities, focused on skills, substantive knowledge, and personal development</li><li>On-demand Udemy for Business for all Synechron employees with free access to more than 5000 curated courses</li><li>Coaching opportunities with experienced colleagues from our FinLabs and Center of Excellences (CoE) groups</li><li>Cutting edge projects at the world’s leading tier-one banks, financial institutions and insurance firms</li><li>A flat and approachable organization</li><li>An excellent working atmosphere: regular drinks, sports activities, offsite weekends with a young, dynamic team</li><li>A truly diverse, fun-loving and global work culture</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>SYNECHRON’S DIVERSITY &amp; INCLUSION STATEMENT</strong><p><br></p>Diversity &amp; Inclusion are fundamental to our culture, and Synechron is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiative ‘Same Difference’ is committed to fostering an inclusive culture – promoting equality, diversity and an environment that is respectful to all. We strongly believe that a diverse workforce helps build stronger, successful businesses as a global company. We empower our global workforce by offering flexible workplace arrangements, mentoring, internal mobility, learning and development programs.<p><br></p>All employment decisions at Synechron are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to the applicant’s gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiative ‘Same Difference’ is committed to fostering an inclusive culture – promoting equality, diversity and an environment that is respectful to all. We strongly believe that a diverse workforce helps build stronger, successful businesses as a global company. We empower our global workforce by offering flexible workplace arrangements, mentoring, internal mobility, learning and development programs.<p><br></p>All employment decisions at Synechron are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to the applicant’s gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: iOS Developer
description: Must be local - Hybrid 2 times/month<p><br></p>Visa: GC/USC/GC-EAD/H4EAD/TN<p><br></p>Must have a valid LinkedIn profile<p><br></p><strong>This resource needs to fit the quality and high expectations . This client is very professional and polished.</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a Lead .NET Developer who is passionate about new technology and creating a seamless, customer-centric eCommerce experience. Our Lead .NET Developer will be responsible for driving improvements and new features of the eCommerce applications from a coding and configuration perspective. Our Lead Developer will have previous experience in .Net or C# technologies. Today, we use Sitecore and Sitecore eCommerce platforms. This role presents an exciting opportunity to learn Sitecore technology. Training and certification in Sitecore will be provided as part of the onboarding experience. Working within a scrum team, you will review objectives, work on code fixes and enhancements, and occasionally assist with the code releases. This role will engage in daily scrum meetings with the US and offshore teams to ensure all communication of objectives is clear and address any blocking issues.<p><br></p>Our Lead Developer will have excellent communication skills, and be able to document changes, features, and processes, and keep the documentation up-to-date. Regular code reviews will be a part of this role, keeping coding standards, and ensuring compliance with SOX, PCI, GDPR, and any other compliance requirements. The right candidate will have the ability to work with the team on the Continuous Integration process, improving the time-to-live for code, and the efficiency of Continuous Inspection, and testing.<p><br></p>This position is responsible for pushing business expectations further by joining a diverse team of collaborative individuals with one thing in mind; bridging the gap to customer empowerment. Our Solutions Team is seeking talent that will, not only, strategize and execute researched decisions, but also approach each task with determined interest. You'll have the opportunity to work with emerging technologies, from various mature customer, product, and ecommerce technologies to more upcoming machine learning and artificial intelligence applications.<p><br></p>This role will support our Power Efficiency Solution division's overall Digital Customer Experience (DCX) product portfolio with focus on Small-Medium customer growth, 80/20 initiatives to maximize growth on the best fit customers and most profitable products and will also be a key player driving implementation and coordination of digital efforts for profitable growth through enhanced digital customer experience.<p><br></p>As the Lead .NET Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining websites and applications built on the Sitecore XP Content Management System (CMS) and Sitecore ecommerce system (XC). You will work closely with clients and stakeholders to understand their requirements and use cases, and then translate them into functional website solutions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Responsibilities Include</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Building and customizing websites and applications using .NET programming languages (such as C#), Sitecore-specific APIs, and other web development tools.</li><li>Developing and implementing templates, components, layouts, and workflows to enable content creators to easily manage and publish web content.</li><li>Integrating with other systems and tools, such as CRMs, ERPs, marketing automation software, and social media platforms.</li><li>Collaborating with other developers, designers, and content creators to ensure that the website and application meet functional, design, and performance requirements.</li><li>Testing and debugging solutions to ensure high performance, security, and usability.</li><li>Providing technical support and maintenance for websites and applications, including troubleshooting and fixing issues as they arise.</li><li>Staying up-to-date with the latest Sitecore and web development trends, best practices, and technologies.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p>Specific technical skillsets include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Languages: .NET, C#</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Sitecore CMS Versions: 9.x, 10.x Hands-on experience with XC (Experience Commerce optimal)</li><li>Web Technologies: ASP.NET, ASP.NET MVC 5</li><li>Languages: T-SQL, Linq</li><li>Scripting Languages: Ajax, JavaScript, Knockout.js, JQuery, JSON, HTML, XML</li><li>Component Technologies: Web Services, SOAP, ADO.NET, WCF, WEB API, SOAP, REST</li><li>Databases (RDBMS): SQL 2016/2019</li><li>Version Control: GitHub Enterprise</li><li>ORM: Glass Mapper, Entity Framework</li></ul>

title: Lead .Net Developer with Sitecore
description: Job Overview:<p><br></p>We are looking for someone that works hard and is experienced to join our staff on 1st shift. Pay is entirely based on experience. In exchange for your hard work, we offer excellent benefits including medical/dental/vision, 401K with company match, paid holidays, vacation, flexible spending, and much more!<p><br></p>As a CNC Mill Programmer, you will write programs and modify existing ones for our Kitamura &amp; Hwacheon Mills in MasterCam (we will train for PowerMill). Our millss have Fanuc controls.<p><br></p>You'll need to be able to set up, operate and program a CNC Mill, know how to use machinist tools for measuring and indicating workpieces, be able to read and interpret blueprints, and have a mathematical aptitude.<p><br></p>Other qualifications include being able to use various hand tools, being able to work on your own without much supervision, being able to finish setup sheets, and possessing computer skills in order to transfer program files to the appropriate workstation.<p><br></p>We are looking for someone that is self-motivated, organized, and can work well with others as well as work well independently.<p><br></p>Overall, this is a great opportunity to join an organization that prides itself on offering great wages, great benefits, and excellent opportunities to grow professionally!<p><br></p>You should be proficient in:<p><br></p><ul><li>Tool/Die/Mold Repair Skills</li><li>Tool/Die/Mold Setup Experience</li><li>Troubleshooting CNC Machines</li><li>Shop Math Skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Machines &amp; technologies you'll use:<p><br></p><ul><li>CNC Mill (3-4 axis VMC) (Fanuc)<br><br></li></ul> ID:yUx7fb Ref #: 31309

title: Java Fullstack Developer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Motion Recruitment, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>A Ticketing company based is looking for a highly skilled Senior .Net Developer to join our team. As a Senior Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our client-facing web application. <strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4-6 years of experience building out client-facing web applications </li><li>Strong technical skills in Angular/TypeScript, .Net Core, and T-SQL or SQL </li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and microservices architecture </li><li>Understanding of software development principles, design patterns, and best practices </li><li>Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills </li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills </li><li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team </li><li>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field </li></ul> <strong>Desired Skills &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ticketing Experience </li></ul> <strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop and maintain client-facing web applications using Angular/TypeScript, .Net Core, and T-SQL or SQL </li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement new features and functionality </li><li>Write clean, maintainable, and testable code </li><li>Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving our development processes </li><li>Troubleshoot and debug issues in production and provide timely solutions </li><li>Mentor and guide junior team members </li></ul> Daily Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>80 Hands On </li><li>20% Team Collaboration </li></ul> <strong>The Offer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bonus </li></ul> You will receive the following benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical Insurance </li><li>Dental Benefits </li><li>Vision Benefits </li><li>Paid Time Off (PTO) </li></ul> Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.<p><br></p><ul><li>Net Software Engineer / Chicago</li></ul><p><br></p>

title: Xceptor Developer
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>The role is responsible for providing a professional third-line remote and onsite technical support and field engineering service to clients by proactively identifying and resolving technical incidents and problems. Through preemptive service incident and resolution activities, this role will restore service to clients by managing incidents and seeing them through to an effective resolution. Their primary objective is to ensure all requests, process events and resolution incidents result in zero missed SLA conditions. The role is responsible for managing incidents of high complexity.<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Stakeholder engagement</strong></strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Internal</strong></strong>: engage with GDC Service Operations team, receive instructions, and manage escalation incidents to Technical Account Manager, Client Delivery Executive or 3rd party vendors as necessary.<p><br></p><strong><strong>External</strong></strong>: proactively act as third-line remote and onsite technical support and provide field engineering services for clients (including the analysis, assignment and escalation thereof).<p><br></p><strong><strong>Value Chain Linkage</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Service Operations</li><li>Service Transition</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Skills and attributes</strong></strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Availability Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Analyses service and component availability, reliability, maintainability and serviceability. Ensures that services and components meet and continue to meet all of their agreed performance targets and service levels. Provides advice, assistance and leadership associated with the planning, design and improvement of service and component availability.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Service Level Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Monitor service delivery against service level agreements and maintains records of relevant information. Analyses service records against agreed service levels to identify actions required to maintain or improve levels of service. Ensures that service delivery meets agreed service levels.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Configuration Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Manages configuration items (CIs) and related information. Investigates and implements tools, techniques and processes for managing CIs and verifies that related information is complete, current and accurate. Maintains secure configuration, applying and maintaining tools, techniques and processes to identify, track, log and maintain accurate, complete and current information.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Capacity Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Monitors service component capacity and initiates actions to resolve any shortfalls according to agreed procedures. Applies techniques to control the demand upon a particular resource or service.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Support Services:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Maintains the support process and checks that all requests for support are dealt with according to agreed procedures. Uses service assurance software and tools to investigate and diagnose problems, collect performance statistics and create reports, working with users, other staff and suppliers as appropriate. Drafts and maintains procedures and documentation for support services. Ensure usage of knowledge articles in incident and problem diagnosis and resolution.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Incident Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Prioritises and diagnoses incidents according to agreed procedures. Investigates causes of incidents and seeks resolution. Escalates unresolved incidents. Facilitates recovery, following resolution of incidents through adoption of knowledge articles. Documents and closes resolved incidents according to agreed procedures.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Problem Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Initiates and monitors actions to investigate and resolve problems in systems, processes and services. Determines problem fixes/remedies. Assists with the implementation of agreed remedies and preventative measures.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Learning Design &amp; Development:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Designs, creates, develops, customises and maintains learning materials and resources to deliver agreed outcomes, and meet accreditation requirements if appropriate. Assists with design, configuration and testing of learning environments, including creation of simulated data, and replication of external systems, interfaces and assessment systems.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Technical Specialism:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Maintains an in-depth knowledge of specific specialisms, and provides expert advice regarding their application.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Programming Skills:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Python, XML, REST API Programming<p><br></p><strong><strong>Work Outputs</strong></strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Ensure resolution of incidents and requests:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Act as the escalation contact for L2 Field Engineer and cross team escalations (network, F5, server etc). Investigate assigned support calls and identify the root cause of incidents and problems. Ensure the efficient and comprehensive resolution of incidents and requests. Attend to user satisfaction related escalations to ensure satisfactory closure. Report and escalate issues to 3rd party vendors if necessary. Take full ownership for managing the incident to resolution within the service level conditions.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Improve quality:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Conduct monthly random review of incidents and service requests, analysing and providing inputs for improvements in quality.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Knowledge Management Practices:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Constantly create and update knowledge base to improve productivity and self-service within the engineering team. Optimize knowledge articles for clients through gap analysis.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Ensure continuous feedback:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Provide continuous feedback to clients / affected parties and update all systems and/or portals as prescribed by Dimension Data procedures.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Incident management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Update incidents with progress and resolution details.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Shift management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>L3 Field Engineers that work shifts will be required to follow the required handover procedures for shift changes to ensure service continuity. Complete and maintain any shift handover schedules.<p><br></p><ul><li>Plan and execute firmware upgrades, server builds and other operational activities</li><li>Actively participate in projects</li><li>Check and resolve security reported events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Next career steps</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Technical Account Manager</li><li>Service Operations Manager</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Education required</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree or relevant qualification in IT/Computing</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Certifications required</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>ITIL v3 Foundation</li><li>Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert - Routing and Switching (CCIE-R/S)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Wireless (CCNP-W)</li><li>Juniper Networks Certified Support Professional - Enterprise Routing and Switching (JNCSP-ENT)</li><li>JNCIA Security</li><li>Certified Partner SE - WAN Optimization</li><li>Riverbed Certified Solutions Professional - WAN Optimization (RCSP-W)</li><li>F5 Certified Technology Specialist Local Traffic Management (F5-CTS-LTM)</li><li>301a LTM Specialist Architect Setup and Deploy Security domain</li><li>Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert - description_json: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>The role is responsible for providing a professional third-line remote and onsite technical support and field engineering service to clients by proactively identifying and resolving technical incidents and problems. Through preemptive service incident and resolution activities, this role will restore service to clients by managing incidents and seeing them through to an effective resolution. Their primary objective is to ensure all requests, process events and resolution incidents result in zero missed SLA conditions. The role is responsible for managing incidents of high complexity.<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Stakeholder engagement</strong></strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Internal</strong></strong>: engage with GDC Service Operations team, receive instructions, and manage escalation incidents to Technical Account Manager, Client Delivery Executive or 3rd party vendors as necessary.<p><br></p><strong><strong>External</strong></strong>: proactively act as third-line remote and onsite technical support and provide field engineering services for clients (including the analysis, assignment and escalation thereof).<p><br></p><strong><strong>Value Chain Linkage</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Service Operations</li><li>Service Transition</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Skills and attributes</strong></strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Availability Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Analyses service and component availability, reliability, maintainability and serviceability. Ensures that services and components meet and continue to meet all of their agreed performance targets and service levels. Provides advice, assistance and leadership associated with the planning, design and improvement of service and component availability.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Service Level Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Monitor service delivery against service level agreements and maintains records of relevant information. Analyses service records against agreed service levels to identify actions required to maintain or improve levels of service. Ensures that service delivery meets agreed service levels.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Configuration Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Manages configuration items (CIs) and related information. Investigates and implements tools, techniques and processes for managing CIs and verifies that related information is complete, current and accurate. Maintains secure configuration, applying and maintaining tools, techniques and processes to identify, track, log and maintain accurate, complete and current information.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Capacity Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Monitors service component capacity and initiates actions to resolve any shortfalls according to agreed procedures. Applies techniques to control the demand upon a particular resource or service.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Support Services:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Maintains the support process and checks that all requests for support are dealt with according to agreed procedures. Uses service assurance software and tools to investigate and diagnose problems, collect performance statistics and create reports, working with users, other staff and suppliers as appropriate. Drafts and maintains procedures and documentation for support services. Ensure usage of knowledge articles in incident and problem diagnosis and resolution.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Incident Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Prioritises and diagnoses incidents according to agreed procedures. Investigates causes of incidents and seeks resolution. Escalates unresolved incidents. Facilitates recovery, following resolution of incidents through adoption of knowledge articles. Documents and closes resolved incidents according to agreed procedures.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Problem Management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Initiates and monitors actions to investigate and resolve problems in systems, processes and services. Determines problem fixes/remedies. Assists with the implementation of agreed remedies and preventative measures.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Learning Design &amp; Development:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Designs, creates, develops, customises and maintains learning materials and resources to deliver agreed outcomes, and meet accreditation requirements if appropriate. Assists with design, configuration and testing of learning environments, including creation of simulated data, and replication of external systems, interfaces and assessment systems.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Technical Specialism:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Maintains an in-depth knowledge of specific specialisms, and provides expert advice regarding their application.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Programming Skills:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Python, XML, REST API Programming<p><br></p><strong><strong>Work Outputs</strong></strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Ensure resolution of incidents and requests:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Act as the escalation contact for L2 Field Engineer and cross team escalations (network, F5, server etc). Investigate assigned support calls and identify the root cause of incidents and problems. Ensure the efficient and comprehensive resolution of incidents and requests. Attend to user satisfaction related escalations to ensure satisfactory closure. Report and escalate issues to 3rd party vendors if necessary. Take full ownership for managing the incident to resolution within the service level conditions.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Improve quality:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Conduct monthly random review of incidents and service requests, analysing and providing inputs for improvements in quality.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Knowledge Management Practices:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Constantly create and update knowledge base to improve productivity and self-service within the engineering team. Optimize knowledge articles for clients through gap analysis.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Ensure continuous feedback:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Provide continuous feedback to clients / affected parties and update all systems and/or portals as prescribed by Dimension Data procedures.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Incident management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>Update incidents with progress and resolution details.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Shift management:</strong></strong><p><br></p>L3 Field Engineers that work shifts will be required to follow the required handover procedures for shift changes to ensure service continuity. Complete and maintain any shift handover schedules.<p><br></p><ul><li>Plan and execute firmware upgrades, server builds and other operational activities</li><li>Actively participate in projects</li><li>Check and resolve security reported events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Next career steps</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Technical Account Manager</li><li>Service Operations Manager</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Education required</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree or relevant qualification in IT/Computing</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Certifications required</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>ITIL v3 Foundation</li><li>Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert - title: CNC Mill Programmer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, ComPsych, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>About ComPsych</strong><p><br></p>ComPsych ® Corporation is the world’s largest provider of employee assistance programs (EAP) and is the pioneer and worldwide leader of fully integrated EAP, behavioral health, wellness, work-life, HR, FMLA and absence management services under its GuidanceResources ® brand. ComPsych provides services to more than <strong>68,000</strong> organizations covering more than <strong>139 million</strong> individuals throughout the U.S. and 190 countries. By creating “Build-to-Suit” programs, ComPsych helps employers attract and retain employees, increase employee productivity and improve overall health and well-being.<p><br></p><strong>Overview</strong><p><br></p>As a member of the level 3 engineering team, you will be one of the highest technical escalation points, leading various infrastructure efforts, managing projects across members of various teams, and identifying, designing, and deploying new solutions. This is a highly focused Virtualization Engineering role and requires someone with deep technical knowledge of virtualization technologies.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Supports the ongoing maintenance, both proactive and reactive, of our VMware environment.</li><li>Supports our Storage Area Network and Network Attached Storage solutions across multiple sites.</li><li>Performs regular software patching across the VMware solution environment.</li><li>Performs capacity planning and manages the hardware and software lifecycle of the VMware environment.</li><li>Maintains and provisions the VMware Horizon VDI environment.</li><li>Works with the network team to ensure that the NSX solution conforms to best practices.</li><li>Works with the security team to ensure that patches, firewall policies, host settings, and isolation policies meet our business security requirements.</li><li>Collaborates with consumers of the virtualization platform, including Windows, Linux, and app-dev teams to ensure the performance required is delivered.</li><li>Acts as a technical lead, project manager, and level 3 engineer, seeing projects from inception to completion while adhering to BC/DR best practices.</li><li>Identifies automation opportunities and implements accordingly.</li><li>Builds extensive documentation both for new and existing solutions.</li><li>Identifies new solutions and/or designs to improve/streamline the environment and/or which provide direct benefits to the business.</li><li>Other duties as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience and proficiency with VMware vSphere 6.x-7.x.</li><li>Experience and proficiency with vRealize Suite products (vROPS, vRLI, etc).</li><li>Experience and proficiency with VMware NSX-T 3.x.</li><li>Experience and proficiency with HPE Servers and HPE OneView.</li><li>Experience with VMware Horizon 7.x-8.x.</li><li>Experience with VMware Site Recovery Manager 8.x</li><li>Experience with Veeam Backup &amp; Replication 9.x-11.x.</li><li>Proficiency in PowerCLI and/or other scripting languages.</li><li>Strong troubleshooting skills.</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical audiences.</li><li>Project Management skills and capable of leading meetings.</li><li>5 or more years supporting VMware environments.</li><li>Proficiency with core networking concepts and ability to troubleshoot network connectivity issues.</li><li>Flexibility to work after-hours as needed and to be a part of an on-call rotation.</li><li>Must be able to work on-site when needed at our Chicago office and/or regional datacenters.</li><li>Willingness to take on additional duties as needed.</li><li>Powershell experience is a plus.</li><li>VCP (or higher) preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits And Perks</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Full benefits package, including Paid Time Off (PTO), medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with match, robust EAP, wellness program, and much more</li><li>Competitive pay with bonus program and annual increases</li><li>EOE/AA/M/F/Vet/Disability</li></ul><p><br></p>ComPsych Corporation maintains a drug-free workplace. Sr. Virtualization Engineer
